Title: Sheet Pan Ratatouille
Ingredients: ['1 large eggplant, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', '2 zucchinis, cut into 1/2-inch slices', '2 heirloom tomatoes, cut in wedges', '1 white onion, cut into 1/2-inch-thick rounds', '1 red bell pepper, cut into 1/2-inch strips', '4 cloves garlic', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh rosemary', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
', 'Step 3: Place eggplant, zucchinis, tomatoes, onion, bell pepper, and garlic in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Drizzle with olive oil, rosemary, salt, and pepper; toss vegetables until well coated.
', 'Step 5: Roast in the preheated oven until slightly tender; about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Mix and roast for another 12 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) and cook until vegetables begin to caramelize; about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Drizzle with balsamic vinegar.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '163.9 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '23.6 g', 'fatContent': '7.6 g', 'fiberContent': '9.1 g', 'proteinContent': '4.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '599.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '11.1 g'}

Title: Easy and Delicious Slow Cooker Cassoulet
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '6 slices turkey bacon', '1 large onion, finely chopped', '4 boneless, skinless chicken thighs, chopped', '¼ pound fully-cooked smoked sausage, diced', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon dried thyme leaves', '2 bay leaves', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ cup tomato paste', '3 (15 ounce) cans great Northern beans, drained and rinsed', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes, drained', '3 tablespoons minced fresh parsley']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat and cook bacon until crisp and brown, turning often, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Remove bacon and drain on paper towels; crumble when cool.
', 'Step 3: Set bacon aside.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir onion in the same skillet until translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir in chicken, sausage, garlic, thyme, bay leaves, and black pepper; cook until chicken pieces are browned, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir in tomato paste.
', 'Step 7: Transfer chicken mixture to a slow cooker and stir in crumbled turkey bacon, great Northern beans, and diced tomatoes.
', 'Step 8: Cover the cooker, set on Low, and cook until cassoulet is thickened and the chicken is very tender, 4 to 5 hours.
', 'Step 9: Sprinkle with parsley before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '521.9 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '52.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '68.4 mg', 'fatContent': '18.9 g', 'fiberContent': '12.1 g', 'proteinContent': '35.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '5.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '641.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.7 g'}

Title: Duck Rillettes
Ingredients: ['1 ½ tablespoons kosher salt', '2 teaspoons ground black pepper, or more to taste', '2 teaspoons dried thyme', '12 cloves garlic', '6 (1/4 inch thick) slices fresh ginger', '1 orange, zest cut into thin strips', '1 bunch fresh thyme, plus more for garnish', '3 bay leaves', '1 whole duck', '2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', '1 tablespoon brandy (such as Armagnac)', '2 teaspoons chopped fresh parsley', '1 teaspoon chopped fresh chives', '½ teaspoon Dijon mustard', '1 pinch cayenne pepper', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '½ teaspoon grated orange zest']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a 9x13 baking dish with 2 pieces of aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Stir kosher salt, 2 teaspoons black pepper, and dried thyme together in a bowl.
', 'Step 4: Mix garlic, ginger, orange zest strips, fresh thyme, and bay leaves together in another bowl.
', 'Step 5: Season duck all over, inside and out, with about 2/3 of the kosher salt mixture.
', 'Step 6: Fill duck cavity with garlic mixture.
', 'Step 7: Place duck, breast-side up, into prepared baking dish and season with remaining salt mixture.
', 'Step 8: Wrap duck tightly in aluminum foil.
', 'Step 9: Roast in the preheated oven until meat pulls away from the bones, 5 to 6 hours.
', 'Step 10: Cool duck with its accumulated juices, wrapped in aluminum foil, to room temperature.
', 'Step 11: Chill in the refrigerator for 12 hours or overnight.
', 'Step 12: Pick meat from bones and place in a bowl.
', 'Step 13: Spoon all accumulated juices in the foil into a saucepan and place over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 14: Cook until hot throughout; strain through a fine-mesh strainer into a bowl.
', 'Step 15: Let fat and stock separate; transfer fat from the top to another bowl.
', 'Step 16: Mash duck meat, 3 tablespoons duck fat, 2 tablespoons duck stock, butter, brandy, parsley, chives, Dijon mustard, cayenne pepper, salt, and ground black pepper together in a bowl with a wooden spoon; transfer to a sealable container, press down, and drizzle a little duck fat over the top.
', 'Step 17: Sprinkle thyme leaves, black pepper, and orange zest over the top.
', 'Step 18: Seal the container and refrigerate for the flavors to blend, 1 to 3 days.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '460.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '9.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '83.7 mg', 'fatContent': '40.9 g', 'fiberContent': '2.7 g', 'proteinContent': '11.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '16 g', 'sodiumContent': '3011.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '0.2 g'}

Title: Chicken Divan Casserole
Ingredients: ['2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '4 cups broccoli florets, or to taste', '3 tablespoons butter', '1 small onion, chopped', '1 ½ teaspoons minced garlic', '½ teaspoon garlic salt', '⅛ teaspoon dried parsley', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '3 cups cauliflower florets', '1 cup chicken broth', '1 cup heavy whipping cream', '1 teaspoon lemon juice', '½ cup mayonnaise', '2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chicken breasts into a large pot and cover with water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a breast should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: Remove chicken from the water.
', 'Step 5: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer.
', 'Step 6: Bring water to a boil.
', 'Step 7: Add broccoli, cover, and steam until tender, 3 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Chop broccoli.
', 'Step 9: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 10: Melt butter in a deep saucepan over low heat.
', 'Step 11: Add onion and garlic; cook and stir until onion is clear and tender, 8 to 12 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Add garlic salt, parsley, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 13: Pulse cauliflower in a blender or food processor until it resembles rice.
', 'Step 14: Add cauliflower and chicken broth to the onion mixture; cook and stir until broth is nicely absorbed, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Add heavy cream and lemon juice.
', 'Step 16: Let simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until well combined, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Stir in mayonnaise and remove from heat.
', 'Step 18: Let sauce cool until thickened.
', 'Step 19: Pull chicken apart with 2 forks into bite-size pieces.
', 'Step 20: Add 1/2 the pulled chicken to the sauce.
', 'Step 21: Line the bottom of a casserole dish with the rest of the pulled chicken.
', 'Step 22: Lay steamed broccoli on top; pour the cauliflower sauce over the broccoli.
', 'Step 23: Top with Cheddar cheese.
', 'Step 24: Cover with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 25: Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 26: Remove foil and bake until cheese at the edges is slightly browned, about 10 minutes more.
', 'Step 27: Let casserole cool for 5 to 10 minutes; slice into 6 even portions.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '417.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '7.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '104.6 mg', 'fatContent': '36.6 g', 'fiberContent': '2.2 g', 'proteinContent': '16.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '17.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '614.5 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.5 g'}

Title: Bordeaux Caneles
Ingredients: ['4 ¼ cups whole milk', '3 vanilla bean pods, split lengthwise', '4 eggs', '4 egg yolks', "1 (16 ounce) package confectioners' sugar", '7 ounces all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons dark rum', '3 ½ ounces butter, softened']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine milk and vanilla beans in a saucepan; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Remove from heat and let cool to lukewarm, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Beat eggs and egg yolks together in a large bowl.
', "Step 4: Gently stir in confectioners' sugar, flour, and rum.
", 'Step 5: Pour in warm milk mixture, discarding vanilla beans; gently stir until smooth.
', 'Step 6: Cover bowl with plastic wrap and let batter rest in the refrigerator for 24 hours.
', 'Step 7: Coat fluted molds with butter and freeze until coating is set, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 9: Remove batter from the refrigerator, uncover, and pour into molds, filling each about 3/4 full.
', 'Step 10: Bake in the preheated oven until deep brown in color, about 50 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Remove from oven and immediately invert each canele on a wire rack to cool, 30 minutes to 1 hour.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '178.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '27.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '75.1 mg', 'fatContent': '6.1 g', 'fiberContent': '0.2 g', 'proteinContent': '3.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '3.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '52 mg', 'sugarContent': '21.2 g'}

Title: Choco-Coco Cupcakes
Ingredients: ['2 ⅓ cups all-purpose flour', '1 ½ tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 ½ cups white sugar', '1 ½ tablespoons white sugar', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 cup vegetable oil', '3 eggs, beaten', '⅓ cup coconut milk', '1 ⅓ cups dried shredded coconut', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '6 ¼ ounces 85% dark chocolate, chopped', '1 cup heavy whipping cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a muffin tin with paper liners.
', 'Step 3: Combine 2 1/3 cups plus 1 1/2 tablespoon flour, 1 1/2 cup plus 1 1/2 tablespoon white sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl.
', 'Step 4: Mix vegetable oil, eggs, and coconut milk together in another bowl.
', 'Step 5: Pour over flour mixture; stir well to combine.
', 'Step 6: Fold shredded coconut and vanilla extract into batter.
', 'Step 7: Spoon batter into prepared muffin tin, filling each liner 2/3 of the way.
', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove from oven and transfer to a wire rack until cooled completely.
', 'Step 10: Place chopped chocolate in a bowl.
', 'Step 11: Heat cream in a small saucepan over medium heat until edges are bubbling, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Pour over chocolate in the bowl.
', 'Step 13: Mix until ganache is smooth and shiny.
', 'Step 14: Chill until firm, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 15: Remove ganache from the refrigerator.
', 'Step 16: Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed until fluffy and slightly lightened in color, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Transfer to a piping bag fitted with a round tip.
', 'Step 18: Frost cooled cupcakes with whipped ganache.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '301 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '29 g', 'cholesterolContent': '37.2 mg', 'fatContent': '19.9 g', 'fiberContent': '1.7 g', 'proteinContent': '3.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '132.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '17.3 g'}

Title: Deconstructed French Onion Soup Tartlet
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 large white onion, sliced', '1 clove garlic, minced', '¼ cup white wine', '½ cup beef broth', '1 teaspoon dried thyme', '½ teaspoon kosher salt (such as Diamond Crystal®)', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 sheet puff pastry', '½ cup grated Parmesan cheese', '1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat olive oil and butter together in a skillet over medium-high heat until the butter is melted, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Saute onion and garlic in the hot oil mixture until the onion begins to caramelize, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Pour white wine over the onion mixture; bring to a simmer and cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add beef broth and thyme; cook until the liquid reduces in volume by half.
', 'Step 6: Season the mixture with kosher salt and black pepper.
', 'Step 7: Trim puff pastry and fit into a tart pan.
', 'Step 8: Score a rim along the edge of the pastry.
', 'Step 9: Puncture the center of the pastry with a fork.
', 'Step 10: Spread the onion mixture over the pastry; top with Parmesan cheese and mozzarella cheese.
', 'Step 11: Bake in preheated oven until the crust is golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '589.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '32.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '42.1 mg', 'fatContent': '43 g', 'fiberContent': '1.7 g', 'proteinContent': '16 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '15 g', 'sodiumContent': '860.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.6 g'}

Title: Poached Pears (Poires Pochees)
Ingredients: ['2 cups water', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '4 pears', '2 cups red wine', '2 cups white sugar', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 star anise']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring water to a boil in a saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Add lemon juice and pears and let sit for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove pears from the hot water 1 at a time and carefully peel, leaving stem intact.
', 'Step 4: Combine wine, sugar, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and star anise in a medium-sized saucepan and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat to a simmer.
', 'Step 6: Rinse pears and add to the boiling wine mixture.
', 'Step 7: Use a plate on top of pears to keep them submerged.
', 'Step 8: Simmer until a knife very easily pierces the pears, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove saucepan from heat and allow pears to cool in the wine mixture.
', 'Step 10: Serve pears in a bowl, either whole or sliced and cored.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '589.9 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '130 g', 'fatContent': '0.2 g', 'fiberContent': '5.5 g', 'proteinContent': '0.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '10.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '117.2 g'}

Title: French Molten Chocolate Cake
Ingredients: ['5 tablespoons butter', '1 (3.5 ounce) package dark chocolate, chopped', '2 each eggs', '1 egg yolk', '3 tablespoons white sugar', '3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons unsweetened cocoa powder', '1 pinch salt', '1 tablespoon powdered sugar, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place butter and chocolate in the top of a double boiler over simmering water.
', 'Step 2: Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Meanwhile, combine eggs and egg yolk in a bowl.
', 'Step 4: Add sugar and whisk until mixture is light yellow in color and sugar is dissolved, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Pour some of the warm chocolate mixture into the egg mixture, whisking quickly to avoid scrambling the eggs.
', 'Step 6: Add remaining chocolate and whisk until combined and smooth.
', 'Step 7: Sift in flour, cocoa powder, and salt; fold in with a spatula until combined.
', 'Step 8: Butter four 5-ounce ramekins and dust with cocoa powder.
', 'Step 9: Spoon batter into the prepared ramekins, tapping gently to settle any air bubbles.
', 'Step 10: Place in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 12: Place ramekins in a baking dish and bake until edges start to pull away from the sides, 13 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Remove from the oven and dust with powdered sugar.
', 'Step 14: Serve warm.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '370.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '31.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '172.5 mg', 'fatContent': '25.9 g', 'fiberContent': '2.1 g', 'proteinContent': '5.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '11.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '175.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '23.2 g'}

Title: Magrets de Canard aux Pommes (Duck Breasts with Calvados Apple Sauce)
Ingredients: ['4 duck breast halves', '1 ½ tablespoons butter', '4 firm apples, sliced', '1 cup Calvados (apple brandy)']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place duck breasts skin-side down in a nonstick skillet over high heat; cook for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to low; cook until golden brown, about 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 3: Melt butter in a separate skillet over high heat.
', 'Step 4: Add apples; cook and stir until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat to low; cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove skillet from heat; pour in Calvados.
', 'Step 7: Cook and stir over low heat, scraping up browned bits from the bottom of the skillet, until alcohol evaporates, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 8: Serve duck breasts with Calvados sauce.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '403.4 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '23 g', 'cholesterolContent': '117.2 mg', 'fatContent': '13 g', 'fiberContent': '3.3 g', 'proteinContent': '19.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '5 g', 'sodiumContent': '97.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '18.3 g'}

Title: Tarte Tatin with Rosemary
Ingredients: ['½ cup white sugar', '3 tablespoons unsalted butter', '1 sprig fresh rosemary, chopped', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '6 Granny Smith apples - peeled, cored, and thickly sliced', '1 sheet frozen puff pastry, thawed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat a 10-inch cast iron frying pan over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Melt sugar, butter, rosemary, and cinnamon together in the hot pan, stirring constantly, until syrup is a rich caramel color, about 8 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 5: Add apple slices, arranging them in a decorative swirl starting from the outside edges of the pan, rounded sides-down, as tart will be turned upside-down when served.
', 'Step 6: Simmer, uncovered, until apples are slightly tender yet firm, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Shake the pan occasionally to prevent scorching.
', 'Step 8: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 9: Trim corners of puff pastry to form a 10-inch circle.
', 'Step 10: Place pastry over apples and push down between apples and the edge of the pan using the tip of a knife.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until pastry is golden and puffed, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Remove from the oven and let cool for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Loosen the edges of the tart from the pan using a knife.
', 'Step 14: Invert a serving plate over the pan and then, holding the pan and plate together firmly, invert them together.
', 'Step 15: Lift off the pan.
', 'Step 16: Cut tart into wedges and serve warm or at room temperature.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '298.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '39.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '11.4 mg', 'fatContent': '15.8 g', 'fiberContent': '2.5 g', 'proteinContent': '2.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '5.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '76.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '23.4 g'}

Title: Pistachio-Chocolate Friands
Ingredients: ['10 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more for greasing', '¾ cup almond flour', '2 tablespoons almond flour', '¾ cup all-purpose flour', "1 cup confectioners' sugar", "2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar", '¾ cup demerara sugar', '¼ cup unsweetened cocoa powder', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '5 large egg whites', '⅓ cup chopped pistachios, or more to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 320 degrees F (160 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease 12 small cake moulds well with butter.
', 'Step 3: Melt 10 tablespoons butter in a saucepan until it becomes golden over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat and let cool.
', "Step 5: Combine almond flour, all-purpose flour, confectioners' sugar, demerara sugar, cocoa powder, and baking powder in a bowl; stir together until well combined.
", 'Step 6: Add unwhipped egg whites and mix until well combined.
', 'Step 7: Add melted butter and pistachios.
', 'Step 8: Pour batter into the prepared moulds.
', 'Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the friands comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Bon appetit!
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '259.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '25.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '25.4 mg', 'fatContent': '16 g', 'fiberContent': '2.1 g', 'proteinContent': '5.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '6.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '60.3 mg', 'sugarContent': '16.4 g'}

Title: Artichoke and Escargot Over Linguini
Ingredients: ['1 (8 ounce) package linguine pasta', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 (10 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and sliced', '1 (4 ounce) can sliced mushrooms, drained', '1 (7 ounce) can escargot, drained', '3 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 teaspoon dried sage', '1 pinch dried oregano', '¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Add the linguine, and cook until tender, about 8 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Melt half of the butter in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Add the mushrooms and artichokes; cook and stir for a few minutes.
', 'Step 5: When the mushrooms start to brown, stir in the garlic, and cook until fragrant and lightly browned.
', 'Step 6: Stir in the escargot, and season with sage and oregano.
', 'Step 7: Cook for just a few minutes, as the escargot cooks really fast like shrimp.
', 'Step 8: Add about half of the Parmesan cheese, and remove from the heat.
', 'Step 9: Serve over linguine with remaining Parmesan cheese.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '464.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '58.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '85.2 mg', 'fatContent': '9.4 g', 'fiberContent': '5.3 g', 'proteinContent': '36.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '5.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '865.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '6.4 g'}

Title: Poulet a la Grecque
Ingredients: ['½ cup all-purpose flour for coating', '1 pinch salt and pepper', '1 ½ pounds bone-in chicken parts', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 shallots, chopped', '1 onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '3 medium fresh tomatoes, chopped', '2 cups white wine', '2 pinches saffron threads', '½ teaspoon curry powder', '1 teaspoon white sugar', '¾ cup raisins', 'salt and black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Season flour with salt and pepper; coat chicken pieces with seasoned flour.
', 'Step 2: Heat butter and olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Place chicken pieces in skillet; cook, turning once, to brown on both sides, about 6 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Stir in shallots, onions, and garlic; cook until soft, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir in tomatoes and wine; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 6: Then stir in saffron, curry powder, sugar, raisins, and salt and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Cover, and cook over medium heat for 12 to 15 minutes.
']

Title: Stuffed Chicken Parmesan Sub
Ingredients: ['2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '2 cups Italian-style salad dressing', '2 cups all-purpose flour', '1 tablespoon baking powder', '1 ½ cups milk', '1 egg', '3 cups Italian-seasoned bread crumbs', '2 tablespoons butter, divided, or as needed', '10 slices prosciutto, chopped into chunks', '4 cups marinara sauce', 'canola oil as needed', '1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, or more to taste', '4 Italian sub rolls', '8 slices provolone cheese', '1 cup grated Parmesan cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Slice each chicken breast down the center to make 4 cutlets.
', 'Step 2: Place each between 2 pieces of plastic wrap and pound to about 1/2 inch thinness with a meat mallet.
', 'Step 3: Marinate chicken breasts in Italian dressing in the refrigerator overnight.
', 'Step 4: Remove chicken to bring to room temperature 1 hour before cooking.
', 'Step 5: Combine flour and baking powder in one bowl, milk and egg in another bowl, and bread crumbs in a third bowl.
', 'Step 6: Set aside.
', 'Step 7: Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a pan over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Cook prosciutto in the hot butter until it starts to brown, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.
', 'Step 10: Bring marinara sauce to a simmer in a saucepan.
', 'Step 11: Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 12: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 13: Lay chicken cutlets out flat.
', 'Step 14: Line 1/4 of mozzarella cheese down the center of each and sprinkle 1/4 of prosciutto over cheese.
', 'Step 15: Fold cutlets in half over the stuffing and secure edges together with toothpicks.
', 'Step 16: Dunk rolled chicken into the flour mixture, then egg mixture, and finally bread crumbs.
', 'Step 17: Drop chicken into the preheated fryer and cook until crumbs are golden brown, chicken floats, and is no longer pink in the center, 6 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to let grease run off.
', 'Step 19: Cut sub rolls down the centers and spread remaining butter into interiors.
', 'Step 20: Assemble sandwiches in the following manner: bottom sub half, chicken cutlet, marinara, provolone cheese, Parmesan cheese, and top sub half.
', 'Step 21: Transfer subs to a baking pan.
', 'Step 22: Toast in the preheated oven until bread is crisp and cheeses are melted, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 23: Serve hot.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '1103.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '109.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '106 mg', 'fatContent': '54 g', 'fiberContent': '7.1 g', 'proteinContent': '43.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '17.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '3562.9 mg', 'sugarContent': '20.4 g'}

Title: John's Flammekueche
Ingredients: ['18 ounces refrigerated French bread dough', '1 tablespoon olive oil, or as needed', '1 medium potato, thinly sliced', '3 slices smoked bacon', '¼ cup butter', '½ cup chopped onion', '¾ cup light cream', '1 pinch ground nutmeg', 'salt and pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Roll out the bread dough into a rectangle, and spread out on a baking sheet greased with olive oil.
', 'Step 3: Set aside.
', 'Step 4: Place potato slices in a saucepan with enough water to cover.
', 'Step 5: Bring to a boil, and cook for about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add bacon slices to the water, and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Drain.
', 'Step 8: Remove bacon, then dice.
', 'Step 9: While the potatoes and bacon cook, melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 10: Add the onion, and cook, stirring until tender.
', 'Step 11: Remove from heat and stir in cream; season with salt, pepper and nutmeg.
', 'Step 12: Spread the onion mixture over the bread dough.
', 'Step 13: Arrange potato slices evenly, and sprinkle with bacon.
', 'Step 14: Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, until crust is golden on the bottom.
', 'Step 15: Let stand for a few minutes before slicing.
']

Title: Croque Madame on Brioche
Ingredients: ['4 tablespoons salted butter, divided', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', '1 cup whole milk', '2 teaspoons Dijon mustard', '⅛ teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 teaspoons white vinegar', '2 large eggs', '2 (1 inch) thick slices brioche bread', '2 slices deli ham', '2 slices Gruyere cheese', '1 teaspoon chopped fresh chives, or to taste', '¼ teaspoon smoked paprika', '2 slices plum tomato']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a small saucepan over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 2: Whisk in flour and cook for 1 minute.
', 'Step 3: Whisk in milk and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 5: Season with Dijon, nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 6: Cook until sauce coats the back of a spoon, about 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove sauce from the heat.
', 'Step 8: Fill a large saucepan with 2 to 3 inches of water and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 9: Reduce the heat to medium-low, pour in vinegar, and keep the water at a gentle simmer.
', 'Step 10: Crack an egg into a small bowl then gently slip egg into the simmering water, holding the bowl just above the surface of water.
', 'Step 11: Repeat with the remaining egg.
', 'Step 12: Cook eggs until the whites are firm and the yolks have thickened but are not hard, 2 1/2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Remove the eggs from the water with a slotted spoon, dab on a kitchen towel to remove excess water, and place onto a warm plate.
', 'Step 14: Melt remaining butter in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 15: Add bread and toast in melted butter on both sides.
', 'Step 16: Top bread slices liberally with warm sauce, then top with ham and Gruyere cheese.
', 'Step 17: Place poached eggs on top.
', 'Step 18: Cover the pan with foil or a lid and turn off heat.
', 'Step 19: Let stand until cheese has melted and sauce and eggs have set, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 20: Serve immediately, spooning any leftover sauce on top of eggs.
', 'Step 21: Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with chives and paprika.
']

', 'Step 2: Lightly grease cookie sheets and outside of 4 inverted 6-ounce custard cups.

Title: Chestnut Cream Filling

', 'Step 2: n Bring a large pot of water to a boil.

', 'Step 5: n Peel chestnuts while still warm.
', 'Step 6: Transfer to a food processor.

Title: Almond Puff Cake
Ingredients: ['½ cup butter', '¼ teaspoon salt', '1 cup water', '¼ cup blanched slivered almonds', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '4 eggs', '2 cups heavy cream', "1 cup confectioners' sugar", '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '¼ teaspoon almond extract']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine butter, salt, water and almonds.

Title: Fresh Peach Galette

Title: Spicy Roast Goose with Apple Stuffing
Ingredients: ['1 (12 pound) goose, thawed if purchased frozen', '¼ teaspoon ground allspice', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', 'salt and black pepper to taste', '8 apples, peeled, cored and sliced', '½ cup Calvados (apple brandy)', '2 teaspoons ground cinnamon']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Wash the goose thoroughly and pat dry with paper towels.
', 'Step 2: Let the goose sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Meanwhile, mix together the allspice, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, salt and pepper in a small bowl and set aside to make a spice rub.
', 'Step 4: Remove any lumps of visible fat from the cavity of the goose, and render the goose fat in a skillet over medium heat until the fat is liquid and the remaining bits are crisp and brown, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Reserve 3 tablespoons of goose fat and save the rest for another use, or discard.
', 'Step 6: Working in batches if necessary, fry the sliced apples in the reserved goose fat in a large skillet over medium heat until the apple slices are browned, about 10 minutes per batch.
', 'Step 7: Remove the browned apple slices to a large mixing bowl, let cool slightly, and sprinkle with the Calvados and 2 teaspoons of cinnamon.
', 'Step 8: Mix lightly to combine.
', 'Step 9: With the point of a sharp knife, prick the entire skin of the goose, being careful not to cut into the meat.
', 'Step 10: Rub the exterior of the goose well with the spice rub, massaging the spices into the skin.
', 'Step 11: Preheat an oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 12: Spoon the apple stuffing lightly into the cavity of the goose, and lay it on a large sheet of aluminum foil big enough to wrap over the entire goose.
', 'Step 13: Wrap the goose in the foil, seal the edges, and make a 1/2-inch hole in the bottom of the foil packet to allow the fat from the goose to drain.
', 'Step 14: Place the bird breast side up, on a rack set into a large baking pan, and roast the goose in the preheated oven until no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about an hour and a half.
', 'Step 15: Peel the foil back from the breast meat and roast for another 45 minutes until the skin browns, basting once or twice to prevent burning.
', 'Step 16: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone should read 180 degrees F (82 degrees C).
', 'Step 17: Remove the goose from the oven, cover with a doubled sheet of aluminum foil, and allow to rest in a warm area 10 to 15 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Classic Frangipane
Ingredients: ['1 cup skim milk', '¼ cup white sugar', '1 large egg', '1 large egg yolk', '¼ cup all-purpose flour', '4 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', '½ cup white sugar', '½ cup almond meal', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract, or to taste', '¼ teaspoon almond extract, or to taste']

['Step 1: Bring milk to a boil in a saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Remove from the heat and set aside.

', 'Step 9: Add the remaining 1/2 cup sugar, almond meal, vanilla extract, and almond extract.
', 'Step 10: Let cool, stirring every so often to prevent a skin from forming.
', 'Step 11: Once cooled, use it right away or refrigerate until ready to use.
']

Title: Alsatian Apple Sheet Cake
Ingredients: ['2 ½ cups all-purpose flour', '1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature', '1 cup white sugar, divided', '1 pinch salt', '½ cup dry white wine, or as needed', '3 ¼ pounds apples, or as needed', '½ lemon, juiced and zested', '4 tablespoons cinnamon sugar, divided', '2 eggs', '4 teaspoons vanilla sugar', '1 cup heavy cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine flour, butter, 1/2 cup sugar, and salt in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add 3/4 of the white wine and mix into a smooth dough.
', 'Step 3: Add more white wine as needed, but avoid making dough too soft.
', 'Step 4: Shape into a ball, flatten, cover, and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Peel apples and cut in half.
', 'Step 6: Remove core and place into a bowl with cold water and lemon juice to prevent browning.
', 'Step 7: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Grease a rimmed baking sheet with butter and dust with flour.
', 'Step 9: Roll chilled dough out into a rectangle slightly larger than the baking sheet.
', 'Step 10: Transfer dough to the baking sheet and press some of the dough up the rimmed sides to make an edge.

', 'Step 12: Place apple halves cut-side down on a cutting board.
', 'Step 13: Make several parallel cuts without cutting all the way through the apple.
', 'Step 14: Arrange apples all over the dough.
', 'Step 15: Sprinkle evenly with 3 tablespoons cinnamon sugar.
', 'Step 16: Bake in the preheated oven until apples start to lightly brown, 35 to 40 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Combine eggs, 1/2 cup sugar, vanilla sugar, and lemon zest in a bowl.
', 'Step 18: Beat with an electric mixer until very foamy, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Beat cream in a chilled glass or metal bowl with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form.
', 'Step 20: Fold whipped cream into the egg mixture.
', 'Step 21: Remove cake from the oven and reduce temperature to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 22: Pour egg-cream mixture over the apples and sprinkle with remaining 1 tablespoon cinnamon sugar.
', 'Step 23: Bake until cream topping is golden brown, 10 to 15 minutes.
']

Title: Earl Grey Madeleines
Ingredients: ['1 ⅓ cups cake flour', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '3 large eggs, at room temperature', '⅔ cup white sugar', '½ cup unsalted butter, melted and cooled to room temperature', '2 bags Earl Grey tea (such as Pickwick®), finely ground', '1 teaspoon vanilla bean paste', '4 teaspoons melted butter, divided', '4 teaspoons all-purpose flour, divided']

['Step 1: Sift cake flour, baking powder, and salt together into a medium bowl.

', 'Step 3: Combine eggs and sugar in a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment.

Title: Anise Tuiles
Ingredients: ['3 egg whites', "¾ cup confectioners' sugar", '½ cup all-purpose flour', '6 tablespoons butter', '¾ teaspoon anise extract', '¼ teaspoon salt']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Title: Tartiflette (French Cheese and Potato Casserole)

Title: Sweet Pepper French Dressing

Title: Fresh Fruit Breakfast Lasagna
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups milk', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '2 eggs', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '½ teaspoon almond extract', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '½ (3.4 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix', '1 cup orange juice', '½ cup sour cream', '2 cups sliced fresh strawberries', '2 bananas, sliced', '1 cup fresh blueberries', '1 cup whipped cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: To make the crepes, whisk together the milk, flour, eggs, oil, almond extract, and sugar in a bowl until you have a smooth batter.
', 'Step 2: Lightly grease a small skillet and place over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Spoon in 2 tablespoons of batter and gently tilt the skillet to spread the batter to the edges of the pan.
', 'Step 4: Cook until brown, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Flip the crepe and cook the other side until brown.
', 'Step 6: Remove to a plate.
', 'Step 7: Repeat with remaining batter until it is all used.
', 'Step 8: To make the filling, whisk together the pudding mix, orange juice, and sour cream in a bowl.
', 'Step 9: Gently fold the strawberries, bananas and blueberries into the sour cream mixture.
', 'Step 10: Lightly grease the bottom of a baking dish.
', 'Step 11: Cover the bottom of the dish with 1/3 of the crepes.
', 'Step 12: Spoon 1/2 of the fruit mixture over the crepes.
', 'Step 13: Repeat with remaining fruit and crepes, finishing with the crepes as the top layer.
', 'Step 14: Garnish with whipped cream.
', 'Step 15: Allow to sit 30 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Filet Mignon with Bell Pepper Haystack and Fresh Guacamole Served with Corn Chips
Ingredients: ['4 small avocados, peeled and mashed', '3 roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped', '1 large shallot, minced', '1 jalapeno pepper, minced', '½ lemon, juiced', '1 cup low-sodium chicken broth', '¼ cup corn oil', '1 red bell pepper, cut into thin strips', '1 yellow bell pepper, cut into thin strips', '1 (4 ounce) package button mushrooms, sliced thin', '1 teaspoon coriander seeds, crushed', '1 teaspoon celery seed', '¼ teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper', '2 tablespoons water', '3 tablespoons corn oil', '3 large shallots, sliced', '4 cloves garlic, smashed', '3 ½ cups water', '2 tablespoons white wine vinegar', '¼ cup cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', '½ teaspoon sea salt', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '4 (6 ounce) beef tenderloin fillets, room temperature', '1 (16 ounce) package corn chips']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Stir the avocado, roma tomatoes, minced shallot, jalapeno pepper, and lemon juice in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Chill in refrigerator to allow flavors to meld.
', 'Step 3: Place the chicken stock in a small saucepan over medium-low heat; simmer the stock until reduced to about 1/2 cup.
', 'Step 4: Heat 1/4 cup corn oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook the red bell pepper and yellow bell pepper in the hot oil until tender, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir the mushrooms into the peppers; season with the coriander seeds, sea salt, and black pepper.
', 'Step 6: Add the reduced chicken stock and the water; cook and stir until the moisture has been absorbed, another 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Transfer the mixture to a plate lined with paper towels to allow the grease to drain.
', 'Step 8: Heat the olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir the sliced shallots in the hot oil until softened, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Stir in the crushed garlic and cook another 3 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Pour 3 1/2 cups water over the mixture and bring to a boil; cook at a boil until the liquid reduces to 1 cup.
', 'Step 11: Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh strainer and return the strained liquid to the saucepan, keeping it over medium heat.
', 'Step 12: Add the white wine vinegar and return to a boil; continue cooking at a boil until the liquid reduced to about 1/4 cup.
', 'Step 13: Quickly whisk in the chilled butter until just melted, whisking constantly.
', 'Step 14: Remove from the heat and keep warm while you prepare the steaks.
', 'Step 15: Place a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat and allow get hot.
', 'Step 16: Heat the oil in the skillet.
', 'Step 17: Cook the steaks in the hot oil until they start to firm, and are reddish-pink and juicy in the center, about 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 18: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 130 degrees F (54 degrees C).
', 'Step 19: Cover the meat with two layers of aluminum foil and allow to rest in a warm area for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 20: Place a mound of the bell pepper mixture into the center of each serving plate.
', 'Step 21: Slice the rested steaks in half and place atop each mound.
', 'Step 22: Spoon a few spoonfuls of the butter mixture onto the plate to surround the stack.
', 'Step 23: Serve with the chilled guacamole and corn chips.
']

Title: Sockeye Salmon with Preserved Lemon Beurre Blanc
Ingredients: ['¾ cup olive oil', '½ cup minced chives', '¼ cup diced preserved lemon', '¼ cup Champagne vinegar', '10 pounds sockeye salmon fillets', '1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste', '½ (750 milliliter) bottle white wine', '¾ cup sliced shallots', '1 pound butter', '½ cup minced chives', '¼ cup diced preserved lemon', '1 cup chopped parsley, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line rimmed baking sheets with parchment paper.
', 'Step 3: Whisk olive oil, 1/2 cup chives, 1/4 cup preserved lemon, and Champagne vinegar together in a bowl.
', 'Step 4: Lay salmon fillets on the prepared baking sheets.
', 'Step 5: Pour vinaigrette over the top.
', 'Step 6: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven until flesh flakes easily with a fork, 8 to 14 minutes depending on the thickness of the fillets.
', 'Step 8: Bring white wine and shallots to a simmer in a large saucepan.
', 'Step 9: Cook until volume is reduced by half, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Reduce heat to medium-low.
', 'Step 11: Add butter, whisking constantly until melted.
', 'Step 12: Move saucepan on and off the heat so sauce is just hot enough to melt butter, but never simmering.
', 'Step 13: Stir 1/2 cup chives and 1/4 cup preserved lemon into the beurre blanc.
', 'Step 14: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 15: Transfer salmon fillets to a large platter.
', 'Step 16: Pour beurre blanc on top.
', 'Step 17: Garnish with parsley.
']

Title: Bo Luc Lac "French-Vietnamese Shaking Beef"
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons minced garlic', '2 tablespoons oyster sauce', '1 ½ tablespoons white sugar', '1 tablespoon fish sauce', '1 tablespoon sesame oil', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', '1 teaspoon hoisin sauce', '1 ½ pounds beef top sirloin, cut into 1-inch cubes', '½ cup rice vinegar', '1 ½ tablespoons white sugar', '1 ½ teaspoons salt', '1 red onion, thinly sliced', '1 lime, juiced', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 tablespoons cooking oil', '2 bunches watercress, torn', '2 tomatoes, thinly sliced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk garlic, oyster sauce, 1 1/2 tablespoons sugar, fish sauce, sesame oil, soy sauce, and hoisin sauce together in a bowl; add beef.
', 'Step 2: Marinate beef in refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
', 'Step 3: Whisk vinegar, 1 1/2 tablespoons sugar, and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt together in a bowl until vinaigrette is smooth; add onion.
', 'Step 4: Refrigerate for 10 minutes to pickle the onion.
', 'Step 5: Whisk lime juice, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and black pepper together in a bowl until dipping sauce is smooth.
', 'Step 6: Transfer dipping sauce to ramekins.
', 'Step 7: Heat cooking oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat until oil starts to smoke; add beef.
', 'Step 8: Cook in a single layer until beef is seared, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Cook and stir (or "shake") until beef reaches desired doneness, 2 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Spread watercress onto a serving plate and top with tomatoes.
', 'Step 11: Drizzle vinaigrette over tomatoes and layer beef onto watercress; top with onion.
', 'Step 12: Serve dipping sauce on the side.
']

Title: Veal Roast Blanquette
Ingredients: ['4 pounds veal shoulder roast', '¼ teaspoon dried thyme', '4 carrots, halved', '1 pound small potatoes', '½ pound small white onions', '½ pound mushrooms', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 (10 ounce) package frozen green peas', '2 egg yolks']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In an 8 quart Dutch oven over medium-high heat, brown roast on all sides.
', 'Step 2: Add thyme and 2 cups of water.
', 'Step 3: Heat to boiling, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 30 minutes.
', 'Step 4: To the pot, add carrots, potatoes and onions.
', 'Step 5: Cover, and simmer 30 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Toss in mushrooms.
', 'Step 7: Cover, and simmer 15 minutes, or until vegetables and veal are tender.
', 'Step 8: Remove roast and vegetables, and keep warm.
', 'Step 9: In a cup, stir flour and 2 tablespoons water until blended with no lumps.
', 'Step 10: Gradually stir into liquid in Dutch oven.
', 'Step 11: Cook, stirring constantly, until gravy is slightly thickened.
', 'Step 12: Stir in peas, and heat through.
', 'Step 13: In a small bowl, beat egg yolks.
', 'Step 14: Stir in a small amount of hot gravy.
', 'Step 15: Slowly pour egg yolk mixture back into gravy, whisking until thickened.
', 'Step 16: DO NOT BOIL!
', 'Step 17: To serve, pour some gravy over the veal and vegetables.
', 'Step 18: Serve remaining gravy in a gravy boat.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '414.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '23 g', 'cholesterolContent': '255.3 mg', 'fatContent': '13.3 g', 'fiberContent': '4.4 g', 'proteinContent': '48.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '284.3 mg', 'sugarContent': '5.5 g'}

Title: Poulet aigu de Tarragon
Ingredients: ['4 bone-in chicken breast halves, with skin', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh ginger root', 'salt to taste', '3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '1 medium onion, finely chopped', '1 cup chicken broth', '1 cup heavy cream', '2 tablespoons sour cream', '½ cup dry white wine', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh tarragon', '12 spears thick stemmed asparagus', '1 sprig fresh parsley', '1 wedge lemon']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Rub the chicken breast halves with salt and chopped ginger.
', 'Step 2: Watch the ginger, you just want to flavor the meat, but not overpower the sauce.
', 'Step 3: Discard the ginger.
', 'Step 4: Lightly coat the chicken in flour.
', 'Step 5: Heat 3 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 6: Brown the chicken in the hot oil skin side first.
', 'Step 7: Chicken should be about 3/4 cooked but the skin should be browned and crisp.
', 'Step 8: Remove from pan and set aside.
', 'Step 9: Heat remaining 3 tablespoons of olive oil in the skillet, and saute chopped onion until soft and translucent.
', 'Step 10: Use the chicken broth to deglaze the pan.
', 'Step 11: Stir in the cream and sour cream.
', 'Step 12: Reduce heat to low, and simmer until the mixture has reduced by 1/4.
', 'Step 13: Stir in the white wine until well blended.
', 'Step 14: Add the tarragon to the pan, and place chicken breasts on top of tarragon.
', 'Step 15: Cook over low heat, spooning sauce over chicken, until the sauce has become very thick, the chicken is no longer pink, and its juices run clear.
', 'Step 16: Heat one inch of lightly salted water to boiling in a large saucepan.
', 'Step 17: Cut one inch off of the bottom of the asparagus stems.
', 'Step 18: Place asparagus into the pan, cover and steam for 5 to 7 minutes, or until tender but still bright green.
', 'Step 19: Remove from heat, and drain.
', 'Step 20: To serve, place 4 asparagus spears onto each plate with all of the tips facing the same direction.
', 'Step 21: Place one chicken breast skin side up onto each plate so that it covers the stems of the asparagus, but the tips are exposed.
', 'Step 22: Squeeze lemon over the asparagus.
', 'Step 23: Spoon sauce over the chicken, and to the side of the asparagus.
']

Title: Chicken a la Good
Ingredients: ['4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - pounded to 1/4 inch thickness', 'garlic salt to taste', 'ground black pepper to taste', '½ pound thinly sliced ham', '4 slices Swiss cheese', '8 slices bacon', '1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

', 'Step 3: Lay a slice of ham onto each breast, then a slice of Swiss cheese.

', 'Step 5: Secure with a toothpick if necessary.
', 'Step 6: Wrap a piece of bacon loosely around each roll.
', 'Step 7: Place the rolled breasts in a 2 quart glass baking dish and pour in chicken broth.
', 'Step 8: Bake for 30 to 35 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the juices run clear.
', 'Step 9: Broil for a few minutes before serving to crisp up the bacon.
']

Title: Ratatouille in the Slow Cooker
Ingredients: ['6 medium zucchini, halved lengthwise and sliced', '2 medium eggplants, cut into 2-inch pieces', '4 yellow onions, chopped', '4 medium tomatoes, chopped', '3 red bell pepper, chopped', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '½ cup vegetable broth', '¼ cup olive oil', '2 teaspoons salt', '2 teaspoons ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon dried thyme', '½ teaspoon dried oregano']

Title: French Yogurt Cake
Ingredients: ['2 teaspoons butter', '1 ½ cups all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '1 pinch salt', '1 cup white sugar', '2 lemons, zested and juiced, divided', '3 eggs', '½ cup Greek yogurt', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '½ cup extra-virgin olive oil', "1 cup confectioners' sugar"]
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease an 8-1/2x4-1/2-inch loaf pan with butter.
', 'Step 3: Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together into a bowl.
', 'Step 4: Combine white sugar and lemon zest in a bowl.
', 'Step 5: Rub lemon zest into the sugar with your fingers until fragrant.
', 'Step 6: Combine eggs, yogurt, juice of 1 lemon, and vanilla extract in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixture until blended.
', 'Step 7: Add flour mixture and sugar mixture; beat on low speed until batter is just combined.
', 'Step 8: Fold in olive oil gently using a spatula.
', 'Step 9: Pour batter into the prepared loaf pan.
', 'Step 10: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 40 to 50 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Let cool in the pan, at least 30 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Run a knife around the edge of the pan to loosen; invert onto a serving dish.
', "Step 13: Whisk remaining lemon juice and confectioners' sugar together in a bowl to make a thin glaze.
", 'Step 14: Drizzle glaze over cake.
']

Title: Pear Clafouti
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon softened butter', '2 ripe pears - peeled, cored, and sliced, or more to taste', '3 eggs', '¾ cup white sugar', '1 ½ cups heavy whipping cream', '½ cup all-purpose flour', '2 tablespoons kirsch (cherry brandy)', '2 tablespoons grated lemon zest', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 teaspoon ground cardamom', '¼ teaspoon salt', "2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar"]
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Butter a 10 1/2-inch round baking dish or pie plate.
', 'Step 3: Fan pear slices out in a single layer in the bottom.
', 'Step 4: Beat eggs and sugar together using an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment on medium speed until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Mix in heavy cream, flour, kirsch, lemon zest, vanilla extract, cardamom, and salt on low speed until batter is smooth.

', 'Step 9: Let cool briefly, about 15 minutes.
', "Step 10: Serve warm, sprinkled with confectioners' sugar.
"]

Title: Chicken Street Crepes
Ingredients: ['¾ cup milk', '½ cup all-purpose flour', '2 eggs', '1 tablespoon melted butter', '1 pinch salt', 'cooking spray', '1 tablespoon butter', '1 cup spinach leaves', '¼ cup sliced shallots', '1 cup chopped cooked chicken', '½ cup Brie cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix milk, flour, eggs, melted butter, and salt together in a blender until combined.
', 'Step 2: Let mixture rest for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Heat a 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat; lightly coat with cooking spray.
', 'Step 4: Add 1/2 cup of batter and swirl the skillet so the batter completely covers the bottom.
', 'Step 5: Cook until bottom is golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Loosen the edges with a rubber spatula and use your fingers to quickly flip the crepe.
', 'Step 7: Cook 1 minute more.
', 'Step 8: Slide crepe out of the skillet.
', 'Step 9: Repeat with remaining batter, spraying skillet in between crepes.
', 'Step 10: Stack cooked crepes directly on top of each other to maintain temperature.
', 'Step 11: Melt butter in a separate skillet over medium-high heat.

', 'Step 16: Fold crepe in half, return to the skillet, and heat until cheese is melted.
', 'Step 17: Remove from skillet and roll into a cone shape.
']

Title: Pissaladiere (Onion, Olive, and Anchovy Pizza)
Ingredients: ['1 ¼ cups all-purpose flour', '½ teaspoon salt', '¼ cup cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 tablespoons water, or as needed', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '2 ½ pounds onions, thinly sliced', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 small bay leaf', '1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme', '1 tablespoon drained capers', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '20 large Niçoise olives, pitted and coarsely chopped', '16 anchovies anchovy fillets']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix flour and salt together in the bowl of a food processor.
', 'Step 2: Add butter and 2 tablespoons oil.
', 'Step 3: Pulse until mixture resembles coarse meal.
', 'Step 4: Pulse in enough water, 1 tablespoon at a time, to form moist clumps.
', 'Step 5: Gather dough into a ball; flatten into a disk.
', 'Step 6: Wrap in plastic and chill, at least 2 hours.
', 'Step 7: Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a heavy, large skillet over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 8: Add onions, garlic, bay leaf, and thyme; stir to blend.
', 'Step 9: Cover and cook until onions are very tender, stirring occasionally, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Uncover and sauté until most liquid evaporates and onions are golden, about 10 minutes longer.
', 'Step 11: Stir in capers.
', 'Step 12: Season mixture with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 13: Cool completely; discard bay leaf.
', 'Step 14: Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 15: Lightly oil a large baking sheet.
', 'Step 16: Roll out dough on a floured surface to an 11-inch round.
', 'Step 17: Transfer dough to the prepared sheet.
', 'Step 18: Crimp edges of dough to form a stand-up border.
', 'Step 19: Spread filling evenly over dough.
', 'Step 20: Arrange olives and anchovies decoratively atop filling.
', 'Step 21: Bake in the preheated oven until crust is crisp and golden, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 22: Transfer to a platter and serve.
']

Title: French Apple Cake (or the 3/4 Recipe)
Ingredients: ['¾ cup white sugar', '2 eggs', '¾ tablespoon vanilla extract', '3 tablespoons rum', '¾ stick butter, softened, divided', '¾ cup all-purpose flour', '¾ teaspoon baking powder', '1 pinch salt', '4 cups chopped peeled apples, or more taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Butter a 9-inch springform pan.
', 'Step 3: Combine sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract in a bowl; beat with an electric mixer until smooth.
', 'Step 4: Mix in rum.
', 'Step 5: Mix in 1/2 of the butter.
', 'Step 6: Combine flour, baking powder, and salt together in a separate bowl.
', 'Step 7: Add 1/2 of the flour mixture to the egg mixture; mix well.
', 'Step 8: Mix in remaining butter and flour.
', 'Step 9: Fold in apples.
', 'Step 10: Scrape batter into the prepared pan.
', 'Step 11: Smooth the top gently.
', 'Step 12: Bake in the preheated oven until top is golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 50 to 60 minutes.
']

Title: Almond and Hazelnut Praline
Ingredients: ['½ cup white sugar', '⅓ cup chopped almonds', '⅓ cup chopped hazelnuts']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Line a plate with wax paper.
', 'Step 2: Heat a skillet over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 3: Add sugar, almonds, and hazelnuts, stirring continuously until almonds and nuts are evenly coated with caramel, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Carefully tip nut-sugar mixture onto the wax paper--mixture will be very hot.
', 'Step 5: Let cool for 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Break praline in large pieces and serve as-is or place in a food processor with a blade and chop to desired consistency.
']

Title: Simple Parisian-Style Potato Salad
Ingredients: ['2 pounds baby Yukon Gold potatoes, unpeeled', 'salt to taste', '1 bay leaf', '¼ cup extra-virgin olive oil', '1 tablespoon white wine vinegar', '1 teaspoon Dijon mustard', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '¼ cup finely chopped shallots', '2 tablespoons finely chopped flat-leaf parsley']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the potatoes in a large saucepan and cover by 1 inch with water.
', 'Step 2: Season with salt.
', 'Step 3: Add bay leaf and bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat to medium and simmer until potatoes can be easily pierced with a knife, 12 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Do not overcook.
', 'Step 6: Meanwhile, whisk olive oil, white wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper in a small bowl together until emulsified.
', 'Step 7: Drain cooked potatoes in a colander and cool until just warm enough to handle.
', 'Step 8: Cut the potatoes into 1/2-inch slices and transfer to a large bowl.
', 'Step 9: Drizzle vinaigrette over potatoes, gently tossing to coat.
', 'Step 10: Add shallots and parsley and toss lightly to combine.
', 'Step 11: Set the potato salad aside for about 10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.
', 'Step 12: Taste and adjust seasoning if needed.
', 'Step 13: Serve warm or at room temperature.
']

Title: Chicken with Artichokes and Goat Cheese
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '4 cups chicken stock', '1 (9 ounce) package frozen artichoke hearts, thawed', '1 cup fresh pearl onions, peeled', '½ teaspoon dried thyme', '¼ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '3 ounces soft goat cheese, sliced into 4 pieces', '2 tablespoons cornstarch']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and cook chicken breast halves until browned on both sides, 5 to 8 minutes per side.
', 'Step 2: Pour in chicken stock, artichoke hearts, pearl onions, thyme, salt, and black pepper and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Reduce heat to low and simmer until stock is reduced and onions and artichokes are tender, about 45 minutes; turn chicken breasts over in the skillet after 20 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Place a goat cheese slice on each chicken breast; cover skillet and let goat cheese melt.
', 'Step 5: Place chicken breasts onto a serving platter.
', 'Step 6: Spoon about 3 tablespoons liquid from skillet into a small bowl and whisk in cornstarch until smooth; stir cornstarch mixture into skillet and cook until sauce has thickened, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 7: Serve pan sauce with chicken breasts.
']

Title: Creme Au Chocolat
Ingredients: ['¾ cup light cream', '1 (4 ounce) bar sweet baking chocolate, chopped', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '2 egg yolks, lightly beaten', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '4 tablespoons whipped cream, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat cream, chocolate, and sugar in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly, until chocolate is melted and smooth.
', 'Step 2: Pour a little of the melted chocolate mixture into the beaten egg yolks; mix until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Pour back into the pot with the remaining chocolate.
', 'Step 4: Heat gently, stirring constantly, until custard thickens slightly.
', 'Step 5: Spoon into small dessert bowls and garnish with whipped cream.
']

Title: Shichimi-Seared Pork Tenderloin
Ingredients: ['¼ cup white sesame seeds', '¼ cup black sesame seeds', '2 tablespoons shichimi togarashi (Japanese 7 spice)', '4 pounds pork tenderloins', 'Kosher salt', '2 tablespoons canola oil', '3 shallots, minced', '2 tablespoons minced fresh ginger', '¾ cup dry white wine', '2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '1 cup whipping cream', '2 tablespoons soy sauce', '3 tablespoons white miso paste', '1 cup cold, unsalted butter, cut into 1-inch cubes', 'Kosher salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until it begins to smoke.
', 'Step 3: Meanwhile, mix the white and black sesame seeds together with the togarashi powder; set aside.
', 'Step 4: Season the tenderloins with salt, then press into sesame mixture until completely coated.
', 'Step 5: Sear the tenderloins on all sides until golden brown, about 1 minute per side.
', 'Step 6: Transfer the tenderloins to a baking sheet, and bake in preheated oven until the internal temperature reaches 145 degrees F (63 degrees C), 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 7: When done, remove pork, and allow to rest for five minutes in a warm place.
', 'Step 8: While pork is roasting, prepare sauce by simmering the shallots, ginger, lime juice, and wine in a small saucepan over medium-high heat until it has reduced to about 2 tablespoons of liquid.
', 'Step 9: Add the cream, and continue to simmer until it has reduced by half.
', 'Step 10: Pour mixture into a blender, along with soy sauce and miso.
', 'Step 11: Blend on low speed for 10 seconds until pureed, then slowly add butter, a few cubes at a time with blender running until it is incorporated.
', 'Step 12: Season to taste with salt, and keep in a warm place until ready to use.
', 'Step 13: To serve, slice the tenderloin into medallions, and pour warm sauce overtop; serve immediately.
']

Title: Pumpkin Pot De Creme
Ingredients: ['2 cups whipping cream', '¼ cup sugar', '1 teaspoon cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon ground ginger', '¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '1 cup pumpkin puree', '½ vanilla bean, split and scraped', '1 teaspoon dark rum', '5 egg yolks', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '½ cup chopped toasted pecans', '¼ cup maple syrup']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Combine the whipping cream, 1/4 cup sugar, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, cloves, pumpkin puree, and the vanilla bean pod and seeds in a saucepan over medium-low heat; bring to a simmer; stir in the rum.
', 'Step 3: Remove from the heat cover and stand 15 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Beat together the egg yolks and 2 tablespoons sugar.
', 'Step 5: Stir in 2 tablespoons of the cream mixture.
', 'Step 6: Pour the egg yolk mixture into the saucepan with the cream mixture to make a custard; stir; simmer 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Arrange 6 ramekins in a shallow baking dish.
', 'Step 8: Pour the custard evenly into the ramekins.
', 'Step 9: Pour boiling water into the baking dish to half-way up the sides of the ramekins.
', 'Step 10: Loosely cover the baking dish with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until the custard is nearly set with a dime-sized circle of jiggly liquid remaining in the center of each ramekin, 25 to 40 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Allow to sit, loosely covered with aluminum foil, another 30 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Cover each ramekin with plastic wrap; chill in refrigerator overnight.
', 'Step 14: Top each custard with pecans and maple syrup to serve.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '491.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '30.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '279.4 mg', 'fatContent': '40.4 g', 'fiberContent': '2.4 g', 'proteinContent': '5.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '20.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '136.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '23.4 g'}

Title: French Peppermint Cookies with Chocolate Ganache
Ingredients: ['3 egg whites at room temperature', '¼ cup white sugar', '¼ teaspoon cream of tartar', '1 dash peppermint extract, or to taste', "2 cups confectioners' sugar, or as needed", '1 (6 ounce) package semisweet chocolate chips', '¾ cup heavy whipping cream, or as needed', '1 teaspoon white sugar, or to taste', '1 peppermint candy cane, finely crushed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Move rack to the bottom of oven and preheat oven to 175 degrees F (80 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line baking sheets with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Whisk egg whites and 1/4 cup white sugar in the top of a double boiler set over simmering water until smooth.
', 'Step 4: Whisk cream of tartar and peppermint extract into egg mixture and beat until foamy.
', "Step 5: Gradually whisk confectioners' sugar into mixture, beating until egg white meringue holds stiff peaks.
", 'Step 6: Scoop about 1 tablespoon of meringue per cookie and gently transfer to the prepared baking sheets; use spoon to shape the meringue cookies into football shape with 2 gently pointed ends.
', 'Step 7: Bake cookies on bottom rack of the preheated oven until dry on the outside but still slightly soft in the centers, about 1 1/2 hours.
', 'Step 8: Let cool completely before removing from baking sheets.
', 'Step 9: Melt chocolate chips in the top of a double boiler over simmering water until melted, stirring until smooth.
', 'Step 10: Gradually mix cream into chocolate until mixture is thick but not pasty; stir 1 teaspoon white sugar into chocolate ganache until sugar has dissolved.
', 'Step 11: Dip cookies in ganache.
', 'Step 12: Place dipped cookies atop a piece of parchment paper and sprinkle with crushed peppermint candy.
', 'Step 13: Let cookies set; refrigerate leftovers.
']

Title: White Chocolate Macadamia Creme Brulee
Ingredients: ['6 tablespoons chopped and toasted macadamia nuts', '½ cup white sugar', '2 cups whipping cream', '4 ounces white chocolate, chopped', '4 egg yolks', '1 tablespoon vanilla extract', '½ cup brown sugar, firmly packed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Set 6 (4-ounce) ramekins in a deep baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Put 1 tablespoon of the macadamia nuts into each of the ramekins.
', 'Step 4: In a saucepan, stir the cream and sugar over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: When the mixture comes to a slow simmer, add the white chocolate and remove from the heat.
', 'Step 6: Whisk until the chocolate has completely melted.
', 'Step 7: Stir in the egg yolks, one at a time, continuing to whisk until combined.
', 'Step 8: Stir in the vanilla extract.
', 'Step 9: Divide the mixture evenly between the ramekins.
', 'Step 10: Place the dish into the oven and then pour water into baking dish until ramekins are 3/4 submerged.
', 'Step 11: Bake in preheated oven until custard has set, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Remove pan and turn oven to broil.
', 'Step 13: Sprinkle the brown sugar over each of the ramekins.
', 'Step 14: Place pan under broiler until sugar has melted and caramelized, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Remove ramekins from water bath.
', 'Step 16: Allow to cool for about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 17: I prefer to chill these in the fridge before serving however they are just as heavenly served warm.
']

Title: French Chocolate Buttercream
Ingredients: ['4 ounces unsweetened chocolate', '⅓ cup white sugar', '¼ cup water', '2 eggs', '1 cup unsalted butter, room temperature, cut into tablespoons']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt chocolate in a microwave according to package instructions.
', 'Step 2: Set aside and let cool completely.
', 'Step 3: n Combine sugar and water in a saucepan.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil; let boil for 1 minute.
', 'Step 5: Remove from heat and set aside.
', 'Step 6: n Beat eggs in a large bowl using an electric mixer until frothy.
', 'Step 7: Drizzle in sugar mixture slowly; beat on high speed until mixture turns pale yellow and expands in volume, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Add butter by tablespoon one at a time with mixer running, beating well after each addition.
', 'Step 9: Frosting will become watery; continue with remaining butter.
', 'Step 10: n Mix in cooled melted chocolate.
', 'Step 11: Beat on high speed until frosting thickens and becomes fluffy, about 5 minutes.
']

Title: French Orange Poached Pears (Poire Avec Orange)
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups orange juice without pulp', '½ cup packed brown sugar', '¼ cup white sugar', '1 tablespoon vanilla extract', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '3 whole pears, peeled and cored', '½ cup chopped walnuts']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a large saucepan over medium heat, mix together the orange juice, brown and white sugar, vanilla extract, and cinnamon.
', 'Step 2: Bring the mixture to a boil, stirring to dissolve the sugar.
', 'Step 3: Place pears into the syrup, and cover; simmer pears for 1 hour and 15 minutes, spooning sauce over pears every 10 minutes, and turning pears over twice during cooking time.
', 'Step 4: Transfer pears to individual serving dishes.
', 'Step 5: Continue cooking the syrup, stirring often, until thickened, about 15 more minutes, then mix in the walnuts.
', 'Step 6: Pour the sauce over the pears to serve.
']

Title: Ragout de Pattes de Cochon (Pork Shank and Meatball Stew)
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon coarse sea salt, or to taste', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '⅛ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '⅛ teaspoon garlic salt', '2 pork shanks', '2 tablespoons olive oil', 'water to cover', '1 large onion, cut into chunks', '1 stalk celery, coarsely chopped', '1 ½ pounds ground pork', '1 small onion, finely chopped', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '¼ teaspoon ground ginger', '¼ teaspoon mustard powder', '¼ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '⅔ cup toasted flour', '2 tablespoons olive oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix sea salt, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon cloves, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, nutmeg, and garlic salt together in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Rub salt mixture all over pork shanks.
', 'Step 3: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large saucepan.
', 'Step 4: Cook pork shanks in the hot oil until browned, 2 to 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 5: Pour in enough water to cover the shanks.
', 'Step 6: Stir in coarsely chopped onion and celery.
', 'Step 7: Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer until pork can be easily removed from the bones, 2 to 3 hours.
', 'Step 8: Transfer pork shanks to a cutting board; shred pork.
', 'Step 9: Strain cooking liquid, discarding bones, onion, and celery.
', 'Step 10: Pour strained liquid back into the saucepan.
', 'Step 11: Stir in shredded pork.
', 'Step 12: Mix ground pork, finely chopped onion, parsley, 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon cloves, ginger, mustard powder, salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper together in a large bowl.
', 'Step 13: Shape into balls.
', 'Step 14: Pour toasted flour into a shallow dish.
', 'Step 15: Roll meatballs in toasted flour.
', 'Step 16: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 17: Cook meatballs in batches until browned, about 1 minute per side.
', 'Step 18: Stir browned meatballs into the shredded pork stew.
', 'Step 19: Simmer, stirring in leftover toasted flour, until meatballs are no longer pink in the center and stew is thick, about 30 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '632.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '16.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '148.4 mg', 'fatContent': '40.8 g', 'fiberContent': '3.6 g', 'proteinContent': '48.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '11.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '2193 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.9 g'}

Title: Chocolate Decadence Yule Log
Ingredients: ['⅔ cup all-purpose flour', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '5 large eggs eggs', '¾ cup white sugar', '2 (1 ounce) squares unsweetened chocolate', '2 tablespoons water', '2 tablespoons coffee-flavored liqueur', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '¼ teaspoon baking soda', "confectioners' sugar for dusting", '4 (1 ounce) squares semisweet baking chocolate', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', "3 cups confectioners' sugar", '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 tablespoon coffee flavored liqueur']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Lightly spray a 10x15 inch jellyroll pan and line with parchment paper.
', 'Step 3: Sift flour with baking powder and salt and set aside.
', 'Step 4: In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs on high for several minutes until they are very pale and fluffy.
', 'Step 5: Gradually add in the sugar, beating 1 to 2 minutes more or until very thick.
', 'Step 6: Gently, but thoroughly, fold in the flour mixture.
', 'Step 7: Melt the chocolate in a small saucepan over low heat.
', 'Step 8: In a small bowl, combine the 2 tablespoons of water with the 2 tablespoons coffee liqueur and the remaining 2 tablespoons sugar and the baking soda, then gradually stir into the melted chocolate until smooth.
', 'Step 9: Quickly, but thoroughly, fold chocolate mixture into batter.
', 'Step 10: Pour batter into prepared 10x15 inch pan.
', 'Step 11: Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 18 to 20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean.
', 'Step 12: Lightly sift an even layer of confectioners sugar over a cloth napkin or tea towel (do not use Terry-cloth).
', 'Step 13: Flip the cake out of its pan onto the prepared cloth as soon as it comes from the oven.
', 'Step 14: Carefully peel away parchment paper.
', 'Step 15: Lightly dust top of cake with confectioners sugar, then trim away crisp edges.
', 'Step 16: Starting with one of the short sides of the cake, immediately roll the cake up in the cloth, jellyroll style, and cool thoroughly on a rack.
', 'Step 17: For the Filling and Frosting: In a small saucepan over low heat, melt the chocolate.
', 'Step 18: Remove from heat and let cool to lukewarm.
', 'Step 19: In a medium bowl, beat the cream cheese with the confectioners sugar until smooth, then blend in the vanilla extract and coffee liqueur.
', 'Step 20: Blend in the melted chocolate.
', 'Step 21: Unroll the cake and spread about 1/3 of the filling evenly over the surface.
', 'Step 22: Roll the cake back up.
', "Step 23: Arrange cake roll on serving tray, then frost generously, swiping with an icing spatula to form the long 'bark line' design.
", 'Step 24: Swipe ends of cake in a circular motion to simulate the tree-rings of a cut log.
', 'Step 25: Decorate log as desired with holly leaves and berries, mushrooms and snow.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '377.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '58.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '98 mg', 'fatContent': '14.1 g', 'fiberContent': '1.6 g', 'proteinContent': '6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '229.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '50.4 g'}

Title: Almond Pork
Ingredients: ['1 pound pork tenderloin, trimmed and cut into 1/2-inch thick medallions', '1 teaspoon dried tarragon, crumbled', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '4 tablespoons butter, divided', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', '¾ cup white wine', '1 teaspoon chicken bouillon granules', '1 tablespoon Dijon mustard', '¼ cup heavy cream', '½ cup toasted slivered almonds', '¼ cup sliced green onions']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: With a meat mallet, pound the tenderloin slices to 1/4-inch thick.
', 'Step 2: Combine tarragon and garlic powder in a small bowl, and sprinkle the mixture over the cutlets.
', 'Step 3: Rub the seasoning into the meat, cover, and refrigerate for 1 hour to blend the flavors.
', 'Step 4: Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a skillet over medium heat until the foam disappears.
', 'Step 5: Brown half of the tenderloin pieces in the butter, 3 to 4 minutes per side.
', 'Step 6: Do not crowd pan.
', 'Step 7: Repeat with the remainder of the pork pieces and 1 more tablespoon of butter.
', 'Step 8: Set the pork pieces aside on a warm platter.
', 'Step 9: Melt remaining 2 tablespoons of butter in the skillet over medium heat; stir in the flour until smooth and the mixture starts to fry.
', 'Step 10: Gradually whisk in wine, stirring constantly until the flour mixture and wine are blended; stir in chicken bouillon granules and Dijon mustard.
', 'Step 11: Allow the sauce to boil for 1 minute; whisk in the cream.
', 'Step 12: Bring the mixture almost to the boiling point, and stir in the almonds and green onions.
', 'Step 13: Pour sauce over the pork, and serve.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '417 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '7.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '114 mg', 'fatContent': '28.3 g', 'fiberContent': '1.6 g', 'proteinContent': '24.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '12.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '323 mg', 'sugarContent': '1.4 g'}

Title: Deb's Tapenade
Ingredients: ['2 (6 ounce) cans sliced black olives, drained', '3 tablespoons capers', '½ cup minced onion', '1 clove garlic, minced', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley', '¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ cup chopped red bell pepper']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the olives in a food processor or blender; pulse the olives until slightly chopped; remove to a bowl and set aside.
', 'Step 2: Combine the capers, onion, garlic, parsley, Parmesan cheese, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, black pepper, and about half of the red bell pepper in the food processor or blender; blend until finely chopped.
', 'Step 3: Add to the olives and mix.
', 'Step 4: Sprinkle remaining red pepper over the mixture.
']

Title: Blue Cheese Walnut Toasts
Ingredients: ['1 French baguette, cut into 1/3 inch thick slices', '¼ cup butter, melted', '4 ounces crumbled blue cheese', '¼ cup butter, softened', 'salt and pepper to taste', '½ cup chopped walnuts', '½ cup chopped fresh parsley']
Cooking Instructions:

', 'Step 2: Brush one side of each slice of bread with melted butter, and place butter side up on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 3: Bake for 7 minutes, or until lightly toasted.
', 'Step 4: In a small bowl, stir together the blue cheese, softened butter, salt and pepper.
', 'Step 5: Spread this mixture over the tops of the toasted bread slices, then sprinkle with chopped walnuts.
', 'Step 6: Bake for 6 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the topping is melted and bubbly.
', 'Step 7: Arrange on a serving tray and garnish with chopped parlsley.
']

Title: Raspberry Clafoutis
Ingredients: ['½ cup all-purpose flour', '¼ cup white sugar', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '3 eggs', '3 tablespoons butter, melted', '¼ cup milk', '2 tablespoons milk', '1 squeeze lemon juice', '2 cups fresh raspberries', "2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar, or to taste"]
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Whisk flour and 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar together in a bowl.
', 'Step 3: Whisk in eggs and butter.
', 'Step 4: Add 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons milk and lemon juice; whisk until batter is very smooth, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Pour batter into a 9-inch oval or round baking dish.
', 'Step 6: Scatter raspberries on top.
', 'Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven until puffy and golden, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Let cool, about 15 minutes.
', "Step 9: Dust with confectioners' sugar.
"]
