Title: Pear Tarte Tatin
Ingredients: ['1 (15 ounce) package ready-to-use refrigerated pie crust', '⅛ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '½ teaspoon ground ginger', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '5 firm pears', '2 tablespoons good quality bourbon whiskey', '4 tablespoons unsalted butter', '⅔ cup white sugar', '1 pinch salt']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Remove refrigerated pie crust from package, and follow manufacturer's suggestions for unrolling crust.
", 'Step 2: Set aside.
', 'Step 3: Combine nutmeg, ginger, and 2 tablespoons sugar in a small bowl.
', 'Step 4: Peel, quarter, and core 4 pears.
', 'Step 5: Slice each quarter into 3 slices, from core end to bottom, and place in a large bowl.
', 'Step 6: Cut remaining pear in half; peel, and core one half and add to the bowl.
', 'Step 7: Peel, core, and slice the other half as directed above and add to the bowl.
', 'Step 8: Drizzle pears with bourbon and sprinkle with spice-sugar mix, tossing to evenly coat.
', 'Step 9: Melt butter in a 9-inch cast-iron skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 10: Add 2/3 cup white sugar and salt to the melted butter, stirring to combine until mixture bubbles, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Place the single pear half in the center of the skillet.
', 'Step 12: Fan remaining pear slices around the center, core end to the outside of the skillet and stem end toward the center.
', 'Step 13: If possible, turn the pieces in the same direction.
', 'Step 14: Keep adding pear slices, filling in any gaps, until they are all in the skillet.
', 'Step 15: Reduce heat to medium-low.
', 'Step 16: Cook, undisturbed, until pears are fork-tender and color develops to the liquid, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 18: Place a baking sheet on a rack in the lower third of the oven.
', 'Step 19: Remove skillet from heat and place unbaked pie shell on top of the fruit, using a fork to tuck the edges of the pie shell toward the bottom of the skillet.
', 'Step 20: Place skillet on the prepared baking sheet in the preheated oven.
', 'Step 21: Reduce temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 22: Bake until crust is brown, 28 to 30 minutes.
', 'Step 23: Remove from oven.
', 'Step 24: Place a heat-safe plate, larger than the skillet, upside down over the crust.
', 'Step 25: Use oven mitts to grab the plate and skillet together and quickly flip the skillet contents onto the plate; this move is tricky and requires some forearm strength and dexterity.
', 'Step 26: After the flip, if the contents are not centered on the plate, use a spatula to gently move to the center.
', 'Step 27: Add any fruit that remained in the skillet, and drizzle any remaining liquid over the top of the tarte tatin.
', 'Step 28: Allow to sit 15-20 minutes, then serve warm.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '443.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '58.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '15.3 mg', 'fatContent': '22.1 g', 'fiberContent': '5 g', 'proteinContent': '3.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '274.3 mg', 'sugarContent': '30 g'}

Title: Easy Chocolate Creme Brulee
Ingredients: ['1 quart heavy cream', '½ cup white sugar', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '9 egg yolks', '½ cup chocolate chips', '2 tablespoons white sugar, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Set 6 (6 ounce) ramekins on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 3: Pour cream, sugar, and vanilla into a saucepan, and place over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Stir to dissolve the sugar, and heat until it begins to simmer, then remove from heat.
', 'Step 5: Place egg yolks in a large bowl, and slowly whisk in the hot cream mixture, about 2 tablespoons at a time, until you have added approximately a cup of cream to the yolks.
', 'Step 6: At this point, pour in the remaining cream, and whisk until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Stir in the chocolate chips, and set aside for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Stir the mixture until the chocolate is smooth and evenly distributed.
', 'Step 9: Pour into ramekins, and bake in preheated oven until the center is just set, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Remove from oven, and allow to cool for 45 minutes, then place into the refrigerator, and chill until cold, about 6 hours.
', 'Step 11: Place oven rack in topmost position.
', 'Step 12: Turn oven to Broil.
', 'Step 13: Sprinkle the tops of each creme brulee with sugar until evenly coated, gently pour off excess sugar.
', 'Step 14: Place ramekins onto a baking sheet, and place under the broiler until the sugar bubbles and turns a light caramel brown.
', 'Step 15: Serve immediately.
']

Title: White Bean Pate

Title: French Puff Pastry Tart with Pears and Chocolate
Ingredients: ['½ cup unsalted butter', '½ cup white sugar', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '1 cup blanched almond flour', '2 eggs', '1 sheet frozen puff pastry, thawed', '4 ounces milk chocolate, chopped', '3 pears - peeled, cored and sliced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Line a tart pan with parchment paper.
', 'Step 2: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

', 'Step 4: Whisk together the eggs and egg yolk until light and fluffy.

', 'Step 6: Whisk in the milk, vanilla extract, sifted flour, and salt, one at a time, until mixture is light and airy.
', 'Step 7: Pour the mixture over the berries to cover evenly.
', 'Step 8: Bake on center rack in preheated oven until top is golden and springs back when touched, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Cool slightly, and cut into 8 equal pieces.
', "Step 10: Dust with confectioners' sugar, and serve immediately.
"]

Title: Roasted Cod Nicoise
Ingredients: ['cooking spray', '1 ½ pounds small new red potatoes, cut into 1-inch chunks', '2 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '¼ teaspoon salt', '8 ounces thin French-style green beans, trimmed', '1 ½ teaspoons coarse-ground Dijon mustard', '⅛ teaspoon salt', '⅛ teaspoon ground black pepper', '4 (6 ounce) cod fillets', '3 tablespoons prepared black olive tapenade', '6 lemon wedges, or to taste', '1 cup grape tomatoes, halved', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line an extra-large rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.
', 'Step 3: Coat parchment with cooking spray.
', 'Step 4: Toss potatoes in a bowl with 1 1/2 tablespoon oil and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
', 'Step 5: Transfer to the prepared baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Toss green beans in bowl with remaining 1/2 tablespoon oil, mustard, remaining 1/8 teaspoon salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Push potatoes to one side of the baking sheet.
', 'Step 8: Lay beans and fish separately on the other side.
', 'Step 9: Spread 3/4 tablespoon tapenade on each fillet.
', 'Step 10: Bake until cod is no longer translucent and flakes easily with a fork, 12 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 11: If vegetables need more time, transfer cod to a plate and cover with foil to keep warm.
', 'Step 12: Roast vegetables 5 to 10 minutes more.
', 'Step 13: Serve with lemon wedges, tomatoes, and parsley.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '407.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '52.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '62.8 mg', 'fatContent': '10.6 g', 'fiberContent': '14.1 g', 'proteinContent': '37.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '685.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '1.3 g'}

Title: Paris-Brest
Ingredients: ['1 cup all-purpose flour', '5 eggs', '¼ cup milk', '¾ cup water', '¼ teaspoon salt', '6 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', '¼ cup sliced almonds', '1 cup heavy cream, chilled', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', "2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar"]
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place a small pan containing about 2-3 cups of hot water onto the bottom of your oven ( directly onto the bottom of the oven) to generate steam.
', 'Step 3: Lightly grease a large baking sheet with shortening and then dust lightly with flour.
', 'Step 4: Use a 10 inch pan as a template and draw a 10 inch circle onto the flour dusted sheet using a toothpick.
', 'Step 5: Set aside.
', 'Step 6: Place the 4 eggs into a small measuring cup and mix with a fork to combine, set aside.
', 'Step 7: Combine the milk, water, salt and butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: When it comes to a full boil, add the flour all at once and stir to make a paste.
', 'Step 9: Continue to stir over the heat for about 40 seconds until the paste dries a little.
', 'Step 10: Remove from heat and place paste into a mixing bowl.
', 'Step 11: Let cool about 4 minutes.
', 'Step 12: With a mixer on low, mix the paste and slowly add the beaten eggs.
', 'Step 13: Mix slowly but thoroughly until all of the eggs have been added.
', 'Step 14: Place the paste into a pastry bag fitted with a 1/2 inch round decorating tip.
', 'Step 15: Pipe the paste out onto the sheet pan following the 10 inch ring you outlined.
', 'Step 16: Pipe a second ring around the inside next to this ring.
', 'Step 17: Finally, pipe another ring on top of these two rings.
', 'Step 18: Lightly paint the set of rings with the remaining 1 beaten egg and press the sliced almonds into the paste.
', 'Step 19: Place in the oven on the lowest shelf and bake at 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 20: Reduce the temperature to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and bake about 12 minutes more or until brown.
', 'Step 21: Remove form the oven and using a long serrated knife slice off the top half of the puffed ring.
', 'Step 22: Remove any bits of raw dough on the inside of the ring.
', 'Step 23: Replace the top and place back in the oven to crisp the dough, about 5 more minutes.
', 'Step 24: Cool on a rack.
', 'Step 25: To Make The Filling: Whip the pastry cream until smooth.
', 'Step 26: Place the heavy cream into a bowl along with the vanilla and beat on high until soft peaks are formed.
', "Step 27: Add in the confectioners' sugar and beat a little more.
", 'Step 28: Fold the pastry cream in with the whipped cream and transfer to a piping bag fitted with a star tip.
', 'Step 29: Pipe the cream mixture into the ring and then replace the top.
', 'Step 30: If you wish, sprinkle with additional powdered sugar.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '165.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '8.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '96.3 mg', 'fatContent': '13.1 g', 'fiberContent': '0.4 g', 'proteinContent': '3.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '71 mg', 'sugarContent': '1.4 g'}

Title: French Shrimp Salad
Ingredients: ['1 pound fresh asparagus', '¾ pound cooked shrimp - peeled and deveined', '⅓ cup mayonnaise', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '6 artichoke hearts, drained', '1 cup French dressing', '2 hard-cooked eggs, chopped', '6 sprigs fresh parsley']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cook the asparagus in boiling salted water until tender.
', 'Step 2: Remove and cool under cold water.
', 'Step 3: Reserve six stalks and cut remaining asparagus into 1 inch pieces.
', 'Step 4: Cook and clean shrimp.
', 'Step 5: Again reserve the best six and dice the remainder.
', 'Step 6: In a bowl, combine shrimp and asparagus, mix gently with mayonnaise and lemon juice.
', 'Step 7: In a separate bowl, marinate the artichoke hearts in 1 cup French dressing.
', 'Step 8: Place shrimp and asparagus in an attractive shallow bowl.
', 'Step 9: Garnish with sieved egg and arrange reserved asparagus on top to resemble the spokes of a wheel.
', 'Step 10: Drain the artichoke bottoms and garnish each with a dollop of mayonnaise, 1 whole shrimp and 1 parsley sprig.
', 'Step 11: Arrange them around the salad.
']

Title: Nut-Free Macarons
Ingredients: ["1 cup confectioners' sugar", '¾ cup coconut flour', '3 egg whites', '⅓ cup white sugar', '1 cup raspberries', '½ cup butter, softened', "1 ½ cups confectioners' sugar", '1 tablespoon heavy whipping cream']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Sift confectioners' sugar into a medium bowl.
", 'Step 2: Sift in coconut flour.
', 'Step 3: Beat egg whites in a separate bowl using an electric mixer until white and foamy.
', 'Step 4: Add white sugar slowly.
', 'Step 5: Beat until mixture is glossy and forms stiff peaks.
', 'Step 6: Sift the coconut flour mixture into the egg whites, a few tablespoons at a time, folding after each addition.
', 'Step 7: Batter should be thick and gooey and able to fall off a spoon slowly like lava.
', 'Step 8: Fit a piping bag with a coupler and a tip.
', 'Step 9: Drop piping bag tip-down into a tall glass and fold edges down around the glass.
', 'Step 10: Spoon batter into the bag.
', 'Step 11: Gather edges and twist together.
', 'Step 12: Holding the tip at a 90 degree angle, pipe batter onto a greased baking sheet to form individual macaron shells.
', 'Step 13: Tap baking sheet onto a countertop to remove air bubbles.
', 'Step 14: Let sit until dry, 15 to 60 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 16: Bake in the preheated oven until tops are firm, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Puree raspberries in a food processor, adding water if using frozen raspberries.
', 'Step 18: Strain out the seeds using a fine-mesh strainer.
', "Step 19: Beat butter and 1/2 the confectioners' sugar in a bowl using an electric mixer until combined.
", 'Step 20: Add the remaining 1/2 and beat until creamy.
', 'Step 21: Add raspberry puree and heavy cream; mix well to make the frosting.
', 'Step 22: Spoon a small amount of frosting over the flat side of a macaron shell; cap with another shell.
', 'Step 23: Repeat with the remaining filling and shells.
']

Title: Petite Blanquette de Poulet a l'Estragon (Tarragon Chicken)
Ingredients: ['1 whole onion', '1 whole clove', '6 cups water', '7 fluid ounces white wine', '1 stalk celery, cut into chunks', '1 clove garlic', '1 sprig fresh thyme', '1 sprig fresh parsley', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 (3 pound) whole chicken, cut into 8 pieces', '2 carrots, cut into chunks', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '2 ½ ounces butter', '4 ½ ounces fresh mushrooms, trimmed and halved', '1 egg yolk', '1 lemon, juiced', '3 tablespoons heavy cream', '1 sprig fresh tarragon leaves, finely chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Poke the whole clove into the onion, and place onion into a large soup pot.
', 'Step 2: Stir in water, white wine, celery, garlic, thyme, parsley, salt, and black pepper; bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Place the chicken pieces and carrots into the liquid, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove the chicken pieces to a bowl; strain the stock and reserve about 2 cups.
', 'Step 5: Discard vegetables and herbs.
', 'Step 6: Sprinkle the chicken pieces with flour.
', 'Step 7: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat, and pan-fry the chicken until golden brown, about 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 8: Remove chicken pieces; place mushrooms into the skillet, and cook, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms have just started to brown, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Return chicken to skillet; pour in enough stock to barely cover the chicken and mushrooms (about 2 cups); cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Remove chicken and mushrooms to a serving dish.
', 'Step 11: Boil the remaining liquid until reduced by half, stirring constantly, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 12: In a bowl, whisk together the egg yolk, lemon juice, and cream; remove the skillet from the heat, and gradually whisk the egg yolk mixture into the reduced stock until the sauce thickens.
', 'Step 13: Whisk in tarragon.
', 'Step 14: Serve sauce over the chicken and mushrooms.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '309.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '7.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '98.1 mg', 'fatContent': '20.9 g', 'fiberContent': '1.4 g', 'proteinContent': '17.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '9 g', 'sodiumContent': '123.5 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.7 g'}

Title: Walnut-Cream Roll
Ingredients: ['4 egg whites', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ cup white sugar', '4 egg yolks', '¼ cup sifted enriched flour', '½ cup chopped walnuts', "1 tablespoon sifted confectioners' sugar, or as needed", '1 cup cold heavy cream', '1 tablespoon white sugar, or to taste', '1 tablespoon walnut halves, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line the bottom and sides of a 15 1/2x10 1/2x1-inch jelly roll pan with waxed paper.
', 'Step 3: Beat egg whites, vanilla extract, and salt using an electric mixer in a mixing bowl until soft peaks form.
', 'Step 4: Beat in 1/2 cup white sugar gradually until combined.
', 'Step 5: Beat egg yolks in a separate bowl using an electric mixer until thick and lemon-colored.
', 'Step 6: Fold into egg white mixture.
', 'Step 7: Fold in flour and chopped walnuts carefully until combined.
', 'Step 8: Spread batter into the prepared jelly roll pan.
', 'Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until cake springs back when lightly touched and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 12 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes.
', "Step 11: Loosen sides of cake; turn out onto a towel sprinkled with sifted confectioners' sugar.
", 'Step 12: Peel off wax paper and let cool to lukewarm, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Roll cake and towel together starting at the narrow end.
', 'Step 14: Let cool completely on a wire rack, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 15: While cake cools, beat cold heavy cream and 1 tablespoon white sugar together in a mixing bowl using an electric mixer just until stiff peaks form.
', 'Step 16: Unroll cake and spread with whipped cream, reserving some for topping.
', 'Step 17: Re-roll cake and let chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Top with dollops of whipped cream and walnut halves.
', 'Step 19: Slice and serve.
']

Title: Quick Coq au Vin
Ingredients: ['1 (3 to 3 1/2 pound) whole chicken', '12 pearl onions', '½ cup water', '2 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '½ teaspoon white sugar', '4 large mushrooms, cleaned and quartered', '⅓ cup finely chopped onion', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 ½ cups dry and robust red wine (such as Syrah or Grenache)', '2 bay leaves', '1 sprig thyme, leaves picked', '¾ teaspoon salt', '¾ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '2 tablespoons red wine', '1 teaspoon potato starch', '4 slices bread, crusts removed', '2 teaspoons canola oil', '2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cut wings from the chicken, cutting at the joints into 3 pieces.
', 'Step 2: Cut the remaining chicken into 4 pieces, 2 breasts and 2 legs.
', 'Step 3: Remove skin and bones from the breasts.
', 'Step 4: Set breasts aside with the 4 meatier wing pieces.
', 'Step 5: Pull of skin from the chicken legs and remove tips from the drumsticks.
', 'Step 6: Cut down each side of the thigh bone and slide your knife under the bone to separate meat from it.
', 'Step 7: Holding the thigh bone, cut all around the joint at the knee and pull out the bones.
', 'Step 8: Add the legs to the breasts and wings.
', 'Step 9: Combine pearl onions, water, 1 tablespoon olive oil, and sugar in a large saucepan; bring to a boil and cook until water is evaporated and onions begin to fry, 2 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Continue cooking and stirring, shaking the pan occasionally, until onions are lightly browned and glazed on all sides, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add mushrooms; cook and stir for 1 minute.
', 'Step 12: Remove from heat and cover.
', 'Step 13: Heat remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; add chicken wings and cook, stirring frequently, until lightly browned on all sides, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Add the legs; cook and stir until browned, 2 to 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 15: Add breasts; cook and stir until browned, 2 minutes per side.
', 'Step 16: Transfer chicken pieces to a plate.
', 'Step 17: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 18: Place onion in the same skillet used for the chicken; cook and stir for 1 minute.
', 'Step 19: Add garlic; cook until fragrant, about 10 seconds.
', 'Step 20: Add 1 1/2 cups red wine, bay leaves, thyme, salt, and pepper; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 21: Return legs and wings to the skillet; cover and simmer gently for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 22: Add chicken breasts and simmer gently until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 6 minutes.
', 'Step 23: Stir 2 tablespoons red wine and potato starch together in a bowl until dissolved; stir into chicken mixture until sauce is thickened, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 24: Add pearl onions and mushrooms with their juices; keep warm.
', 'Step 25: Cut each slice of bread diagonally in half to form 2 triangles.
', 'Step 26: Trim each triangle into a heart shape.
', 'Step 27: Spread canola oil onto a baking sheet and press bread hearts into the oil so they are moistened on both sides.
', 'Step 28: Bake in the preheated oven until croutons are browned, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 29: Dip the tip of each crouton into the sauce; press into parsley until coated.
', 'Step 30: Cut chicken breasts and legs in half.
', 'Step 31: Serve 1 breast piece, 1 drumstick or thigh, and 1 wing per person with 2 croutons and spoonfuls of sauce and vegetables.
', 'Step 32: Sprinkle remaining parsley over chicken.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '690.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '23.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '145.5 mg', 'fatContent': '35.8 g', 'fiberContent': '2.3 g', 'proteinContent': '49.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '8.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '757.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.7 g'}

Title: Chicken Francese for One
Ingredients: ['½ cup butter', '2 skinless, boneless chicken breasts', '¼ cup lemon juice', '¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt 2 tablespoons of the butter in a medium skillet over medium high heat.
', 'Step 2: Add chicken to skillet and brown for 5 to 7 minutes, turning occasionally.
', 'Step 3: When chicken is browned, add remaining 6 tablespoons of butter and the lemon juice (if desired, add extra lemon juice to taste).
', 'Step 4: Saute for 6 minutes over medium heat, then remove chicken from skillet.
', 'Step 5: Add cheese to skillet, stir all together until mixture has reached the consistency of a sauce, then pour the sauce over the chicken and serve hot.
']

Title: French Onion Soup with Port Wine
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons butter', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '6 white onions, sliced into thin rings', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 pinch salt', '1 ½ teaspoons ground black pepper', '1 tablespoon brown sugar', '1 tablespoon dried thyme', '⅓ cup port wine', '1 (32 ounce) carton beef stock', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '5 slices French bread', '5 slices Swiss cheese', '¼ cup shredded Parmagiano-Reggiano cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt the butter with the olive oil in a large pot over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 2: Add the onion slices and garlic to the pot; season with a pinch of salt and black pepper.
', 'Step 3: Cook the onions in the oil mixture until caramelized, stirring every 10 minutes to keep from browning too quickly, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 4: Stir the brown sugar and thyme into the caramelized onions; allow the sugar to melt into the onion mixture, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Pour the wine over the onions and bring to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food off of the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon; continue simmering another 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add the beef stock; cook together another 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Season to taste with more salt and pepper, if desired.
', "Step 8: Preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 9: Ladle the soup into 5 oven-safe crocks arranged onto a baking sheet.
', 'Step 10: Top the soup with a slice of French bread; cover with a slice of Swiss cheese and sprinkle with some of the Parmagiano-Reggiano cheese.
', 'Step 11: Melt the cheese under the broiler until browned, 2 to 3 minutes.
']

Title: Little French Fudge Cakes
Ingredients: ['1 (4 ounce) bittersweet chocolate bar, chopped', '1 ½ (1 ounce) squares unsweetened chocolate, chopped', '5 tablespoons unsalted butter', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract', '2 eggs', '1 egg yolk', '¾ cup white sugar', '⅛ teaspoon salt', '3 tablespoons organic all-purpose flour', '½ (4 ounce) bittersweet chocolate bar, broken into 1/2-inch pieces']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease 6 cupcake cups, preferably in a dark-colored metal pan.
', 'Step 3: Place 1 chopped bar of bittersweet chocolate, unsweetened chocolate, and butter in a microwave-safe bowl; place bowl in microwave, and cook on low power until the butter has melted and the chocolate is soft, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Check and stir often to avoid burning the chocolate.
', 'Step 5: Stir until smooth.
', 'Step 6: In a mixing bowl, whisk cinnamon, vanilla extract, eggs, egg yolk, sugar, and salt until thoroughly combined, and stir in the flour just until blended.
', 'Step 7: Mix in the chocolate mixture, stir the batter a few times until smooth, and lightly mix in the 1/2 bar of bittersweet chocolate broken into 1/2-inch pieces.
', 'Step 8: Spoon batter into the prepared cupcake cups, filling them about 3/4 full.
', 'Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted into the center of a cake comes out with streaks of thick batter, about 18 minutes.
', 'Step 10: The tops of the cakes should be almost firm.
', 'Step 11: Allow to cool in the pan on a rack for 5 to 10 minutes to serve warm, or 20 minutes to serve at room temperature.
']

Ingredients: ['¼ cup butter', '4 large onions, thinly sliced', '4 cups beef broth', '1 clove garlic, minced', 'salt and ground black pepper, to taste']

', 'Step 2: Cook and stir onions in melted butter until clear and browned, 10 to 15 minutes; transfer to a slow cooker.

Title: Blueberry Buttermilk Clafoutis

Title: Pumpkin Brulee
Ingredients: ['4 cups heavy cream', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '16 each egg yolks', '¼ cup brown sugar', '¾ cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground ginger', '⅛ teaspoon ground cloves', '1 cup canned pumpkin puree', '¼ cup white sugar']

['Step 1: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat the cream and vanilla in a large, heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat; bring to a simmer.

', 'Step 12: Serve immediately.
']

Title: Creme Brulee Pancakes
Ingredients: ['1 egg', '3 tablespoons butter, melted', '1 tablespoon vanilla extract', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '1 ¼ cups milk', '¼ cup heavy cream', '1 ½ cups all-purpose flour', '3 ½ teaspoons baking powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '¼ cup white sugar', '2 tablespoons brown sugar', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon butter, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk egg with 3 tablespoons melted butter, vanilla extract, and 1 tablespoon white sugar in a bowl until thoroughly combined; whisk in milk and cream.
', 'Step 2: Sift flour with baking powder and salt in a separate bowl; stir flour mixture into liquid ingredients to make a smooth batter.
', 'Step 3: Stir 1/4 cup white sugar with brown sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl.
', 'Step 4: Melt 1 teaspoon butter in a skillet over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 5: Scoop up about 3 tablespoons of batter and pour into skillet.
', 'Step 6: Sprinkle top of pancake with about 2 teaspoons of cinnamon sugar in an even layer; cook pancake until bottom is golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Flip pancake over onto sugared side and cook until the cinnamon sugar melts into a crust, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Repeat with remaining batter and cinnamon sugar.
', 'Step 9: Let pancakes cool without stacking to avoid softening the sugar crust.
']

Title: Creamy Coq au Vin Blanc
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons olive oil', '4 bone-in chicken thighs with skin', '1 tablespoon Italian seasoning', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '1 (6 ounce) package portobello mushroom caps', '1 tomato, sliced', '2 tablespoons white cooking wine, or to taste', '1 cup heavy whipping cream', '¼ cup shredded Gruyere cheese', '1 tablespoon cornstarch', '1 tablespoon water', '1 cup chopped sweet onion']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat olive oil in a nonstick pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add chicken thighs, Italian seasoning, and garlic; cook until chicken is browned on both sides, about 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 3: Mix mushrooms and tomato into chicken mixture; reduce heat, cover pot, and cook until mushrooms are softened, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Grease a baking dish.
', 'Step 6: Drain accumulated juices from chicken-mushroom-tomato mixture into a separate saucepan and transfer chicken-mushroom-tomato mixture to the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 7: Pour wine into saucepan with juices and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 8: Add cream and Gruyere cheese; cook and stir until cheese is melted and sauce is smooth, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Stir cornstarch and water together in a small bowl until cornstarch is dissolved; mix into cream sauce until smooth and thickened.
', 'Step 10: Pour sauce over chicken-vegetable mixture; top with onion.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 12: An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '569.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '12 g', 'cholesterolContent': '161.5 mg', 'fatContent': '46.9 g', 'fiberContent': '2.3 g', 'proteinContent': '24.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '20 g', 'sodiumContent': '121.5 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.6 g'}

Title: Braseltouille - Meatatarian Ratatouille
Ingredients: ['1 pound spicy ground sausage', '1 tablespoon sausage drippings', '1 green bell pepper, chopped', '½ white onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 zucchini, halved lengthwise and sliced', '3 yellow squash, halved lengthwise and sliced', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 tablespoon Italian seasoning', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir sausage in a large skillet over medium heat until sausage is crumbly and no longer pink, about 10 minutes; drain excess grease, reserving 1 tablespoon of the pan drippings.
', 'Step 3: Transfer drained sausage to a large bowl and set aside.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir green bell pepper, onion, and garlic in the pan drippings until green pepper is soft, about 8 minutes; transfer to bowl containing sausage.
', 'Step 5: Swirl olive oil in the hot skillet and cook and stir zucchini and yellow squash in hot oil until slightly softened, about 8 minutes; stir in tomatoes and Italian seasoning.
', 'Step 6: Season with salt and black pepper.
', 'Step 7: Bring the mixture to a boil and simmer until squash are tender, 10 to 15 more minutes.
', 'Step 8: Stir sausage and vegetables into skillet, raise heat to high, and bring mixture to a boil.
', 'Step 9: Reduce heat to medium and cook, stirring often, until the liquid has reduced, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Spread the mixture into a 9x13-inch baking dish and sprinkle Cheddar cheese over the top.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until the mixture is bubbly and the cheese has melted and begun to brown, 25 to 30 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '314.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '11.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '60.5 mg', 'fatContent': '22.3 g', 'fiberContent': '3.7 g', 'proteinContent': '17.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '9.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '711.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.4 g'}

Title: French Chocolate Cake
Ingredients: ['½ cup white sugar', '10 (1 ounce) squares semi-sweet chocolate', '¾ cup unsalted butter, cubed', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '5 eggs, separated', '¼ cup sifted all-purpose flour', '1 dash cream of tartar', 'salt to taste', "½ tablespoon confectioners' sugar, for dusting"]
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Generously grease a 9-inch springform cake tin.
', 'Step 3: Dust with a little sugar, and tap out the excess.
', 'Step 4: Set aside 3 tablespoons of the sugar.
', 'Step 5: Place the chocolate, butter, and remaining sugar in a large, heavy-based pan.
', 'Step 6: Cook over moderate heat until the chocolate and butter have melted, and the sugar has dissolved.
', 'Step 7: Remove the pan from heat.
', 'Step 8: Stir in the vanilla, and leave the mixture to cool slightly.
', 'Step 9: Beat the egg yolks into the chocolate mixture one at a time, beating well after each addition.
', 'Step 10: Stir in the flour.
', 'Step 11: In a large bowl, scrupulously clean and grease-free, beat the egg whites until foamy.
', 'Step 12: Add the cream of tartar and salt, and beat to stiff peaks.
', 'Step 13: Sprinkle reserved sugar over egg whites, and beat until stiff and glossy.
', 'Step 14: Use a whisk or spatula to fold 1/3 of the egg whites into the chocolate mixture, then carefully fold in the remaining whites.
', 'Step 15: Carefully pour batter into the prepared tin, and tap the tin gently to release air bubbles.
', 'Step 16: Bake until well risen and a skewer inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, for about 45 minutes to 1 hour.
', 'Step 17: Check the cake after 30 minutes: if the cake appears to rise unevenly, rotate after 30 to 35 minutes.
', 'Step 18: If the cake starts to crack or become too brown, place a piece of foil lightly over the top.
', 'Step 19: Transfer the cake to a wire cooling rack, and remove the sides of the springform tin.
', 'Step 20: Cool completely, and then remove the base.
', "Step 21: Do not attempt to remove the cake before it's completely cooled as this cake is very fragile.
"]
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '293.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '24.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '108 mg', 'fatContent': '21.1 g', 'fiberContent': '1.7 g', 'proteinContent': '4.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '12.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '30.9 mg', 'sugarContent': '20.6 g'}

Title: Vanilla Blancmange
Ingredients: ['½ cup white sugar', '3 tablespoons cornstarch', '⅛ teaspoon salt', '2 cups milk', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine sugar, cornstarch, and salt together in a saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Slowly add milk while stirring.
', 'Step 3: Bring to a simmer over low heat and cook for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Stir in vanilla extract and pour into four 1/2-cup custard cups.
', 'Step 5: Refrigerate until thickened, about 1 hour.
']

Title: Parisian-Style Steak Frites
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon vegetable oil, or as needed', '2 hanger steaks', '2 tablespoons minced shallot', '¼ cup dry white wine', '¼ cup beef broth', '2 anchovy fillets, chopped, or more to taste', '3 tablespoons butter', '1 tablespoon minced fresh parsley', '1 tablespoon minced fresh chervil', '1 teaspoon minced fresh thyme']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat vegetable oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook steaks to desired doneness, about 5 minutes per side for medium; an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 130 degrees F (54 degrees C).
', 'Step 3: Transfer steaks to a plate to rest.
', 'Step 4: Place shallots in the skillet and cook until beginning to soften, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Pour wine into the skillet and bring to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food off of the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon.
', 'Step 6: Add broth and anchovy; cook until thickened to sauce consistency, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove skillet from heat; whisk butter in gradually.
', 'Step 8: Stir parsley, chervil, and thyme into the sauce.
', 'Step 9: Puree sauce in the skillet with an immersion blender until smooth.
', 'Step 10: Cut steaks into thin slices across the grain; spoon sauce over slices.
']

Title: Easy Pots de Creme
Ingredients: ['5 egg yolks', '5 tablespoons white sugar', '¼ teaspoon salt', '¾ cup heavy cream', '½ cup half-and-half', '10 ounces bittersweet chocolate, finely chopped', '1 tablespoon vanilla extract', '1 cup very strong, very hot coffee']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine egg yolks, sugar, and salt in a blender.
', 'Step 2: Blend until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Add heavy cream and half-and-half; blend again.
', 'Step 4: Add chocolate and vanilla extract and blend until chocolate is very finely chopped.
', 'Step 5: Carefully pour hot coffee through the opening while blender is running; blend until chocolate is melted and smooth.
', 'Step 6: Pour mixture into small serving dishes.
', 'Step 7: Let cool to room temperature.
', 'Step 8: Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 3 hours and up to 3 days.
']

Title: Opera Cake
Ingredients: ['6 large egg whites, at room temperature', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '2 cups almond flour', "2 cups confectioners' sugar, sifted", '4 large eggs', '2 large egg yolks', '½ cup all-purpose flour', '½ cup boiling water', '⅓ cup white sugar', '1 ½ tablespoons instant coffee powder', '2 tablespoons boiling water', '2 tablespoons instant coffee powder', '1 cup white sugar', '¼ cup water', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 large egg', '1 large egg yolk', '14 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature', '8 ounces dark chocolate, finely chopped', '½ cup whole milk', '¼ cup heavy cream', '4 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line 2 jelly roll pans with parchment paper.
', 'Step 3: Beat egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until soft peaks form.
', 'Step 4: Slowly add white sugar and whip on high speed until the whites are stiff and glossy.
', "Step 5: Beat almond flour, confectioners' sugar, eggs, and egg yolks in a separate bowl for 3 minutes.
", 'Step 6: Add flour and beat on low speed until combined.
', 'Step 7: Gently fold egg whites into the almond mixture until combined.
', 'Step 8: Divide batter between the jelly roll pans; spread evenly.
', 'Step 9: Bake cake layers in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Invert onto cooling racks and peel off parchment paper; let cool.
', 'Step 11: Make coffee syrup while cake is cooling.
', 'Step 12: Combine boiling water, sugar, and coffee powder in a small bowl; stir until dissolved.
', 'Step 13: Stir 2 tablespoons boiling water and coffee powder together for the buttercream.
', 'Step 14: Set aside.
', 'Step 15: Combine sugar, 1/4 cup water, and vanilla extract in a small saucepan.
', 'Step 16: Bring to a boil.
', 'Step 17: Cook, without stirring, until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the mixture reaches 255 degrees F (124 degrees C).
', 'Step 18: Meanwhile, beat egg and egg yolk in a stand mixer on high speed until pale and foamy.
', 'Step 19: Pour hot sugar syrup carefully down the side of the mixer bowl, mixing continuously until the bottom of the bowl feels cool to the touch.
', 'Step 20: Beat butter in a separate bowl until creamy.
', 'Step 21: Add butter gradually to the egg mixture, beating until frosting is fluffy.
', 'Step 22: Add the dissolved coffee mixture and beat until well incorporated.
', 'Step 23: Place dark chocolate in a heat-proof bowl.
', 'Step 24: Bring milk and cream to a boil in a saucepan.
', 'Step 25: Pour over chocolate; stir until melted and smooth.
', 'Step 26: Whisk in butter until ganache looks smooth and creamy.
', 'Step 27: Let cool.
', 'Step 28: Cut cooled cake layers in half crosswise.
', 'Step 29: Place 1 piece on a rectangular serving plate.
', 'Step 30: Sprinkle some coffee syrup on top.
', 'Step 31: Add an even layer of buttercream.
', 'Step 32: Repeat with a second cake layer, more coffee syrup, and another layer of buttercream.
', 'Step 33: Spread 1/2 of the ganache on top.
', 'Step 34: Repeat with remaining, cake layers, coffee syrup, and buttercream.
', 'Step 35: Top cake with remaining ganache.
']

Title: Pan Bagnat (Pressed French Tuna Sandwich)
Ingredients: ['1 clove garlic, minced', '⅓ cup extra-virgin olive oil', '1 loaf day-old crusty French bread, split in half lengthwise', '2 medium ripe tomatoes, sliced, divided', '1 pinch freshly ground black pepper to taste', '1 pinch salt to taste', '⅓ cup thinly sliced red onion', '⅓ cup sliced green olives', '⅓ cup sliced black olives', '½ cup thinly sliced banana peppers', '1 ½ cups olive oil-packed tuna, broken into large chunks', '8 oil-packed anchovy fillets', '1 tablespoon drained capers', '2 medium hard-boiled eggs, sliced', '¼ cup fresh basil leaves, or to taste', '2 tablespoons white wine vinegar, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Stir garlic into the olive oil and set aside.
', 'Step 2: Partially hollow out the bread by pulling out about 50% of the insides.
', 'Step 3: Brush the bread very generously with the garlic olive oil, reserving about 1 tablespoon for later use.
', 'Step 4: Begin building the sandwich by placing a layer of sliced tomatoes on the bottom half, covering it completely.
', 'Step 5: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 6: Top with sliced onion, olives, and banana peppers.
', 'Step 7: Crumble the tuna over the top, pressing down slightly so it stays in place.
', 'Step 8: Be sure to go as close to the edges as possible.
', 'Step 9: Top with anchovy filets, capers, sliced eggs, and basil leaves.
', 'Step 10: Top with another layer of tomatoes.
', 'Step 11: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 12: Drizzle with vinegar and reserved garlic olive oil.
', 'Step 13: Place the top half of the loaf on and press firmly to compress the ingredients.
', 'Step 14: Wrap in several layers of plastic wrap, then with aluminum foil, ending with seams at the top.
', 'Step 15: Place into a large pan and place a sheet pan over the top.
', 'Step 16: Weigh down with heavy cans, pots, a cast iron pan, or a cutting board, to press the sandwich as evenly as possible.
', 'Step 17: Place in the refrigerator for at least 8 hours, or up to overnight, turning halfway through if possible.
', 'Step 18: Unwrap, slice, and serve.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '561.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '46.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '105.2 mg', 'fatContent': '30.1 g', 'fiberContent': '3.3 g', 'proteinContent': '26.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '5 g', 'sodiumContent': '1286.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.8 g'}

Title: Salmon en Croute
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '½ onion, chopped', '1 cup chopped fresh mushrooms', '2 teaspoons minced garlic, divided', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 cup baby spinach', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour, or as needed', '2 sheets frozen puff pastry (such as Pepperidge Farm®), thawed', '1 (1 1/2-pound) boned, skinned salmon fillet', '½ teaspoon smoked paprika, or more to taste', '1 egg, beaten', '½ cup mayonnaise', '2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', '2 teaspoons Dijon mustard', '½ teaspoon dried dill']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add onion; cook and stir until translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add mushrooms and 1 teaspoon garlic; cook and stir until mushrooms are soft, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Season with salt and black pepper.
', 'Step 5: Transfer onion and mushroom mixture to a small bowl.
', 'Step 6: Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in the same skillet.
', 'Step 7: Add remaining 1 teaspoon garlic; cook and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 8: Add spinach; cook and stir until wilted, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Season with salt and black pepper.
', 'Step 10: Transfer to another bowl.
', 'Step 11: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 12: Line a glass baking dish with parchment paper.
', 'Step 13: Dust work surface with flour.
', 'Step 14: Lay 1 puff pastry sheet out on work surface.
', 'Step 15: Spread onion and mushroom mixture evenly across pastry, leaving a 1/2-inch border.
', 'Step 16: Center salmon on top.
', 'Step 17: Sprinkle paprika over salmon and top with wilted spinach.
', 'Step 18: Cover with second puff pastry sheet.
', 'Step 19: Fold over and crimp edges to seal.
', 'Step 20: Brush top with beaten egg.
', 'Step 21: Transfer to baking dish.
', 'Step 22: Bake in the preheated oven until pastry is golden, 40 to 45 minutes.
', 'Step 23: Remove and let stand for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 24: Slice into 4 portions.
', 'Step 25: Whisk mayonnaise, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, and dill together in a small bowl.
', 'Step 26: Spoon sauce onto 4 plates and place a piece of salmon on each.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '1205.9 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '60.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '131.6 mg', 'fatContent': '85.7 g', 'fiberContent': '2.6 g', 'proteinContent': '47.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '18.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '652.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.4 g'}

Title: Blue Cheese, Bacon and Chive Stuffed Pork Chops
Ingredients: ['2 boneless pork loin chops, butterflied', '4 ounces crumbled blue cheese', '2 slices bacon - cooked and crumbled', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives', 'garlic salt to taste', 'ground black pepper to taste', 'chopped fresh parsley for garnish']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a shallow baking dish.
', 'Step 3: In a small bowl, mix together the blue cheese, bacon and chives.
', 'Step 4: Divide into halves, and pack each half into a loose ball.
', 'Step 5: Place each one into a pocket of a butterflied pork chop, close, and secure with toothpicks.
', 'Step 6: Season each chop with garlic salt and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Keep in mind that the blue cheese will be salty.
', 'Step 8: Place in the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 9: Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or it may take longer if your chops are thicker.
', 'Step 10: Cook until the stuffing is hot, and chops are to your desired degree of doneness.
', 'Step 11: Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.
']

Title: Chai Latte Creme Brulee
Ingredients: ['2 cups heavy whipping cream', '1 cup half-and-half', '1 vanilla bean, split and scraped', '4 chai tea bags', '1 extra large egg', '4 extra large egg yolks', '½ cup white sugar', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon ground cardamom', '¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '¼ teaspoon ground allspice', '¼ cup white sugar, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk cream, half-and-half, scraped vanilla seeds, and vanilla pod in a saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Place over medium heat and bring just to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Remove from heat and add chai tea bags to the cream mixture; cover and let steep for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Squeeze tea bags and discard; discard spent vanilla bean pod.
', 'Step 5: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Whisk egg, egg yolks, and 1/2 cup sugar in a bowl until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Slowly whisk in cream mixture, followed by cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, nutmeg, and allspice.
', 'Step 8: Spoon cream mixture into 6 6-ounce ramekins.
', 'Step 9: Bring a pot of water to a boil.
', 'Step 10: Place ramekins in a baking pan and carefully pour enough boiling water into the pan to reach halfway up the sides of the ramekins.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until the desserts are softly set, 35 to 40 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Remove ramekins from the water bath and refrigerate for 4 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 13: Sprinkle each dessert with about 1 1/2 teaspoon sugar in an even layer.
', 'Step 14: Use a kitchen torch to lightly brown and caramelize the sugar, about 1 minute; let the hot topping cool and harden before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '493.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '32.7 g', 'cholesterolContent': '328.2 mg', 'fatContent': '38.7 g', 'fiberContent': '0.2 g', 'proteinContent': '6.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '22.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '67.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '27.6 g'}

Title: Far Breton
Ingredients: ['9 ounces pitted prunes', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '⅝ cup white sugar', '1 tablespoon vanilla sugar', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 pinch salt', '4 eggs', '3 cups whole milk', '2 tablespoons rum']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a shallow 2 quart baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Place the pitted prunes in a saucepan with enough water to cover.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a simmer, and cook until the prunes are tender but still hold their shape, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drain the prunes and arrange them in the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 6: Whisk together the flour, white sugar, vanilla sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl.
', 'Step 7: Whisk in the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
', 'Step 8: Gradually pour in the milk, stirring vigorously with a wooden spoon until combined.
', 'Step 9: Stir in the rum.
', 'Step 10: Pour the batter evenly over the prunes.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Reduce the oven temperature to 400 degrees F, and bake until the filling is firm, has risen a little, and the top is browned, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Serve warm or at room temperature.
']

Title: Impossible French Apple Pie
Ingredients: ['6 cups tart apples - peeled, cored and sliced', '1 ¼ teaspoons ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '1 cup white sugar', '¾ cup milk', '½ cup biscuit mix (e.g. Bisquick)', '2 eggs', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 cup biscuit mix (e.g. Bisquick)', '½ cup chopped walnuts', '⅓ cup light brown sugar', '3 tablespoons butter']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 10 inch pie pan.
', 'Step 3: In a large bowl, mix apples, cinnamon and nutmeg together; turn mixture into pan.
', 'Step 4: In a separate bowl, beat sugar, milk, 1/2 cup biscuit mix, eggs and butter until smooth.
', 'Step 5: Pour over apples.
', 'Step 6: To Make Streusel: In a small bowl, stir together 1 cup biscuit mix, nuts, brown sugar and butter; mix until crumbly.
', 'Step 7: Sprinkle streusel over top of pie.
', 'Step 8: Bake in preheated oven for 55 to 60 minutes; bake until knife inserted in center of pie comes out clean.
']

Title: Banana Souffle
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon unsalted butter, melted', '2 teaspoons white sugar', '2 egg whites', '2 eggs, separated', '1 pinch salt', '2 ripe bananas, mashed', '1 tablespoon honey, or more to taste', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '½ teaspoon grated fresh ginger root', '1 tablespoon sweetened cocoa powder']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Brush 4 1-cup souffle dishes with melted butter; sprinkle the insides of the cups with sugar.
', 'Step 3: Set the egg yolks aside, and place the 4 egg whites into the work bowl of an electric mixer.
', 'Step 4: Beat the egg whites and salt until the whites form soft peaks.
', 'Step 5: Place the 2 egg yolks, bananas, honey, vanilla extract, and ginger into a blender; pulse until smooth.
', 'Step 6: Scoop the banana mixture into a bowl; use a rubber spatula or wire whisk to gently fold 1/4 of the beaten egg whites into the banana mixture.
', 'Step 7: Gently run the spatula through the center of the bowl, then around the sides of the bowl, repeating until fully incorporated.
', 'Step 8: Fold in the remaining egg whites, being careful to keep as much air in the mixture as possible.
', 'Step 9: Spoon the souffle mixture into the prepared dishes; bake in the preheated oven until the souffles have puffed up above the baking dishes and the tops are browned, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Sift a little sweetened cocoa powder over each souffle for garnish to serve.
']

Title: Slow Cooker Onion Soup
Ingredients: ['¼ cup butter, melted', '1 large sweet onion (such as Vidalia®), cut into thin slivers', '1 small red onion, cut into thin slivers', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '4 cups beef stock', '3 tablespoons brandy', '2 teaspoons soy sauce', '2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 cups Italian-style seasoned croutons', '3 slices provolone cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir sweet onion and red onion in melted butter until softened, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir garlic into onion mixture until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Transfer to a slow cooker.
', 'Step 4: Pour beef stock, brandy, soy sauce, and Worcestershire sauce into slow cooker.
', 'Step 5: Season with salt and black pepper.
', 'Step 6: Cook soup on High for 4 to 5 hours.
', "Step 7: Preheat the oven's broiler and set the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source.
", 'Step 8: Ladle the soup into 3 oven-proof bowls; top with croutons and a slice of Provolone per bowl.
', 'Step 9: Broil in the preheated oven until cheese melts and begins to brown, about 3 minutes.
']

Title: Boeuf en Croute
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon olive oil', '2 (6 ounce) beef tenderloin filets', '1 tablespoon butter', '8 ounces fresh white mushrooms, minced', '⅓ cup minced shallot', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 tablespoons red wine', '4 6-inch squares of frozen puff pastry, thawed but still cold', '1 ½ cups red wine', 'salt and pepper to taste', '1 egg', '2 tablespoons milk']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the olive oil in a heavy skillet over high heat until very hot.
', 'Step 2: Sear the filets until well-browned on both sides, 1 to 2 minutes per side.
', 'Step 3: Remove the filets from the skillet, and chill in refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
', 'Step 4: Filets must be cold.
', 'Step 5: In the same skillet over medium heat, melt the butter, and cook and stir the mushrooms, shallot, and garlic until the shallots are tender and translucent and the mushrooms have given off their juice, 6 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir in 2 tablespoons of red wine, scraping and dissolving any browned flavor bits from the pan.
', 'Step 7: Transfer the mushroom mix into a bowl, and chill in refrigerator for about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Place 2 pieces of puff pastry on a work surface, and top each with a chilled filet.
', 'Step 9: Spread half the mushroom mixture in a neat layer on top of of each filet, and top each with a piece of puff pastry.
', 'Step 10: Fold and pinch the edges of the pastry together, sealing in the contents, and trim to make a tidy package.
', 'Step 11: Cut a small slit into the top of each package.
', 'Step 12: Pour 1 1/2 cups of red wine into a saucepan over medium heat, and simmer until the wine is reduce by half, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Season wine sauce to taste with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 14: Meanwhile, whisk egg into milk in a bowl, and brush the pasty packages with the egg mixture for a browner crust, if desired.
', 'Step 15: Return the bundles to the refrigerator to keep cold.
', 'Step 16: Preheat an oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 17: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
', 'Step 18: Place the puff pastry bundles onto the prepared baking sheet, and bake in the preheated oven until the pastry is golden brown and crisp and the filets are the desired degree of doneness (for medium-rare, about 15 minutes; an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 130 degrees F (54 degrees C)).
', 'Step 19: Serve each filet in the pastry shell with spoonfuls of wine sauce on top.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '3273.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '232.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '195.9 mg', 'fatContent': '215.3 g', 'fiberContent': '8.6 g', 'proteinContent': '68.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '59.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '1358.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '8.4 g'}

Title: Grandma Oakley's Chocolate Blancmange
Ingredients: ['2 (1 ounce) squares bitter chocolate', '2 tablespoons butter', '¾ cup white sugar', '⅓ cup cornstarch', '¼ teaspoon salt', '3 cups milk', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine chocolate and butter in the top of a saucepan placed over a pot of simmering water; simmer over medium heat until melted, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Combine sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a bowl; stir in about 1/4 cup milk.
', 'Step 3: Add mixture to melted chocolate and blend thoroughly.
', 'Step 4: Add remaining milk.
', 'Step 5: Place saucepan over direct heat and cook, stirring constantly, until mixture boils and thickens.
', 'Step 6: , about 1 minute more.
', 'Step 7: Return saucepan to the pot of boiling water, cover, and cook 15 minutes longer, stirring occasionally.
', 'Step 8: Remove saucepan from heat and stir in vanilla extract.
', 'Step 9: Cool in refrigerator about 3 hours to overnight before serving.
']

Title: Alsatian Pork and Sauerkraut
Ingredients: ['4 slices bacon, cut into 1-inch pieces', '1 onion, chopped', '1 (16 ounce) can sauerkraut, drained', '1 ½ tablespoons dark brown sugar', '4 cups chicken broth, plus more if needed', '3 potatoes, quartered', '1 large Granny Smith apple, cored and sliced', '12 juniper berries', '6 whole black peppercorns', '2 whole cloves', '1 sprig fresh parsley', '1 bay leaf', '4 (6 ounce) boneless pork chops, 1/2 inch thick', '1 pound kielbasa sausage, cut into 3-inch pieces']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the bacon in a large, deep pot, and cook over medium-high heat, stirring to turn pieces occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Drain the bacon pieces on a paper towel-lined plate.
', 'Step 3: With a paper towel, wipe the bacon grease out of the pot but keep as much of the brown bits as possible.
', 'Step 4: Stir in the onion, sauerkraut, brown sugar, and chicken broth, stirring to dissolve the sugar.
', 'Step 5: Add the potatoes and apple slices.
', 'Step 6: Place the juniper berries, peppercorns, cloves, parsley, and bay leaf into a small cheesecloth square, and tie the ends together to make a spice bag (or place the spices into a stainless steel tea ball).
', 'Step 7: Place the spice bag into the pot, and add the pork chops and kielbasa sausage pieces.
', 'Step 8: Add more chicken broth, if needed, to just cover the ingredients.
', 'Step 9: Bring the pot to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer until the potatoes are very tender, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 10: To serve, use a slotted spoon to remove the sauerkraut, potatoes, and apple slices to the center of a serving platter.
', 'Step 11: Arrange bacon, pork chops, and kielbasa pieces around the outside of the platter.
']

Title: Brandied Cherry Clafouti
Ingredients: ['2 cups canned tart cherries, drained', '¼ cup brandy', '⅔ cup white sugar, divided', 'cooking spray (such as Pam®)', '1 cup milk', '⅔ cup sifted all-purpose flour', '3 large eggs', '1 tablespoon vanilla extract', '1 tablespoon lemon zest', '¼ teaspoon salt', '⅛ teaspoon allspice', "1 teaspoon confectioners' sugar, or as needed"]
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix cherries, brandy, and 1/3 cup white sugar in a bowl; let soak for 1 hour.
', 'Step 2: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 3: Spray a 9-inch pie pan with cooking spray.
', 'Step 4: Remove cherries from brandy mixture using a slotted spoon and transfer to the prepared pie pan.
', 'Step 5: Pour brandy mixture into a blender; add remaining 1/3 cup sugar, milk, flour, eggs, vanilla extract, lemon zest, salt, and allspice to the blender.
', 'Step 6: Pulse mixture until batter is smooth; pour over cherries.
', 'Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and continue baking until golden and puffy, 45 to 50 minutes.
', "Step 9: Cool slightly and dust with confectioners' sugar to serve.
"]

Title: Favorite Apple Galette
Ingredients: ['1 ⅛ cups all-purpose flour', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '¼ teaspoon salt', '½ cup butter, cut into pieces', '2 tablespoons ice water, or as needed', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '¼ cup brown sugar, or more to taste', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '5 apples - peeled, cored, and sliced', '2 tablespoons butter, cut into pieces', '1 tablespoon coarse sugar crystals']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk 1 1/8 cups flour, white sugar, and salt together in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Press 1/2 cup butter pieces into flour mixture with your fingers until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
', 'Step 3: Make a well in the center of the flour mixture.
', 'Step 4: Pour water and vanilla into well; quickly work water and vanilla into flour to create a loose dough, adding more water if the dough is crumbly.
', 'Step 5: You should be able to squeeze it in your hand and have it stay together but be a bit crumbly.
', 'Step 6: Shape dough into a flat disc, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Stir brown sugar, 1 tablespoon flour, and cinnamon together in a bowl.
', 'Step 8: Add apples and toss to coat.
', 'Step 9: Let sit for flavors to blend, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 11: Roll dough out into a large, rough circle on a baking stone or baking sheet.
', 'Step 12: Pour apple mixture into the center of the dough, leaving a 2-inch uncovered border, and dot apples with 1 tablespoon butter.
', 'Step 13: Fold edges of dough up over the apples, leaving an opening in the center.
', 'Step 14: Dot dough with remaining 1 tablespoon butter and sprinkle coarse sugar over the dough.
', 'Step 15: Bake in the preheated oven until the crust is crisp and golden and apples are tender and caramelized, 40 to 45 minutes.
']

Title: Cali's Sinful Creme Brulee
Ingredients: ['½ cup semi-sweet chocolate chips', '2 cups heavy cream', '¼ cup white sugar', '1 pinch salt', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '5 egg yolks', '4 tablespoons white sugar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place about 2 tablespoons of the chocolate chips into each of four 6 ounce ramekins.
', 'Step 3: Place them in the microwave, and heat on full power for 30 second intervals.
', 'Step 4: Stir, and continue heating until chocolate has melted.
', 'Step 5: Spread to cover the sides and bottom of each ramekin.
', 'Step 6: Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
', 'Step 7: Meanwhile, in a saucepan, whisk together the cream, 1/4 cup sugar, and salt.
', 'Step 8: Set over medium heat, and warm until steam rises from the surface.
', 'Step 9: Then in a separate bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and vanilla.
', 'Step 10: When the cream is hot, ladle a little bit into the egg yolks while whisking quickly.
', 'Step 11: Ladle in a bit more to bring the yolks up to a high temperature without scrambling them.
', 'Step 12: Whisk the yolk mixture into the rest of the cream.
', 'Step 13: Ladle into the chocolate lined ramekins.
', 'Step 14: Place a towel in the bottom of a baking dish, and place the filled ramekins on top of the towel.
', 'Step 15: Place in the oven, and pour boiling water carefully into the baking dish until it comes half way up the sides of the ramekins.
', 'Step 16: Cover the dish loosely with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 17: Bake for 35 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven, just until the custard is set.
', 'Step 18: Remove ramekins from the dish, and refrigerate for 4 to 6 hours.
', 'Step 19: Before serving, sprinkle 1 tablespoon of sugar over the top of each creme brulee.
', "Step 20: Use a kitchen torch or your oven's broiler to caramelize the sugar.
", 'Step 21: It may take 2 to 3 minutes in the broiler.
', 'Step 22: Serve immediately.
']

Title: Chewy French Baguette
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon white sugar', '1 ½ cups hot water', '2 teaspoons active dry yeast', '3 ¾ cups all-purpose flour, or more as needed', '1 ½ teaspoons salt', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Dissolve sugar into the hot water in a 2-cup measure; add yeast and stir gently.
', 'Step 2: Let dissolve until top is foamy, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Whisk flour and salt together in a large bowl.
', 'Step 4: Make a well in the center and pour in the yeast mixture.
', 'Step 5: Stir gently, starting from the middle, until mixture is sticky.
', 'Step 6: Knead by hand, adding more flour if needed, until dough is elastic and no longer sticky, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Oil a large, clean bowl and place dough inside, turning to coat.
', 'Step 8: Cover with a towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled in volume, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 9: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 10: Fill a roasting pan with water and set on the lower rack of the oven.
', 'Step 11: Line a baking sheet with a silicone mat.
', 'Step 12: Punch down dough and turn onto a lightly floured surface.
', 'Step 13: Shape dough into 1 large loaf or 6 sandwich loaves, tapering the ends.
', 'Step 14: Place loaves on the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 15: Cut 3 or 4 diagonal slashes, about 1/4 to 1/2-inch, across the tops.
', 'Step 16: Cover with a dry towel and let rise until doubled in volume, about 40 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Uncover and bake in the center of the preheated oven until top is light golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes depending on the size of the loaves.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '331.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '60.8 g', 'fatContent': '5.4 g', 'fiberContent': '2.4 g', 'proteinContent': '8.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '585.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '0.9 g'}

Title: Floating Island (Oeufs a la Neige)
Ingredients: ['3 eggs', '½ cup white sugar, divided', '¼ teaspoon salt', '1 ½ cups whole milk', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Separate two of the eggs.
', 'Step 2: In top of double boiler, combine 1 whole egg and 2 yolks with 1/4 cup sugar and the salt, whisking until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Whisk in the milk and cook over simmering water, stirring constantly with a spatula or wooden spoon.
', 'Step 4: When the custard thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon, remove it from the heat.
', 'Step 5: (Do not boil.
', 'Step 6: If custard should start to curdle, remove from heat and beat vigorously until smooth.
', 'Step 7: ) Pour the custard through a strainer into a bowl and stir in the vanilla extract.
', 'Step 8: Cool and refrigerate.
', 'Step 9: In a heat-proof bowl, lightly whisk the 2 egg whites with the remaining 1/4 cup sugar, just enough to dissolve the sugar.
', 'Step 10: Place the bowl on top of a pot of simmering water and stir constantly until the temperature of the whites reaches 145 degrees F (63 C) or hotter.
', 'Step 11: Immediately remove the bowl from the heat, and use an electric mixer to beat the warm egg whites until they form stiff, glossy peaks.
', 'Step 12: Pour the chilled custard into a serving dish.
', 'Step 13: Drop the meringue by heaping tablespoons onto the custard to make islands.
', 'Step 14: Chill before serving.
']

Title: Love Letter - Crepes
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups all-purpose flour', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '2 cups milk', '2 tablespoons butter, melted', '2 eggs', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '2 teaspoons vegetable oil, or as needed', '½ cup flaked coconut', '1 tablespoon white sugar, or more to taste', '¼ teaspoon ground cardamom']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Sift flour, 1 tablespoon sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Whisk milk, butter, eggs, and vanilla extract into flour mixture until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Scoop about 1/4 cup batter and pour onto hot skillet.
', 'Step 5: Tilt the pan in a circular motion to evenly distribute the batter.
', 'Step 6: Cook crepe until bottom is lightly browned, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Loosen with a spatula, flip, and cook the other side, about 2 more minutes.
', 'Step 8: Transfer to a plate.
', 'Step 9: Add more oil to the pan and repeat with remaining batter.
', 'Step 10: Mix coconut, 1 tablespoon white sugar, and cardamom together in a small bowl.
', 'Step 11: Spread 1 to 2 tablespoons of coconut mixture into the center of each crepe; fold crepe over the filling like an envelope or in half.
']

Title: Liver and Bacon
Ingredients: ['1 pound bacon', "1 pound calves' liver, sliced", '1 (5.5 ounce) package pork flavored seasoning coating mix (e.g. - SHAKE-N-BAKE)']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place bacon in a large, deep skillet.
', 'Step 2: Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown.
', 'Step 3: Transfer bacon to a plate, reserving a small amount of grease in the pan and the rest aside.
', 'Step 4: Pour seasoning coating mix into a large resealable plastic bag.
', "Step 5: Place calves' liver in bag one slice at a time; seal, and toss to coat.
", 'Step 6: Cook liver in bacon grease over medium high heat, turning occasionally to brown both sides.
', 'Step 7: Depending on the size of your skillet you may need to work in batches and add more bacon grease.
', 'Step 8: Liver is done when juices run clear.
', 'Step 9: Return bacon to the skillet during the last 2 minutes of cooking to warm through.
', 'Step 10: Serve hot with your favorite side dish.
']

Title: Chocolate Mousse Cake IV
Ingredients: ['1 (18.25 ounce) package chocolate cake mix', '1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', '2 (1 ounce) squares unsweetened chocolate, melted', '½ cup cold water', '1 (3.9 ounce) package instant chocolate pudding mix', '1 cup heavy cream, whipped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Prepare and bake cake mix according to package directions for two 9-inch layers.
', 'Step 3: Cool and remove from pans.
', 'Step 4: In a large bowl, mix together sweetened condensed milk and melted chocolate.
', 'Step 5: Gradually stir in the water, then instant pudding until smooth.
', 'Step 6: Chill for at least 30 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove the chocolate mixture from the refrigerator, and stir to loosen.
', 'Step 8: Fold in whipped cream and return to the refrigerator for at least another hour.
', 'Step 9: Place one layer of cake onto a serving plate.
', 'Step 10: Top with 1 1/2 cups of the mousse, then cover with the remaining cake layer.
', 'Step 11: Frost with the remaining mousse, and refrigerate until serving.
', 'Step 12: Garnish with fresh fruit or chocolate shavings.
']

Title: Fresh Fruit Frangipane Tart
Ingredients: ['3 puff pastry rectangles', '1 ½ tablespoons butter, softened', '⅓ cup white sugar', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '1 large egg', '¾ cup almond flour', '¼ teaspoon fine salt', '⅛ teaspoon vanilla extract', '¼ teaspoon almond extract', '3 pluots, or to taste', '3 tablespoons apricot jam', '2 teaspoons water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place 1 piece of puff pastry on a baking sheet lined with a silicone mat or parchment paper.
', 'Step 3: Lightly moisten one of the short edges with water.
', 'Step 4: Connect the end of the other puff pastry to the moistened edge.
', 'Step 5: Press pieces together to form a long rectangle, trimming off loose ends with a dough scraper as needed.
', 'Step 6: Cut the third puff pastry piece lengthwise into 1-inch strips.
', 'Step 7: Moisten the outer edges of the long rectangle with your finger; stick the pastry strips on top.
', 'Step 8: Poke shallow holes all over the bottom of the dough using a fork.
', 'Step 9: Do not prick the raised border.
', 'Step 10: Bake pastry shell in the preheated oven until it starts to turn golden brown, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Remove from oven.
', 'Step 12: Reduce oven temperature to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 13: Readjust the borders and push the bottom down with the flat side of a fork.
', 'Step 14: Let cool completely while preparing the filling.
', 'Step 15: Place butter and 1/3 cup plus 1 tablespoon sugar in a bowl; smear together using a spatula until combined.
', 'Step 16: Whisk in egg until mixture is creamy.
', 'Step 17: Add almond flour, salt, vanilla extract, and almond extract.
', 'Step 18: Mix thoroughly.
', 'Step 19: Cut each pluot into 6 wedges.
', 'Step 20: Fill pastry shell with the almond paste.
', 'Step 21: Stick the pluots snugly, but not too deeply, into the filling.
', 'Step 22: Bake in the preheated oven until browned and almond filling is set, 30 to 40 minutes.
', 'Step 23: Transfer tart onto a wire rack and let cool completely, at least 40 minutes.
', 'Step 24: Combine apricot jam and water in a microwave-safe bowl.
', 'Step 25: Bring to a boil in the microwave.
', 'Step 26: Let cool until warm.
', 'Step 27: Brush glaze over the cooled tart.
']

Title: Mom's Chicken En Cocotte
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 (3 1/2) pound whole chicken, cut into 8 pieces', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '8 carrots, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces', '8 potatoes, quartered', '4 stalks celery, cut into 1-inch pieces', '½ large onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '2 chicken bouillon cubes', '2 ½ cups water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Pour the olive oil into the bottom of a heavy Dutch oven, and place over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Sprinkle the chicken pieces with salt and black pepper, and cook in the hot oil until browned on both sides, 5 to 8 minutes per side.
', 'Step 4: Add the carrots, potatoes, celery, onion, garlic, chicken bouillon cubes, and water, and stir to combine.
', 'Step 5: Bring to a boil, and cover the Dutch oven.
', 'Step 6: Place the Dutch oven into the preheated oven, and simmer, covered, until the vegetables are tender, about 45 minutes.
']

Title: Cream of Brie Soup
Ingredients: ['¼ cup butter', '1 small onion, minced', '3 stalks celery, chopped', '¼ cup all-purpose flour', '4 cups chicken stock', '½ pound Brie cheese with the rind, cubed', '½ cup heavy cream', '1 tablespoon green bell pepper, cut into very fine matchsticks', '1 tablespoon red bell pepper, cut into very fine matchsticks']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat; cook the onions and celery until the onions are translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Stir in the flour, and cook for 3 minutes, stirring constantly.
', 'Step 3: Gradually whisk in the chicken stock.
', 'Step 4: Simmer until the celery is tender, about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the Brie cheese, and allow to melt for about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Pour the soup into a blender, filling the pitcher no more than halfway full.
', 'Step 7: Hold down the lid of the blender with a folded kitchen towel, and carefully start the blender, using a few quick pulses to get the soup moving before leaving it on to puree.
', 'Step 8: Puree in batches until smooth, and pour into a clean pot.
', 'Step 9: Heat the soup to almost simmering over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 10: Pour in the cream.
', 'Step 11: To serve, garnish with red and green pepper strips.
']

Title: Poulet a la Moutarde (Chicken in Dijon Mustard Sauce)
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon oil', '1 tablespoon butter', '1 pound skin-on, bone-in chicken thighs', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '⅓ cup Dijon mustard', '1 large onion, sliced', '1 cup white wine', '1 cup chicken broth', '⅓ cup heavy cream', '1 large bay leaf', '5 sprigs fresh thyme']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Warm oil and butter in a large, ovenproof casserole or Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Season chicken thighs with salt and pepper and place into the pot, skin-side down.
', 'Step 4: Brush thighs with 1/2 the mustard.
', 'Step 5: Cook until skin is golden, 3 to 4 minutes, and turn thighs over.
', 'Step 6: Brush with remaining mustard.
', 'Step 7: Cook 3 to 4 minutes more and transfer thighs to a plate.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat to medium and add sliced onion to the casserole.
', 'Step 9: Cook until nearly clear, 5 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Pour in wine to deglaze.
', 'Step 11: Increase heat to medium-high and bring to a boil, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Keep cooking until sauce reduces slightly and no longer smells strongly of alcohol, 3 to 4 minutes more.
', 'Step 13: Pour broth and heavy cream into the casserole dish.
', 'Step 14: Scrape the bottom to loosen browned bits.
', 'Step 15: Add bay leaf and thyme.
', 'Step 16: Return chicken to the casserole dish and cover.
', 'Step 17: Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink at the bone and juices run clear, about 40 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '427.9 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '18.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '100.2 mg', 'fatContent': '25.6 g', 'fiberContent': '5.6 g', 'proteinContent': '20.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '10.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '919.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.5 g'}

Title: Pear Clafoutis
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened, divided', '3 large eggs', '⅓ cup white sugar, or to taste', '1 ¼ cups whole milk', '¼ teaspoon fine salt', '1 pinch freshly grated nutmeg', '1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract', '½ teaspoon almond extract', '⅔ cup all-purpose flour', '3 cups thinly sliced sweet, ripe pears', '½ cup toasted sliced almonds', '½ tablespoon white sugar, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 10-inch baking dish generously with 1 tablespoon butter.
', 'Step 3: Whisk eggs, 1/3 cup sugar, milk, salt, nutmeg, vanilla extract, almond extract, and flour together in a bowl for batter.
', 'Step 4: Reserve 12 to 14 pear slices for topping and add remaining pear slices to the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 5: Pour batter over pears in the baking dish and top with almonds.
', 'Step 6: Shake and tap the dish gently on the countertop to let mixture settle.
', 'Step 7: Lay reserved pear slices flat on top.
', 'Step 8: Melt remaining butter and brush over pears.
', 'Step 9: Sprinkle with 1/2 tablespoon sugar.
', 'Step 10: Bake in the preheated oven until top is golden, fruit is soft, and custard is set, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Remove from the oven and let cool to room temperature before serving, or serve chilled.
']
