Title: Parmesan-Crusted Au Gratin Potatoes and Onion
Ingredients: ['4 pounds russet potatoes, cut into 1/4-inch slices', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '6 tablespoons butter', '6 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 ½ cups whole milk', '1 cup heavy whipping cream', '2 ½ cups shredded mild Cheddar cheese', '1 cup shredded Asiago cheese', '1 sweet onion, sliced into rings', '¾ cup sliced green onions', '⅓ cup shaved Parmesan cheese', '7 buttery round crackers (such as Ritz®), crushed', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with water; add salt and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until just beginning to soften, 15 to 20 minutes; drain.
', 'Step 3: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat; add flour and whisk until the mixture thickens, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Pour milk and heavy cream into the saucepan; cook and stir until smooth, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Melt Cheddar and Asiago cheese into the butter mixture; cook while stirring continually until the mixture is smooth and creamy, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Season the sauce with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Butter a 9x13-inch casserole dish.
', 'Step 9: Layer about half the sliced potatoes into the bottom of the baking dish.
', 'Step 10: Top the potatoes with sweet onion slices and green onions; pour about 1/3 of the cheese sauce over the onions.
', 'Step 11: Arrange the remaining potato slices into the dish; pour remaining cheese sauce over the potatoes.
', 'Step 12: Sprinkle Parmesan cheese and crushed crackers over the top.
', 'Step 13: Bake in the preheated oven until hot in the center and beginning to brown at the edge, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Sprinkle parsley over the top of the dish to serve.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '507.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '41.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '96.2 mg', 'fatContent': '31 g', 'fiberContent': '4.6 g', 'proteinContent': '17.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '19.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '455.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.2 g'}

Title: Vanilla Bean Pastry Cream
Ingredients: ['1 large whole egg', '2 large egg yolks', '½ cup white sugar', '¼ cup cornstarch', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '2 cups whole milk', '1 vanilla bean', '4 tablespoons cold butter, cubed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place whole egg and 2 egg yolks into a mixing bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add sugar, corn starch, and salt.
', 'Step 3: Whisk together completely until mixture turns from yellow to a very page creamy color and is slightly thickened, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 4: n Place milk in a saucepan.
', 'Step 5: Split vanilla bean lengthwise.
', 'Step 6: Scrape the cut side with a paring knife to extract the seeds (paste).
', 'Step 7: Add the seeds to the milk.
', 'Step 8: Heat over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until milk just barely starts to simmer and a few small bubbles appear on the surface.
', 'Step 9: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 10: Whisk hot milk into egg mixture, starting with a small splash then incorporating the rest.
', 'Step 11: Pour mixture back into saucepan.
', 'Step 12: n Place pan over medium-low heat and continue to whisk until mixture begin to thicken, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Remove from heat and let it cool 5 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Add chunks of butter and whisk until butter melts into the warm milk mixture.
', 'Step 15: Pass mixture through a fine mesh strainer to remove and chunks of cooked egg or vanilla seeds.
', 'Step 16: Cover surface with plastic to keep it from discoloring; refrigerate until thoroughly chilled 2 to 3 hours.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '120.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '13.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '63.9 mg', 'fatContent': '6.3 g', 'proteinContent': '2.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '3.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '210.9 mg', 'sugarContent': '11.4 g'}

Title: Chef John's Salmon in Parchment
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon olive oil, or more if needed', '6 small potatoes', '10 spears asparagus', '2 (8 ounce) skinless, boneless, center-cut salmon fillets', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 teaspoon extra-virgin olive oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Take two pieces of parchment paper, fold in half, and cut a half-circle starting at each crease.
', 'Step 3: They should look similar to a heart-shape when unfolded.
', 'Step 4: Coat each piece of parchment with olive oil on both sides.
', 'Step 5: Place potatoes in a saucepan and cover with salted water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 6: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Drain.
', 'Step 8: Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
', 'Step 9: Add asparagus, and cook uncovered until slightly tender, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Drain in a colander, then immediately immerse in ice water for several minutes until cold to stop the cooking process.
', 'Step 11: Once the asparagus is cold, drain well, and set aside.
', 'Step 12: Place 1 salmon fillet, half the asparagus, and half the potatoes in the middle of one side of a prepared parchment paper.
', 'Step 13: Sprinkle with salt and pepper and drizzle with extra-virgin olive oil.
', 'Step 14: Fold other half of circle over and seal parchment edge by making overlapping folds around the edge.
', 'Step 15: At the end, fold the last crease in the opposite direction of the rest to ensure it seals.
', 'Step 16: Repeat with the second piece of prepared parchment and remaining ingredients.
', 'Step 17: Place pouches on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 18: Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Remove from oven and allow to sit for 5 minutes before cutting open parchment.
', 'Step 20: The salmon is done when it flakes easily with a fork.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '873 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '114.7 g', 'cholesterolContent': '100 mg', 'fatContent': '18.5 g', 'fiberContent': '15.7 g', 'proteinContent': '62.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '3.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '133 mg', 'sugarContent': '6.5 g'}

Title: Eggless Crepes
Ingredients: ['½ cup skim milk', '⅔ cup water', '¼ cup butter, melted', '2 tablespoons vanilla extract', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '¼ teaspoon salt', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a medium bowl, mix together milk, water, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
', 'Step 2: In a small bowl, thoroughly mix flour, sugar, and salt.
', 'Step 3: Whisk flour mixture into milk mixture until batter is smooth.
', 'Step 4: Cover and refrigerate 2 hours.
', 'Step 5: Warm a medium skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 6: Coat pan with a small amount of vegetable oil and pour in about 2 tablespoons of crepe batter.
', 'Step 7: Swirl pan to allow batter to spread out thinly.
', 'Step 8: Cook until edges are crispy and golden, then flip to cook other side until lightly browned.
', 'Step 9: Repeat with remaining batter.
']

Title: Chef John's Chocolate Croissants
Ingredients: ['½ cup warm water (100 degrees F or 38 degrees C)', '½ (.25 ounce) package active dry yeast', '2 tablespoons granulated white sugar', '1 ¾ cups unbleached bread flour', '1 ½ teaspoons kosher salt', '3 tablespoons butter, room temperature, cut into pieces', '1 stick unsalted European-style butter', '1 cup chopped bittersweet chocolate', '1 egg', '1 tablespoon water', '1 pinch coarse sea salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place warm water in the bowl of a stand mixer.
', 'Step 2: Sprinkle with yeast.
', 'Step 3: Let yeast dissolve for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add sugar and bread flour.
', 'Step 5: Sprinkle with salt; add 3 tablespoons butter.
', 'Step 6: Attach the bowl to the stand mixer.
', 'Step 7: Mix dough with the dough hook just until butter is completely kneaded in and the dough forms a ball and pulls away cleanly from the sides of the bowl, 3 or 4 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Transfer dough to a work surface and form into a semi-smooth ball.
', 'Step 9: Place dough back in the mixer bowl; cover.
', 'Step 10: Let rise in a warm spot until doubled, about 2 hours.
', 'Step 11: Transfer dough to a lightly floured work surface.
', 'Step 12: Push and press dough to deflate it, and form it into a rectangle.
', 'Step 13: Fold into thirds by lifting one end over the middle third, and folding the other side onto the middle.
', 'Step 14: Wrap in plastic wrap.
', 'Step 15: Place on a rimmed baking sheet lined with a silicone mat.
', 'Step 16: Refrigerate until chilled through, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 17: Cut 1 stick of butter in 1/2 lengthwise and place halves slightly apart from each other on a length of parchment paper long enough to fold over the butter.
', 'Step 18: Fold the parchment paper over the butter.
', 'Step 19: Press butter down.
', 'Step 20: Roll out with a rolling pin to a square about 8x8 inches.
', 'Step 21: Refrigerate until a little chilled and just barely flexible, 10 or 15 minutes.
', 'Step 22: Roll dough out into a rectangle slightly wider than the butter slab and just over twice as long.
', 'Step 23: Place butter on one half of the dough leaving about 1 inch margin from the edge of the dough.
', 'Step 24: Fold the other half of the dough over the butter.
', 'Step 25: Dust work surface and dough with flour as needed.
', 'Step 26: Press rolling pin down on dough to create ridges.
', 'Step 27: Then roll out the ridges.
', 'Step 28: Repeat this process.
', 'Step 29: Keep pressing and rolling until dough is about the same size rectangle as you had before you folded it in half, dusting with just a bit of flour as necessary.
', 'Step 30: Starting from the short side, fold one-third of dough over middle third.
', 'Step 31: Then fold the other end over to form a small rectangle.
', 'Step 32: Flatten out just slightly with rolling pin.
', 'Step 33: Transfer to the silicone-lined baking sheet; cover with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 34: Refrigerate until chilled, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 35: Transfer dough back to work surface and repeat pressing and rolling technique until dough is the size of the previous larger rectangle.
', 'Step 36: Fold into thirds again, starting from the short side.
', 'Step 37: Press and roll slightly.
', 'Step 38: Transfer back to lined baking sheet.
', 'Step 39: Cover and refrigerate about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 40: Roll back out to a large rectangle.
', 'Step 41: This time, fold dough in half.
', 'Step 42: Then press and roll out into a 1/2-inch thick rectangle, using as little flour as needed to keep dough from sticking.
', 'Step 43: Dust dough with flour and roll out to a rectangle about 1/8-inch thick.
', 'Step 44: Cut dough lengthwise into 6 pieces using a pastry wheel.
', 'Step 45: Pull and stretch out 1 of the dough pieces until ends are slightly tapered.
', 'Step 46: Line 1 to 2 tablespoon of chocolate 1 inch parallel to the bottom edge and an equal amount of chocolate 1 more inch ahead.
', 'Step 47: Roll dough up over the chocolate toward the top short edge to form a croissant with the seam at the bottom.
', 'Step 48: Repeat with the remaining 5 dough pieces.
', 'Step 49: Place shaped croissants on baking sheets lined with silicone mats.
', 'Step 50: Whisk together egg and 1 tablespoon water to make the egg wash.
', 'Step 51: Brush croissants with a large portion of the egg wash.
', 'Step 52: Place in a warm area to allow them to rise, 60 to 90 minutes.
', 'Step 53: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 54: Brush croissants gently but thoroughly again with egg wash.
', 'Step 55: Sprinkle sea salt on top.
', 'Step 56: Bake in preheated oven until beautifully browned, about 25 minutes.
', 'Step 57: Transfer to a cooling rack.
', 'Step 58: Cool to room temperature, about 1 hour.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '566.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '52.7 g', 'cholesterolContent': '88.6 mg', 'fatContent': '36 g', 'fiberContent': '4.1 g', 'proteinContent': '8.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '22 g', 'sodiumContent': '591.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '22.4 g'}

Title: Pommes Anna with Gruyere
Ingredients: ['¾ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon thyme', '2 tablespoons butter, divided', '1 thinly sliced sweet onion', '1 ½ pounds Yukon gold potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced', '1 cup shredded Gruyere cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine salt, pepper, and thyme in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a 10-inch skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir onions until soft and golden brown, about 8 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Move to a bowl.
', 'Step 5: Melt remaining 1 tablespoon butter in the skillet; remove from heat.
', 'Step 6: Arrange 1/3 of potato slices in the skillet in a slightly overlapping layer.
', 'Step 7: Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of the salt mixture.
', 'Step 8: Top with 1/2 of the onions and 1/2 of the Gruyere cheese.
', 'Step 9: Repeat layers, ending with potatoes; sprinkle with remaining salt mixture.
', 'Step 10: Cover and cook over medium-low heat, reducing heat to low if necessary, until potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Uncover and continue cooking, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Run a spatula around edges to loosen; let cool, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Invert potatoes carefully onto a serving dish.
']

Title: Croque-Monsieur
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon Dijon mustard', '2 tablespoons mayonnaise', '4 tablespoons butter or margarine, softened', '6 slices white bread', '6 slices Swiss cheese', '12 slices thinly sliced deli ham', '4 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '¼ teaspoon salt', '2 eggs', '¼ cup water', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Use 2 tablespoons of the butter to spread over one side of each slice of bread.
', 'Step 2: On three of the slices, spread a layer of Dijon mustard over the butter, and top each with 4 slices of ham.
', 'Step 3: On the other three, spread mayonnaise, and top each one with 2 slices of Swiss cheese.
', 'Step 4: Press ham and cheese sides of sandwiches together.
', 'Step 5: In a flat bottomed dish, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, eggs, and water until blended.
', 'Step 6: Set aside.
', 'Step 7: Heat remaining butter and vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Dip both sides of each sandwich in the egg mixture, and fry in the oil and butter until browned, flipping to brown on each side.
']

Title: Profiteroles
Ingredients: ['1 cup water', '½ cup butter', '¼ teaspoon salt', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '4 eggs', '1 cup heavy cream', "¼ cup confectioners' sugar", '1 teaspoon rose water', '1 cup heavy cream', '9 ounces semisweet chocolate, chopped']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
', 'Step 3: Bring the water to a boil in a saucepan.
', 'Step 4: Stir in the butter and salt until the butter has melted; remove the saucepan from the heat.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the flour until no dry lumps remain; stir in the eggs, one at a time, adding the next egg only after the last one has been completely incorporated into the mixture.
', 'Step 6: Drop the profiterole paste onto the prepared baking sheet in evenly spaced dollops.
', 'Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven until the pastries have puffed up and turned golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Remove from the baking sheet and cool on a wire rack to room temperature.
', "Step 9: Beat 1 cup of heavy cream to soft peaks; stir in the confectioners' sugar and rosewater until the sugar has dissolved.
", 'Step 10: Bring the remaining cup of heavy cream to a simmer in a small saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 11: Remove from the heat and stir in the chocolate until melted and smooth.
', 'Step 12: To assemble, poke a hole into the bottom of each pastry and fill with the rose water cream.
', 'Step 13: Place the filled profiteroles onto individual serving plates and top with the warm sauce.
', 'Step 14: Leftover profiteroles may be stored sealed in an airtight container in the refrigerator up to 5 days.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '763.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '47.6 g', 'cholesterolContent': '273.4 mg', 'fatContent': '61.7 g', 'fiberContent': '3.6 g', 'proteinContent': '11.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '36.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '284.3 mg', 'sugarContent': '26.5 g'}

Title: Sabayon
Ingredients: ['4 egg yolks', '4 tablespoons water', '4 tablespoons Marsala wine', '4 tablespoons white sugar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Pour a few inches of water into a pan and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low to keep water at a simmer.
', 'Step 3: Combine egg yolks, water, Marsala, and sugar in a large heat-proof bowl and set above the simmering water.
', 'Step 4: Cook, whisking constantly with a balloon whisk, until sugar is dissolved and mixture starts to thicken, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Continue cooking and whisking until sabayon is the texture of mousse and holds its shape, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Lift bowl occasionally to let steam escape and keep eggs from overcooking.
', 'Step 7: Serve immediately.
']

Title: Chef John's Steak Diane
Ingredients: ['½ cup demi-glace', '1 tablespoon Dijon mustard', '2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce', '1 teaspoon tomato paste', '1 pinch cayenne pepper', '2 teaspoons vegetable oil', '2 (8 ounce) beef tenderloin steaks, fully trimmed, pounded to 1/2 inch thick', 'Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste', '1 tablespoon unsalted butter, cut into small chunks', '3 tablespoons shallot, minced', '¼ cup Cognac or brandy', '¼ cup heavy cream', '2 teaspoons sliced fresh chives']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Season steaks generously on both sides with salt.
', 'Step 2: Allow steaks to come to room temperature while you make the sauce.
', "Step 3: Stir together demi-glace (see Cook's Note), mustard, Worcestershire sauce, tomato paste, and cayenne pepper in a bowl.
", 'Step 4: Heat oil in a skillet over very high heat, swirling carefully to evenly cover surface.
', 'Step 5: When oil reaches a smoking point, transfer steaks to oil; add a few chunks of butter.
', 'Step 6: Sear meat on high heat until brown on each side, 2 to 3 minutes per side; keep them on the rare side.
', 'Step 7: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 125 degrees F (52 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Transfer steaks to a warm plate.
', 'Step 9: Stir shallots into skillet; cook until softened, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Remove skillet from heat; pour in Cognac.
', 'Step 11: Carefully ignite with a fireplace lighter.
', 'Step 12: When alcohol burns off and flames go out, return skillet to high heat and bring to a boil; cook, stirring, a few minutes to reduce slightly.
', 'Step 13: Add demi-glace mixture, cream, and any accumulated juices from the steak.
', 'Step 14: Cook on high heat just until sauce starts to thicken, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Transfer steaks back to pan and reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 16: Gently simmer until meat is heated through and cooked to your desired level of doneness.
', 'Step 17: Transfer to hot plates and serve with a generous spoonful or two of sauce.
', 'Step 18: Sprinkle with chives.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '1050 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '43.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '247 mg', 'fatContent': '54.8 g', 'fiberContent': '2.5 g', 'proteinContent': '71.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '23.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '2593.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.9 g'}

Title: French Leek Pie
Ingredients: ['1 (9 inch) refrigerated pie crust', '2 teaspoons butter', '3 leeks, chopped', '1 pinch salt and black pepper to taste', '1 cup light cream', '1 ¼ cups shredded Gruyere cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 3: Stir in leeks; cook, stirring occasionally, for about 10 minutes, or until soft.
', 'Step 4: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 6: Stir in cream and cheese, and warm through.
', 'Step 7: Pour mixture into pie shell Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until custard is set and golden on top.
', 'Step 8: Allow to sit 10 minutes before cutting pie into wedges.
']

Title: Poached Salmon with Hollandaise Sauce
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', '1 tablespoon olive oil', 'Salt and pepper to taste', '2 (6 ounce) skinless, boneless salmon fillets', '3 egg yolks', '1 tablespoon hot water', '1 cup butter, cut into small pieces', '2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', 'Salt and pepper to taste', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Find a high-sided pan large enough to accommodate both salmon fillets side-by-side, without too much excess room; a small skillet or medium-sized saucepan should do.
', 'Step 2: Pour lemon juice and olive oil into the pan, along with enough water to bring the water level up to 3/4-inch.
', 'Step 3: Season the water to taste with salt and pepper, then add the salmon.
', 'Step 4: Pour in enough water to just cover the salmon.
', 'Step 5: Place the salmon over medium-high heat, and heat until the water is hot and steaming, but not simmering (165 degrees F (75 degrees C)); reduce heat if needed to keep the water at the proper temperature.
', 'Step 6: Poach until the salmon turns opaque, and is firm to the touch; or to an internal temperature of 140 degrees F (60 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Proceed making the Hollandaise sauce while the salmon is poaching.
', 'Step 8: Pour a few inches of water into a saucepan, and bring to a boil over high heat, then turn heat to medium-high and maintain water at a gentle boil.
', 'Step 9: Place the egg yolks in a metal bowl, and whisk in hot water.
', 'Step 10: Place the bowl over, but not touching, the boiling water.
', 'Step 11: Whisk constantly until the yolks thicken, turn a light, opaque yellow, and double in volume.
', 'Step 12: You may need to remove the bowl from the boiling water from time to time in order to keep from scrambling the yolks.
', 'Step 13: When the yolks have thickened and increased in volume, begin whisking in the butter, a cube at a time until it melts and incorporates into the hollandaise sauce.
', 'Step 14: Wait for each cube to melt and incorporate before adding the next.
', 'Step 15: Once all of the butter has been incorporated, remove from heat, whisk in the lemon juice, and season to taste with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 16: To serve, drain the poached salmon and place each piece onto a dinner plate.
', 'Step 17: Generously ladle with the warm hollandaise sauce, and sprinkle with chives.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '1270.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '4.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '650.4 mg', 'fatContent': '123.7 g', 'fiberContent': '0.2 g', 'proteinContent': '38.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '65.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '765.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '1.2 g'}

Title: Secret Recipe Chicken Fricassee
Ingredients: ['¼ cup all-purpose flour', '¼ cup margarine', '2 cups heavy whipping cream', '2 cups chicken broth', '1 tablespoon dried parsley', '4 egg yolks', '¼ cup lemon juice', '1 teaspoon cornstarch, or as needed', '4 cooked chicken breasts, broken into chunks']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix flour and margarine together in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring until the flour and margarine form a paste.
', 'Step 2: Whisk cream into flour mixture about 1/2 cup at a time until smoothly combined; whisk in chicken broth and parsley.
', 'Step 3: Bring sauce to a simmer, whisking constantly until thickened.
', 'Step 4: Whisk egg yolks and lemon juice together in a bowl.
', 'Step 5: Whisk egg yolk mixture slowly into cream mixture, about 1 tablespoon at a time, until the sauce barely comes to a simmer and coats the back of a spoon.
', 'Step 6: Do not boil.
', 'Step 7: If thicker sauce is desired, whisk cornstarch and 1/4 cup of sauce in a small bowl; stir cornstarch mixture back into sauce until thickened, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Stir chicken breast pieces into sauce until chicken is heated through.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '693.4 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '12.6 g', 'cholesterolContent': '414.6 mg', 'fatContent': '61.7 g', 'fiberContent': '0.4 g', 'proteinContent': '23.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '31.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '702.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '1.3 g'}

Title: Chef John's Quick Cassoulet
Ingredients: ['4 ounces bacon, cut into 1 inch pieces', '8 ounces smoked sausage, sliced', '12 ounces boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cubed', '1 onion, diced', 'salt and pepper to taste', '2 cups chicken broth, plus more if needed', '2 (15 ounce) cans cannellini beans, drained and rinsed', '1 ½ teaspoons minced fresh rosemary', '1 ½ teaspoons minced fresh thyme', 'cayenne pepper to taste', '¼ cup melted butter', '1 cup bread crumbs', '½ cup finely grated Parmigiano-Reggiano']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Add bacon to a large, cold oven-ready skillet.
', 'Step 2: Place over medium heat and cook for 10-12 minutes, until almost crisp.
', 'Step 3: Transfer to a bowl, reserving the grease in the pan.
', 'Step 4: Stir in sausage slices; cook 3-4 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add chicken thigh pieces; cook and stir for 5 minutes, until browned.
', 'Step 6: Remove meat to the plate with bacon.
', "Step 7: Discard all the oil, but don't wipe out the pan.
", 'Step 8: Add chopped onion and turn the heat to medium-low; cook and stir for 5 minutes, until the onions are translucent.
', 'Step 9: Add 1 cup of chicken stock.
', 'Step 10: Mash about 1/4 of the beans in a small bowl, stir all the beans into the pan.
', 'Step 11: Stir in cayenne, rosemary and thyme.
', 'Step 12: Add reserved meat back to the pan.
', 'Step 13: Stir in remaining cup of stock or more if needed to cover.
', 'Step 14: Return to simmer.
', 'Step 15: Mix bread crumbs, Parmigiano-Reggiano and melted butter together in a small bowl.
', "Step 16: Preheat the oven's broiler and set the oven rack about 7 inches from the heat source.
", 'Step 17: Sprinkle the cassoulet with half the bread crumb mixture.
', 'Step 18: Place under the broiler and cook about 5 minutes, until browned.
', 'Step 19: Remove the pan and push bread crumbs down into the cassoulet.
', 'Step 20: Top with remaining bread crumb mixture.
', 'Step 21: Return to oven and continue broiling 5 more minutes, until browned.
', 'Step 22: Turn off the broiler and leave in the oven for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 23: Remove and let sit for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 24: Enjoy.
']

Title: Easy Cheese Souffles
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons melted butter', '2 tablespoons white sugar, or as needed', '2 large eggs', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', '¼ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 teaspoon lemon zest', '2 ounces cream cheese, softened', '⅓ cup shredded Cheddar cheese', '1 pinch salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Brush butter on the bottom and up the sides of two 5 1/2-ounce ramekins.
', 'Step 3: Scoop in some sugar; rotate ramekins to coat while pouring most of the sugar back into its container.
', 'Step 4: Place ramekins on a shallow baking pan.
', 'Step 5: Separate eggs between 2 bowls.
', 'Step 6: Add sugar, flour, 1/4 teaspoon salt, vanilla extract, lemon zest, cream cheese, and Cheddar cheese to the yolks.
', 'Step 7: Mix the souffle base with a spatula until sugar and flour disappear.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle a pinch of salt over the room-temperature egg whites.
', 'Step 9: Beat with a whisk until soft peaks form; peaks should hold their shape but not be stiff or dry.
', 'Step 10: Stir and fold 1/2 of the egg whites into the souffle base until combined.
', 'Step 11: Gently fold the rest of the egg whites into the batter.
', 'Step 12: Fill ramekins up to the lip with the batter.
', 'Step 13: Bake in the preheated oven until puffed and browned, about 12 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Serve immediately.
']

Title: Mussels Provencal
Ingredients: ['1 (12 ounce) package fettuccini pasta', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (16 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 teaspoon tomato paste', '5 fresh mushrooms, chopped', '1 teaspoon dried basil', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon dried tarragon', '36 raw green-lipped mussels', '½ cup olives', '2 fresh tomatoes, chopped']

['Step 1: Bring a large pot of water to boiling.
', 'Step 2: Cook pasta in boiling water until al dente, about 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain.
', 'Step 4: Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Cook onion and garlic in oil until soft.
', 'Step 6: Stir in diced tomatoes, tomato paste, and mushrooms, and add the mussels.
', 'Step 7: Season with basil, oregano, and tarragon.
', 'Step 8: Cover, and simmer for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Stir in olives and fresh tomatoes.
', 'Step 10: Cover, and simmer 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Serve mussels and sauce over pasta.
']

Title: Meringue Mushrooms
Ingredients: ['½ cup egg whites', '¼ teaspoon cream of tartar', '¼ teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 cup white sugar', '1 tablespoon unsweetened cocoa powder', "4 ounces chocolate confectioners' coating"]
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 225 degrees F (110 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line 2 cookie sheets with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: In a large glass or metal bowl, use an electric mixer to whip egg whites until foamy.
', 'Step 4: Add cream of tartar, salt, and vanilla.
', 'Step 5: Continue whipping until the whites hold soft peaks.
', 'Step 6: Gradually sprinkle in the sugar so that it does not sink to the bottom, and continue whipping until the mixture holds stiff shiny peaks.
', 'Step 7: Place a round tip into a pastry bag, and fill the bag half way with the meringue.
', 'Step 8: To pipe the mushroom caps, squeeze out round mounds of meringue onto one of the prepared cookie sheets.
', 'Step 9: Pull the bag off to the side to avoid making peaks on the top.
', 'Step 10: For the stems, press out a tiny bit of meringue onto the other sheet, then pull the bag straight up.
', 'Step 11: They should resemble candy kisses.
', 'Step 12: Do not worry about making all of the pieces exactly the same.
', 'Step 13: The mushrooms will look more natural if the pieces are different sizes.
', 'Step 14: Dust the mushroom caps lightly with cocoa using a small sifter or strainer.
', 'Step 15: Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until the caps are dry enough to easily remove from the cookie sheets.
', 'Step 16: Set aside to cool completely.
', 'Step 17: Melt the coating chocolate in a metal bowl over simmering water, or in a glass bowl in the microwave, stirring occasionally until smooth.
', 'Step 18: Poke a small hole in the bottom of a mushroom cap.
', 'Step 19: Spread chocolate over the bottom of the cap.
', 'Step 20: Dip the tip of a stem in chocolate, and press lightly into the hole.
', 'Step 21: When the chocolate sets, they will hold together.
', 'Step 22: Repeat with remaining pieces.
', 'Step 23: Store at room temperature in a dry place or tin.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '38.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '7.1 g', 'fatContent': '1.3 g', 'fiberContent': '0.1 g', 'proteinContent': '0.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '21.9 mg', 'sugarContent': '5.6 g'}

Title: Seafood Sausage
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons butter, or to taste, divided', '2 tablespoons minced shallot', '8 ounces boneless, skinless sole, chilled and cubed', '1 (4 ounce) skinless salmon fillet, chilled and cubed', '4 ounces shrimp - chilled, peeled, deveined, and chopped', '2 tablespoons plain dry breadcrumbs', '4 large egg whites', '1 large egg', '2 teaspoons kosher salt', '2 pinches cayenne pepper, or to taste', '2 tablespoons chopped Italian parsley', '2 tablespoons water', '1 lemon, juiced', '2 tablespoons cold butter', '1 tablespoon chopped Italian parsley', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt 2 teaspoons butter in a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Saute shallots until soft and sweetened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Let cool to room temperature.
', 'Step 4: Combine sole, salmon, and shrimp in a food processor.
', 'Step 5: Add bread crumbs.
', 'Step 6: Pour in egg whites and whole egg.
', 'Step 7: Season with kosher salt and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 8: Add the cooled shallots and parsley.
', 'Step 9: Cover processor and pulse on and off, starting with short pulses and transitioning to longer ones, until mixture is well blended and clumps together at the blade.
', 'Step 10: Transfer mixture to a bowl, wrap in plastic wrap, and chill in the refrigerator for 1 to 2 hours.
', 'Step 11: Transfer 1/4 of the sausage mixture onto a piece of plastic wrap.
', 'Step 12: Shape into a log with dampened fingertips.
', 'Step 13: Roll in the plastic, twisting the ends to seal.
', 'Step 14: Lay the log onto a piece of aluminum foil and roll it up.
', 'Step 15: Twist the ends in opposite directions, but not too tightly.
', 'Step 16: Fold the ends back.
', 'Step 17: Repeat with the remaining sausage mixture.
', 'Step 18: Bring a pot of water to a simmer.
', 'Step 19: Add the sausages and submerge them with a plate.
', 'Step 20: Cover pot and simmer on low for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 21: Transfer sausages into a bowl of cold water to stop the cooking process.
', 'Step 22: Let cool for 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 23: Remove from the water and refrigerate until ready to serve.
', 'Step 24: Peel foil off of the sausages over a piece of paper towel.
', 'Step 25: Snip off 1 end of the plastic wrap and squeeze the sausage out through the opening.
', 'Step 26: Trim off any unsightly chunks.
', 'Step 27: Melt remaining butter in a pan over medium heat.
', 'Step 28: Cook sausages in the hot butter, turning until browned all over, 5 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 29: Reduce heat to medium-low and cover.
', 'Step 30: Cook until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the sausages reads 140 degrees F (60 degrees C), 5 to 6 minutes more.
', 'Step 31: Repeat with remaining sausages.
', 'Step 32: Pour water and lemon juice into the same pan and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 33: Cook until reduced by 1/2, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 34: Reduce heat to low; add cold butter and parsley.
', 'Step 35: Swirl pan until butter is melted; season with salt and swirl once more.
', 'Step 36: Spoon sauce over the sausages.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '284.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '6.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '164.5 mg', 'fatContent': '16.6 g', 'fiberContent': '1.6 g', 'proteinContent': '27.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '8.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '1284.9 mg', 'sugarContent': '0.7 g'}

Title: Chocolate Banana Crepes
Ingredients: ['½ cup whole or 2% milk', '1 ½ tablespoons melted butter', '1 egg yolk', '1 teaspoon vanilla', '2 teaspoons hazelnut liqueur', '1 tablespoon cocoa', "2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar", '⅓ cup white flour', '½ tablespoon butter', '1 tablespoon whole or 2% milk', '2 teaspoons hazelnut liqueur', '1 tablespoon cocoa', "2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar", '2 ripe bananas, sliced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a medium bowl, stir together 1/2 cup milk, 1 1/2 tablespoons melted butter, egg yolk, vanilla, and 2 teaspoons hazelnut liqueur.
', 'Step 2: Whisk 1 tablespoon cocoa into liquid until completely incorporated.
', "Step 3: Next, whisk in 2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar until completely incorporated.
", 'Step 4: Then gradually whisk in flour until completely incorporated.
', 'Step 5: Set aside.
', 'Step 6: Melt 1/2 tablespoon butter in a saucepan over low heat.
', 'Step 7: Stir 1 tablespoon milk and 2 teaspoons hazelnut liqueur into melted butter.
', "Step 8: Stir in 1 tablespoon cocoa and 2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar.
", 'Step 9: Set over very low heat to keep warm.
', 'Step 10: Spray a non-stick frying pan or crepe pan with cooking spray, and heat over medium heat.
', 'Step 11: Pour about 1/4 cup of batter onto the pan, and swirl to form a very thin disk; cook for about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Flip, and cook about 1 minute more.
', 'Step 13: Place crepe on a plate.
', 'Step 14: Add 1/4 sliced bananas to crepe, and spoon 1/4 of the chocolate sauce over the bananas.
', "Step 15: Roll or fold crepe, and sprinkle with confectioners' sugar.
", 'Step 16: Repeat steps 3 and 4.
', 'Step 17: Serve crepes warm.
']

Title: Fig and Olive Tapenade
Ingredients: ['1 cup chopped dried figs', '½ cup water', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar', '1 teaspoon dried rosemary', '1 teaspoon dried thyme', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '⅔ cup chopped kalamata olives', '2 cloves garlic, minced', 'salt and pepper to taste', '⅓ cup chopped toasted walnuts', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese']

Title: Beef Bourguignon II
Ingredients: ['¼ cup all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 pounds cubed stew meat', '4 tablespoons butter', '1 onion, chopped', '2 carrots, chopped', '1 clove garlic, minced', '2 cups red wine', '1 bay leaf', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley', '½ teaspoon dried thyme', '1 (6 ounce) can sliced mushrooms', '1 (16 ounce) can canned onions']

', 'Step 2: Coat the beef cubes with this mixture.

', 'Step 4: Add the meat and brown well on all sides.
', 'Step 5: Pour this into a 2 quart casserole dish.
', 'Step 6: Return the skillet to the heat and add the onion, carrots and garlic to it.
', 'Step 7: Saute for 5 to 10 minutes, or until onion is tender.
', 'Step 8: add the wine, bay leaf, parsley, thyme, and liquid from the mushrooms.
', 'Step 9: Pour over meat.
', 'Step 10: Bake, covered, at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 2 1/2 hours.

Title: Cheese Puffs (Gougeres)
Ingredients: ['1 cup all-purpose flour', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon fresh ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon dried thyme', '½ teaspoon chili powder', '1 pinch cayenne pepper', '1 cup whole milk', '1 stick butter (cut into 1/2 inch cubes)', '6 large eggs (at room temperature)', '½ cup grated Parmesan or Romano cheese', '¾ cup grated Gruyere cheese', '1 ounce pepperoni, diced', '2 tablespoons milk', '2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Combine the flour with the salt, black pepper, thyme, chili powder, and cayenne pepper in a large bowl.
', 'Step 3: Put the milk and butter in a large saucepan and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 4: When the butter melts, turn heat to low.
', 'Step 5: Add the seasoned flour all at once.
', 'Step 6: Stir vigorously with a wooden spoon until the dough forms a ball.
', 'Step 7: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 8: Separate the white and yolk from one egg, reserving the yolk for glazing.
', 'Step 9: Put the dough into a large mixer bowl.
', 'Step 10: Beat at medium speed for one minute.
', 'Step 11: Then beat in one egg and the extra egg white.
', 'Step 12: Beat until completely absorbed into the dough.
', 'Step 13: Then add the remaining 4 eggs, one at a time, waiting each time until the previous egg is completely absorbed.
', 'Step 14: After all 5 eggs (plus the one egg white) have been incorporated, the dough should be smooth and satiny.
', 'Step 15: Add the Parmesan and Gruyere cheeses, and pepperoni if you are using it.
', 'Step 16: Incorporate thoroughly into the dough.
', 'Step 17: Use a pastry bag to pipe dough onto 2 ungreased baking sheets.
', 'Step 18: You can also drop dough from a teaspoon.
', 'Step 19: For tiny puffs, mounds should be about 1/2 inch in diameter.
', 'Step 20: From small appetizers, mounds should be 1 inch in diameter.
', 'Step 21: For puffs large enough for filling, mounds should be 1 1/2 inches in diameter.
', 'Step 22: Keep the size of the puffs uniform so they bake properly.
', 'Step 23: Space puffs about 1 inch apart.
', 'Step 24: Beat the remaining egg yolk with 2 tablespoons of milk to make a glaze.
', 'Step 25: Lightly brush the tops of the puffs with glaze before baking.
', 'Step 26: Sprinkle tops with your Parmesan cheese.
', 'Step 27: Bake in pre-heated oven for 10 minutes (5 minutes for tiny puffs).
', 'Step 28: Reduce heat to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 29: Bake 10 minutes more for tiny puffs; 15 to 20 minutes longer for medium or large puffs, or until puffs are golden brown.
', 'Step 30: Test by removing a puff from the oven and breaking it open.
', 'Step 31: The inside should be baked through.
', 'Step 32: If it is still doughy or wet, bake another 5 minutes.
', 'Step 33: Remove pans from oven and leave puffs on pans until cool enough to serve.
']

Title: Caneles de Bordeaux
Ingredients: ['1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 cup white sugar', '4 egg yolks', '¼ cup rum', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '¼ teaspoon kosher salt', '2 cups whole milk', '2 tablespoons unsalted butter', '1 teaspoon unsalted butter', '2 tablespoons butter', '2 tablespoons beeswax']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place flour, sugar, egg yolks, rum, vanilla extract, and salt in a mixing bowl.
', 'Step 2: Mix and smear into a smooth paste using a spatula.
', 'Step 3: Continue mixing until flour is fully incorporated.
', 'Step 4: Place butter and pour milk into a saucepan.
', 'Step 5: Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 6: As soon as milk mixture comes to a simmer, remove from heat.
', 'Step 7: Slowly add half the milk to the flour mixture to prevent the egg yolks from cooking.
', 'Step 8: Whisk until well blended and smooth.
', 'Step 9: Slowly pour in the rest of the milk mixture; whisk until batter is smooth.
', 'Step 10: Batter will be thin.
', 'Step 11: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 12: Melt 2 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon butter and beeswax in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 13: Stir with a pastry brush.
', 'Step 14: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 15: Brush the bottom and the sides of each muffin cup generously with the butter/beeswax mixture.
', 'Step 16: Ladle batter into muffin cups until mixture is almost to the top.
', 'Step 17: Place pan in preheated oven.
', 'Step 18: Bake 10 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Reduce heat to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 20: Bake until canelés are very well browned, about 50 minutes.
', 'Step 21: Allow to cool just 5 minutes.
', 'Step 22: Run a thin blade around the sides and carefully remove canelés from cups.
', 'Step 23: Invert onto a cooling rack.
', 'Step 24: Let cool completely to room temperature to create the crispy surface.
']

Title: Apple Tarte Tatin
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons butter', '¾ cup white sugar', '3 large Granny Smith apples - peeled, cored, and quartered', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', '1 9-inch unbaked pie crust (see footnote for recipe link)']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Coat a 10-inch oven-proof skillet with butter.
', 'Step 3: Sprinkle sugar evenly over the top of the butter.
', 'Step 4: Place apple quarters, rounded sides down, on top of the butter and sugar in a circular pattern.
', 'Step 5: Place skillet over medium-high heat and cook until butter melts and sugar dissolves and begins to caramelize.
', 'Step 6: Continue to cook until apples soften and caramel begins to brown, 10 to 12 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle work surface with flour and roll pie dough into an 11-inch circle.
', 'Step 9: Pinch edge to create a ruffle around crust.
', 'Step 10: Place crust on top of apples and tuck in edges around apples.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until crust is golden brown, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Allow to cool for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Place a plate over the top of the pan and carefully invert to release tarte from the pan.
', 'Step 14: Scrape any remaining apples stuck to the pan back on top of crust.
']

Title: Buche de Noel
Ingredients: ['2 cups heavy cream', "½ cup confectioners' sugar", '½ cup unsweetened cocoa powder', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '6 egg yolks', '½ cup white sugar', '⅓ cup unsweetened cocoa powder', '1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract', '⅛ teaspoon salt', '6 egg whites', '¼ cup white sugar', "confectioners' sugar for dusting"]
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a 10x15 inch jellyroll pan with parchment paper.
', "Step 3: In a large bowl, whip cream, 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar, 1/2 cup cocoa, and 1 teaspoon vanilla until thick and stiff.
", 'Step 4: Refrigerate.
', 'Step 5: In a large bowl, use an electric mixer to beat egg yolks with 1/2 cup sugar until thick and pale.
', 'Step 6: Blend in 1/3 cup cocoa, 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla, and salt.
', 'Step 7: In large glass bowl, using clean beaters, whip egg whites to soft peaks.
', 'Step 8: Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar, and beat until whites form stiff peaks.
', 'Step 9: Immediately fold the yolk mixture into the whites.
', 'Step 10: Spread the batter evenly into the prepared pan.
', 'Step 11: Bake for 12 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the cake springs back when lightly touched.
', "Step 12: Dust a clean dishtowel with confectioners' sugar.
", 'Step 13: Run a knife around the edge of the pan, and turn the warm cake out onto the towel.
', 'Step 14: Remove and discard parchment paper.
', 'Step 15: Starting at the short edge of the cake, roll the cake up with the towel.
', 'Step 16: Cool for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Unroll the cake, and spread the filling to within 1 inch of the edge.
', 'Step 18: Roll the cake up with the filling inside.
', 'Step 19: Place seam side down onto a serving plate, and refrigerate until serving.
', "Step 20: Dust with confectioners' sugar before serving.
"]

Title: Beef Bourguignon I
Ingredients: ['3 cups Burgundy wine', '2 tablespoons brandy', '2 onions, thinly sliced', '2 carrots, chopped', '1 sprig fresh parsley', '1 bay leaf', '1 clove garlic, crushed', '10 whole black peppercorns', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 pounds cubed beef chuck roast', '4 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '¼ pound bacon, cubed', '2 onions, chopped', '3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 tablespoon tomato paste', '2 cloves garlic, crushed', '1 (10.5 ounce) can beef broth', 'salt and pepper to taste', '4 tablespoons butter', '1 pound fresh mushrooms, sliced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: For marinade: In a large bowl, combine the wine, cognac, onions, carrots, parsley, bay leaf, garlic, peppercorns and salt.
', 'Step 2: Mix well and add the cubed beef.
', 'Step 3: Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 2 days.
', 'Step 4: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: For Bourguignon: Strain the meat from the vegetables and marinade; reserve marinade.
', 'Step 6: Dry meat with paper towels.
', 'Step 7: Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large skillet over medium high heat.
', 'Step 8: Add the meat and saute for 10 minutes, or until browned on all sides.
', 'Step 9: Transfer meat to a separate medium bowl with a slotted spoon and set aside.
', 'Step 10: In the same skillet, add the bacon and saute until lightly browned.
', 'Step 11: Transfer the bacon to the bowl with the meat.
', 'Step 12: Drain the skillet and return it to the heat.
', 'Step 13: Pour a cup of marinade into the skillet to deglaze the skillet, scraping the bottom to loosen up all the little bits.
', 'Step 14: Return this liquid to the reserved marinade.
', 'Step 15: Heat the remaining oil in the skillet.
', "Step 16: Add the onion and carrot from the marinade, along with the additional onion that you've chopped, and saute for 5 minutes, or until tender.
", 'Step 17: Transfer this mixture to the bowl with the meat and bacon, again using a slotted spoon, and return skillet to the heat.
', 'Step 18: Add the flour to the skillet, combining with the oil and stir until well mixed and brown, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Now add the tomato paste, garlic, beef broth, reserved marinade and salt and pepper to taste.
', 'Step 20: Bring to a boil and whisk to remove any flour lumps.
', 'Step 21: Add this to the meat and vegetable mixture.
', 'Step 22: Place entire mixture into a 9x13 baking dish.
', 'Step 23: Bake at 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) for 3 hours, stirring occasionally and adding water as needed.
', 'Step 24: Season with salt and pepper to taste.
', 'Step 25: About 15 minutes before meat is done baking, melt butter in the skillet over medium high heat.
', 'Step 26: Add the mushrooms and saute for 5 to 10 minutes, or until lightly browned.
', 'Step 27: When meat is done, add the mushrooms to the meat mixture, stir well and let sit for about 15 minutes.
']

Title: Regular Crepes
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups all-purpose flour', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '½ teaspoon salt', '2 cups milk', '2 tablespoons butter, melted', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '2 eggs']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a large bowl, sift together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.
', 'Step 2: Stir in the remaining ingredients; mix until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium high heat.
', 'Step 4: Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each crepe.
', 'Step 5: Tilt the pan with a circular motion so that the batter coats the surface evenly.
', 'Step 6: Cook the crepe for about 2 minutes, until the bottom is light brown.
', 'Step 7: Loosen with a spatula, turn and cook the other side.
', 'Step 8: Stack the finished crepes by putting wax paper between each one.
', 'Step 9: Keep covered with a dry cloth until ready to eat.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '110.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '15 g', 'cholesterolContent': '39.3 mg', 'fatContent': '3.7 g', 'fiberContent': '0.4 g', 'proteinContent': '4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '2 g', 'sodiumContent': '159.5 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.1 g'}

Title: Pain de Campagne - Country French Bread
Ingredients: ['½ teaspoon instant yeast', '½ cup warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)', '¾ cup whole wheat flour', '2 ½ cups warm water', '½ teaspoon instant yeast', '6 cups unbleached bread flour', '1 tablespoon kosher salt', '2 tablespoons cornmeal for dusting']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: To make the sponge, whisk the 1/2 teaspoon yeast in 1/2 cup warm water.
', 'Step 2: Stir in the whole wheat flour until the mixture resembles a thick batter.
', 'Step 3: Beat for about 100 strokes to form longs strands of gluten.
', 'Step 4: Cover the bowl with a damp cloth and let sit at room temperature for 2 to 8 hours (longer is better for flavor development).
', 'Step 5: You can also let the poolish ripen in the refrigerator for 12 to 15 hours, bringing it back to room temperature before proceeding with the recipe.
', 'Step 6: When the poolish is ready, it will be bubbly and loose, with a yeasty, sour aroma.
', 'Step 7: Scrape the poolish into a bowl and stir in the 2 1/2 cups water and the remaining 1/2 teaspoon yeast.
', 'Step 8: Stir well to combine.
', 'Step 9: Add the bread flour 1 cup at a time, mixing well after each addition, until the dough becomes too difficult to stir.
', 'Step 10: Transfer the dough to a floured work surface and knead for 10 to 12 minutes, adding more flour only when the dough becomes too sticky to handle.
', 'Step 11: Sprinkle the salt over the dough and knead it for an additional 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 12: The dough should have a smooth surface and spring back to the touch.
', 'Step 13: Shape the dough into a round and cover with a damp cloth for 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Place the dough in an oiled bowl, turning to coat the surface of the dough with oil.
', 'Step 15: Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rise at room temperature until doubled in size, about 2 to 3 hours.
', 'Step 16: Deflate the dough and cut it into two pieces.
', 'Step 17: Shape the dough into two rounds, cover them with plastic or a damp cloth, and allow the dough to rest for 30 minutes at room temperature.
', 'Step 18: Shape the dough into baguettes.
', 'Step 19: Place a heavily floured cloth on a baking sheet, arranging a fold down the center to separate the loaves.
', 'Step 20: Place the loaves, seam-side up, on the floured cloth.
', 'Step 21: Dust the tops of the loaves with flour, cover with a damp towel, and let rise until doubled in bulk again, about two hours.
', 'Step 22: Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 23: Sprinkle a baking sheet with cornmeal.
', 'Step 24: Gently transfer the risen loaves to the baking sheet, placing them seam-side down on the cornmeal.
', 'Step 25: Make several diagonal slashes in the loaf with a serrated knife or razor blade.
', 'Step 26: Immediately place the scored loaves in the preheated oven.
', 'Step 27: Bake the bread until the loaves are golden brown, about 25 to 30 minutes.
', 'Step 28: Cool the loaves on wire racks.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '47.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '10.1 g', 'fatContent': '0.3 g', 'fiberContent': '1.6 g', 'proteinContent': '1.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '723.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '0.1 g'}

Title: Cream Puffs I
Ingredients: ['½ cup white sugar', '5 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 pinch salt', '2 cups milk', '2 egg yolks, beaten', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '½ cup shortening', '1 cup water', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 pinch salt', '4 eggs']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: For the custard: In a small saucepan, combine 1/2 cup sugar, 5 tablespoons flour and a pinch of salt.
', 'Step 2: Stir in milk, a little at a time, until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
', 'Step 4: Boil 60 seconds, then pour a small amount of hot liquid into the 2 egg yolks, and stir.
', 'Step 5: Then return now heated egg yolks to saucepan and stir, over heat, until mixture starts to bubble again.
', 'Step 6: Remove from heat, add vanilla.
', 'Step 7: Cover and chill in refrigerator.
', 'Step 8: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 9: For the pastry: In a medium saucepan, combine shortening and water and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 10: Sift together 1 cup flour and a pinch of salt and pour all at once into boiling mixture.
', 'Step 11: Stir vigorously until mixture forms a ball.
', 'Step 12: Remove from heat, and add eggs, one at a time, stirring vigorously after each addition.
', 'Step 13: Drop by spoonfuls onto baking sheet, or pipe into desired shape.
', 'Step 14: Bake 10 minutes in the preheated oven, then reduce heat to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) and bake 25 minutes more, or until golden.
', 'Step 15: Cool completely, split, fill with custard, and replace tops.
']

Title: Chicken Paillard
Ingredients: ['4 (6 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '⅓ cup dry white wine', '1 lemon, juiced', '1 small shallot, chopped', '2 teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil', '1 clove garlic, crushed', '1 lemon, juiced', '1 tablespoon red wine vinegar', '1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', '2 teaspoons lemon zest', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, divided', '½ teaspoon salt, divided', '4 cups trimmed arugula', '8 ounces cherry tomatoes, halved']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Pound chicken breasts on a work surface using a meat tenderizer or heavy pan to 1/4-inch thick.
', 'Step 2: Whisk wine, juice of 1 lemon, shallot, 2 teaspoons olive oil, and garlic together in a shallow bowl.
', 'Step 3: Add chicken breasts; marinate for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Whisk juice of 1 lemon, vinegar, 1 tablespoon olive oil, and lemon zest together in a large bowl; stir in 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
', 'Step 5: Add arugula and tomatoes; toss to combine.
', 'Step 6: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate, or heat a skillet over high heat.
', 'Step 7: Remove chicken from marinade; season with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
', 'Step 8: Cook chicken on preheated grill until golden brown and just cooked through, 2 to 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 9: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 10: Plate chicken with arugula salad on top.
']

Title: Slow Cooker Chicken Cordon Bleu
Ingredients: ['6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup', '1 cup milk', '4 ounces sliced ham', '4 ounces sliced Swiss cheese', '1 (8 ounce) package herbed dry bread stuffing mix', '¼ cup butter, melted']

['Step 1: Mix together the cream of chicken soup and milk in a small bowl.
', 'Step 2: Pour enough of the soup into a slow cooker to cover the bottom.
', 'Step 3: Layer chicken breasts over the sauce.
', 'Step 4: Cover with slices of ham and then Swiss cheese.
', 'Step 5: Pour the remaining soup over the layers, stirring a little to distribute between layers.
', 'Step 6: Sprinkle the stuffing on top, and drizzle butter over stuffing.
', 'Step 7: Cover, and cook on Low for 4 to 6 hours, or 2 to 3 hours on High.
']

Title: Salad Nicoise
Ingredients: ['½ pound new potatoes, quartered', '¼ cup chopped fresh parsley', '¼ cup pitted nicoise olives', '½ onion, thinly sliced', '1 (5 ounce) can tuna', '⅓ pound fresh green beans - rinsed, trimmed and blanched', '½ pound mixed salad greens', '1 cup lemon vinaigrette', '3 hard-cooked eggs, quartered', '3 roma (plum) tomatoes, thinly sliced', '1 tablespoon capers', '4 anchovy filets']

Title: Shirred Eggs
Ingredients: ['¼ teaspoon softened butter', '2 teaspoons heavy cream', '2 eggs', 'salt and pepper to taste', '1 teaspoon minced fresh chives', '1 teaspoon grated Parmesan cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Rub the inside of a 6 ounce ramekin with butter.
', 'Step 3: Pour cream into the ramekin, then crack the eggs on top of the cream without breaking the yolks.
', 'Step 4: Use a spoon to position the yolks towards the center of the ramekin, then sprinkle with salt, pepper, chives, and Parmesan cheese.
', 'Step 5: Bake in preheated oven until the whites of the eggs have set and the yolks are still soft, 12 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove from oven, and allow to set for 2 to 3 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Breakfast Crepes
Ingredients: ['1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 cup milk', '1 egg', '1 pinch salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a medium-size mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, milk, egg and salt.
', 'Step 2: Heat a large frying pan or wok over medium high heat.
', 'Step 3: When the pan is hot add a teaspoon of butter and lightly coat the surface of the pan with the melted butter.
', 'Step 4: Pour one quarter cup of the batter into the pan and tilt the pan with a circular motion so that the batter coats the surface in a smooth and even layer.
', 'Step 5: After two minutes, lift up an edge of the crepe with a spatula to see if it is browning.
', 'Step 6: When the underside has begun to brown, flip the crepe and cook the other side until it is also brown; about 2 minutes.

', 'Step 8: Serve hot.
']

Title: Chocolate Crepes
Ingredients: ['2 eggs', '½ cup milk', '½ cup water', '¾ cup all-purpose flour', '6 teaspoons white sugar', '⅓ tablespoon butter or margarine', '1 fluid ounce cognac', '1 (3.9 ounce) package instant chocolate pudding mix', '1 teaspoon instant coffee granules', '3 cups heavy cream', '4 (1 ounce) squares bittersweet chocolate', '½ cup butter or margarine', '1 ¼ cups nonfat evaporated milk', "2 ½ cups confectioners' sugar"]
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Crepe batter: in a large bowl, mix together eggs, milk, water, flour, sugar, 1 teaspoon butter, and cognac.
', 'Step 2: Filling: beat pudding mix, instant coffee and whipping cream together with an electric mixer until the mixture is thick.
', "Step 3: Sauce: in a small saucepan, melt the chocolate, butter, evaporated milk, and confectioners' sugar together until the mixture is a little thick.
", 'Step 4: Crepes: heat a small skillet (or crepe pan) to a high temperature.
', 'Step 5: Place a small amount of batter into the skillet and swirl it around until the batter covers the bottom of the pan.
', 'Step 6: When the crepe is slightly browned flip the crepe over and let the other side brown for a few seconds.
', 'Step 7: The first crepe will most likely not turn out well, but the rest will.
', 'Step 8: Stack the crepes on top of each other to let tem cool before filling.
', 'Step 9: Spoon the filling into the center of each crepe and roll the crepe up around it.
', 'Step 10: Spoon the sauce over the crepes and serve.
']

Title: Irish Cream Crème Brûlée
Ingredients: ['2 cups heavy cream', '⅓ cup white sugar', '6 large egg yolks', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '3 tablespoons Irish cream liqueur', 'superfine sugar as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place 6 ramekins on a towel set in a roasting pan at least 3 inches deep.
', 'Step 3: Stir together cream and sugar in a saucepan over medium heat, and cook until very hot, stirring until the sugar dissolves.
', 'Step 4: Whisk together egg yolks, vanilla, and Irish cream until combined.
', 'Step 5: Slowly add 1/3 of the hot cream, whisking it in 2 tablespoons at a time until incorporated.
', 'Step 6: Once you have incorporated 1/3 of the cream, you can stir in the remaining hot cream without fear of the mixture curdling.
', 'Step 7: Pour custard into the ramekins, then fill roasting pan with boiling hot water to come halfway up the sides of the ramekins.
', 'Step 8: Bake in preheated oven until set, 50 to 60 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Once the custard has set, place ramekins on a wire rack, and allow to cool to room temperature, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 10: Cover, and refrigerate until cold, about 4 hours.
', 'Step 11: Custards may remain refrigerated until ready to serve.
', 'Step 12: Unwrap the custards, and sprinkle about 1 teaspoon of superfine sugar onto each.
', 'Step 13: Gently shake the custards so the sugar coats the entire top surface, then tip the custards to a 45-degree angle and shake off excess sugar.
', 'Step 14: Using a small hand torch, melt the sugar by making short passes over top of the custards with the flame not quite touching.
', 'Step 15: Continue melting the sugar until it turns deep brown.
', 'Step 16: Once the sugar has melted and turned to caramel, the cold custard underneath will harden the sugar into a crispy crust.
', 'Step 17: Serve immediately.
', 'Step 18: Alternatively, the sugar-dusted custards may be browned underneath the broiler in the oven.
']

Title: Easy Yogurt Cake
Ingredients: ['1 (5 ounce) container plain yogurt', '1/2 yogurt container vegetable oil', '2 large eggs', '1 1/2 yogurt containers white sugar', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 3/4 yogurt containers all-purpose flour', '2 ½ teaspoons baking powder', '1 pinch salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 9-inch round springform cake pan.
', 'Step 3: Empty the yogurt into a mixing bowl.
', 'Step 4: Measure the oil, using the yogurt container, and add to the yogurt.
', 'Step 5: Set aside.
', 'Step 6: Rinse yogurt container and dry with paper towel to continue using it as a measuring tool.
', 'Step 7: Add eggs, sugar, and vanilla extract to the yogurt-oil mixture.
', 'Step 8: Beat well until thoroughly combined.
', 'Step 9: Add flour, baking powder, and salt.
', 'Step 10: Stir until just combined; batter will be thick.
', 'Step 11: Pour into the prepared cake pan and spread to level the top.

']

Title: Beef Bourguignon Without the Burgundy
Ingredients: ['1 (2 1/2 pound) boneless beef chuck roast, cut into 2-inch cubes', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 onion, chopped', '1 tablespoon butter', '2 tablespoons flour', '2 cups Merlot wine', '2 cups beef broth', '2 carrots, cut into 1-inch pieces', '2 stalks celery, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', '4 sprigs fresh thyme', '1 bay leaf']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Generously season beef with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 2: Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over high heat.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir beef cubes in hot oil until browned on all sides, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Transfer meat to a plate.
', 'Step 5: Cook and stir onion, butter, and a pinch of salt in the Dutch oven until onion begins to sweat.
', 'Step 6: Stir flour into onion mixture; cook and stir until onion starts to soften, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Pour wine into onion mixture; bring to a simmer and cook until wine is reduced by half, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Return beef and any accumulated juices to the Dutch oven.
', 'Step 9: Add beef broth, carrots, celery, thyme sprigs, bay leaf, and salt.
', 'Step 10: Bring to a simmer, cover the pot with a lid, and simmer for 1 1/2 hours on low until meat is almost tender.
', 'Step 11: Remove cover from the Dutch oven and simmer uncovered until meat is tender and stew is thick, about 30 minutes more.
', 'Step 12: Season with salt and pepper.
']

Title: Puff Pastry Shells

', 'Step 2: Cut two rounds from each sheet of puff pastry using a 3-inch round cutter, forming 8 circles.
', 'Step 3: Use a 2 1/2-inch round cutter to cut through 4 of the rounds.
', 'Step 4: Place entire cut round on top of an un-cut round.
', 'Step 5: Brush each with egg mixture.
', 'Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until puffed and golden, 20 to 25 minutes.
']

Title: How to Make Cassoulet
Ingredients: ['1 pound dried Great Northern beans', '1 whole clove', '½ onion', '4 cloves garlic, smashed', '1 bay leaf', '1 teaspoon dried thyme', '½ teaspoon dried rosemary', '10 cups water', '½ pound thick-sliced bacon, chopped', '2 ribs celery, diced', '2 carrots, diced', '½ onion, diced', 'salt to taste', '1 teaspoon olive oil', '1 pound link sausages (preferably French herb sausage), cut in half crosswise', '1 pound cooked duck leg confit', '1 ½ teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper', '1 teaspoon herbes de Provence', '1 (14 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '¼ cup butter', '4 cloves garlic, crushed', '2 cups panko bread crumbs', '1 bunch fresh parsley, finely chopped', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '1 tablespoon olive oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Soak Great Northern beans in water in a large bowl overnight.
', 'Step 2: Drain beans and place into a large soup pot.
', 'Step 3: Push whole clove into the 1/2 onion and add to beans; stir in garlic, bay leaf, thyme, rosemary, and 10 cups water.
', 'Step 4: Bring beans to a simmer and cook over medium-low heat until beans have started to soften, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 5: Drain beans and reserve the cooking liquid, removing and discarding onion with clove and bay leaf.
', 'Step 6: Transfer beans to a large mixing bowl.
', 'Step 7: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Cook bacon in a large, heavy Dutch oven over medium heat until lightly browned and still limp, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Stir celery, carrots, and 1/2 diced onion into bacon; season with salt.
', 'Step 10: Cook and stir vegetables in the hot bacon fat until tender, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Heat 1 teaspoon olive oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat; brown sausage link halves and duck confit in the hot oil until browned, about 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 12: Season vegetable-bacon mixture with 1 1/2 teaspoon salt, cracked black pepper, and herbes de Provence; pour in diced tomatoes.
', 'Step 13: Cook and stir mixture over medium heat until juice from tomatoes has nearly evaporated and any browned bits of food on the bottom of pot have dissolved, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Stir mixture into beans.
', 'Step 15: Spread half the bean mixture into the heavy Dutch oven and place duck-sausage mixture over the beans; spread remaining beans over meat layer.
', 'Step 16: Pour just enough of the reserved bean liquid into pot to reach barely to the top of the beans, reserving remaining liquid.
', 'Step 17: Bring bean cassoulet to a simmer on stovetop and cover Dutch oven with lid.
', 'Step 18: Bake bean cassoulet in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat; add 4 crushed garlic cloves, panko crumbs, and parsley to the melted butter.
', 'Step 20: Season with salt and black pepper, and drizzle 1 tablespoon olive oil over crumbs.
', 'Step 21: Stir to thoroughly combine.
', 'Step 22: Uncover cassoulet and check liquid level; mixture should still have several inches of liquid.
', 'Step 23: If beans seem dry, add more of the reserved bean liquid.
', 'Step 24: Spread half the crumb mixture evenly over the beans and return to oven.
', 'Step 25: Cook, uncovered, for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 26: There should be about 2 or 3 inches of liquid at the bottom of the pot; if mixture seems dry, add more reserved bean mixture.
', 'Step 27: Sprinkle remaining half the bread crumb mixture over cassoulet.
', 'Step 28: Turn oven heat to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and bake cassoulet, uncovered, until crumb topping is crisp, edges are bubbling, and the bubbles are slow and sticky, 20 to 25 more minutes.
', 'Step 29: Serve beans on individual plates and top each serving with a piece of duck and several sausage pieces.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '524.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '54 g', 'cholesterolContent': '81 mg', 'fatContent': '23.7 g', 'fiberContent': '11.1 g', 'proteinContent': '30.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '8.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '1208.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.3 g'}

Title: Perfect Creme Brulee
Ingredients: ['3 egg yolks', '¼ cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 cup heavy cream', '1 tablespoon brown sugar', '2 tablespoons white sugar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Move a rack to the bottom of the oven.
', 'Step 3: Whisk the egg yolks, sugar, and vanilla together in a stainless steel bowl until smooth.
', 'Step 4: Bring the cream just to a simmer in a saucepan over medium-low heat; pour into the egg yolk mixture, whisking continually until combined.
', 'Step 5: Bring a couple of inches of water to a simmer in an oven-safe saucepan over medium low heat; set the bowl with the cream mixture over the saucepan to form a double boiler.
', 'Step 6: Place the entire double boiler into the preheated oven; bake until the mixture sets, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Chill in refrigerator 2 hours.
', "Step 8: Preheat the oven's broiler and set the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source.
", 'Step 9: Combine the brown sugar with 2 tablespoons of white sugar in a bowl; sprinkle evenly over the cold creme.
', 'Step 10: Heat under the preheated broiler until the sugar melts and browns, 2 to 3 minutes; return immediately to the refrigerator and chill until the sugar is set, about 15 minutes.
']

Title: Gateau Breton
Ingredients: ['6 egg yolks', '1 tablespoon water', '1 ½ cups all-purpose flour', '1 cup butter, softened', '¾ cup white sugar', '2 tablespoons cornstarch']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a 9-inch springform pan.
', 'Step 3: Mix 1 teaspoon egg yolk and water in a small bowl.
', 'Step 4: Set aside for glazing the cake.

Title: Macarons
Ingredients: ['4 extra large egg whites', "1 ⅔ cups confectioners' sugar", '1 ⅓ cups almond flour', '⅛ teaspoon salt', '¼ cup superfine (castor) sugar']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place egg whites into a metal mixing bowl and refrigerate overnight.
', 'Step 2: The next day, bring egg whites to room temperature.
', 'Step 3: Preheat oven to 280 degrees F (138 degrees C).
', 'Step 4: Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
', "Step 5: Whisk confectioners' sugar and almond flour in a bowl.
", 'Step 6: Beat the egg whites with salt in metal bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed until foamy, about 1 minute; increase speed to high and gradually beat in superfine sugar, about 1 tablespoon at a time, until the egg whites are glossy and hold stiff peaks, 3 to 5 more minutes.
', 'Step 7: Gently fold almond flour mixture into whipped egg whites until thoroughly incorporated; spoon meringue into a pastry big fitted with a 3/8-inch tip.
', 'Step 8: Pipe 1-inch disks of meringue onto the prepared baking sheets, leaving 2 inches of space between cookies.
', 'Step 9: The batter will spread.
', 'Step 10: Lift the baking sheets a few inches above the work surface and hit them lightly on the work surface several times to remove any air bubbles from the cookies.
', 'Step 11: Let the cookies stand at room temperature until the shiny surfaces become dull and a thin skin forms, about 15 minutes.
', "Step 12: Place the baking sheets in the preheated oven and bake with the oven door open slightly until the macarons' surfaces are completely dry, about 15 minutes.
", 'Step 13: Let cookies cool completely on a baking sheet before peeling parchment paper from the cookies.
', 'Step 14: Spread half the cookies with any desired filling, top with remaining cookies to make sandwiches, and refrigerate at least 2 hours to overnight to let the cookies soften.
']

Title: How to Make Bordelaise Sauce
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon butter', '4 large shallots, peeled and sliced', '1 pinch salt', '1 cup red wine', '2 cups veal stock', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place butter and shallots into a saucepan with pinch of salt; cook and stir shallots over medium-low heat until caramelized and browned, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Stir occasionally.
', 'Step 3: Add red wine and bring to a simmer.
', 'Step 4: n Reduce heat to low; cook until wine is nearly evaporated and pan juices are thick and slightly syrupy.
', 'Step 5: Watch carefully, mixture burns easily.
', 'Step 6: Add veal stock, return to a simmer, and cook until reduced by half and sauce is slightly thickened, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: n Pour sauce through a fine mesh strainer set over a container.
', 'Step 8: Tap the strainer with a spoon while straining and squeeze out the last remaining drops of sauce from the residue.
', 'Step 9: Season sauce to taste with salt and black pepper.
']

Title: American French Onion Soup
Ingredients: ['¼ cup unsalted butter', '6 large yellow onions, diced', '3 tablespoons dry sherry', '1 tablespoon sherry vinegar, or to taste', '4 cups chicken broth', '4 cups beef broth', '3 sprigs fresh thyme', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '6 slices French bread', '¼ cup butter, melted', '1 cup shredded extra-sharp Cheddar cheese', '1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Melt 1/4 cup butter in a large, oven-safe skillet on medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Stir in onions until they are all coated in butter.
', 'Step 4: Transfer skillet to the preheated oven and cook onions, stirring occasionally, until they are tender and well browned, about 1 hour.

', 'Step 8: Pour in chicken broth, beef broth, and thyme.
', 'Step 9: Bring to a boil, skimming off any foam and fat that appear on top.

', "Step 12: Preheat the oven's broiler and set the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source.
", 'Step 13: Generously brush French bread slices with melted butter.
', 'Step 14: Place on a baking sheet and broil in the preheated oven until crisp and golden, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Ladle soup into heat-proof bowls, top each bowl with a piece of toasted bread, sprinkle with 2 to 3 tablespoons of Cheddar cheese and Monterey Jack cheese.
', 'Step 16: Broil bowls of soup under the broiler until cheese is golden and bubbly, 5 to 6 minutes.

Title: French Butter Cakes (Madeleines)
Ingredients: ['2 eggs', '¾ teaspoon vanilla extract', '⅛ teaspoon salt', '⅓ cup white sugar', '½ cup all-purpose flour', '1 tablespoon lemon zest', '¼ cup butter', '⅓ cup granulated sugar for decoration']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Butter and flour 12 (3 inch) madeleine molds; set aside.
', 'Step 3: Melt butter and let cool to room temperature.
', 'Step 4: In a small mixing bowl, beat eggs, vanilla and salt at high speed until light.
', 'Step 5: Beating constantly, gradually add sugar; and continue beating at high speed until mixture is thick and pale and ribbons form in bowl when beaters are lifted, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Sift flour into egg mixture 1/3 at a time, gently folding after each addition.
', 'Step 7: Add lemon zest and pour melted butter around edge of batter.
', 'Step 8: Quickly but gently fold butter into batter.
', 'Step 9: Spoon batter into molds; it will mound slightly above tops.
', 'Step 10: Bake 14 to 17 minutes, or until cakes are golden and the tops spring back when gently pressed with your fingertip.
', 'Step 11: Use the tip of the knife to loosen madeleines from pan; invert onto rack.
', 'Step 12: Immediately sprinkle warm cookies with granulated sugar.
', "Step 13: Madeleines are best eaten the day they're baked.
", 'Step 14: Leftover madeleines are wonderful when dunked into coffee or tea.
', 'Step 15: Variation: Chocolate Madeleines: Omit lemon zest.
', 'Step 16: Increase sugar to 1/2 cup.
', 'Step 17: Substitute 1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder for 2 tablespoons of the flour; sift into batter with flour.
']

Title: Quiche Lorraine II

Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).

Title: French Macarons
Ingredients: ['3 extra-large egg whites', '⅓ cup white sugar', "1 ⅔ cups confectioners' sugar", '1 cup almond flour', '1 pinch salt', '½ cup butter, softened', "⅔ cup confectioners' sugar", '½ teaspoon vanilla extract']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
', 'Step 3: Beat egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed until foamy, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 4: Add white sugar and continue to beat until peaks are stiff enough they stay in place when the bowl is turned upside down, about 5 minutes.
', "Step 5: Sift 1 2/3 cup confectioners' sugar, almond flour, and salt together twice.
", 'Step 6: Fold into the egg whites until batter is creamy and falls slowly off the lifted spatula, about 50 turns with a spatula.
', 'Step 7: Transfer batter to a piping bag fitted with a round tip.
', 'Step 8: Pipe batter onto the parchment paper, using a circular motion to make macarons 1 inch in diameter.
', 'Step 9: Tap the baking sheet against the counter about 10 times to release any air bubbles.
', 'Step 10: Bake in the preheated oven for 9 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Rotate baking sheet and continue baking until macarons are shiny and rise slightly to form "feet", about 9 minutes more.
', 'Step 12: Peel off the parchment paper and allow to cool completely, about 30 minutes.
', "Step 13: Beat butter, 2/3 cup confectioners' sugar, and vanilla extract with an electric mixer until creamy and thick, about 10 minutes.
", 'Step 14: Transfer filling to a piping bag fitted with a round tip.
', 'Step 15: Pipe a small amount of filling onto the center of 1 macaron; top with another macaron and press gently to sandwich the filling between the two.
']
