Title: No-Knead Artisan Style Bread
Ingredients: ['3 cups all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon active dry yeast', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 ⅔ cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)', '1 teaspoon chopped fresh rosemary', '1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme', '1 teaspoon chopped fresh sage']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine the flour, yeast, and salt in a large bowl and mix to combine.
', 'Step 2: Add the water and herbs, if using, and mix well.
', 'Step 3: The dough will be very sticky and shaggy-looking.
', 'Step 4: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and set aside at room temperature for 18 to 24 hours.
', 'Step 5: Generously flour a work surface.
', 'Step 6: The dough will have risen and will be covered in bubbles.
', 'Step 7: Transfer the dough to the work surface and dust it with flour.
', 'Step 8: Fold the dough in half, and then form the dough into a ball by stretching and tucking the edges of the dough underneath the ball.
', 'Step 9: Liberally flour a kitchen towel (do not use terrycloth).
', 'Step 10: Place the dough ball on the floured towel.
', 'Step 11: Cover with another floured towel.
', 'Step 12: Let the dough rise for about two hours [see footnote].
', 'Step 13: Preheat an oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 14: Place a lidded Dutch oven or deep heavy duty casserole dish (with lid) into the oven to preheat.
', 'Step 15: Carefully remove the hot baking dish from the oven.
', 'Step 16: Remove the lid and gently turn the dough ball into the ungreased baking dish, seam-side up; shake the dish so the dough is more evenly distributed.
', 'Step 17: Cover and bake for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Remove the lid and bake until the crust is golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Remove the loaf from the baking dish and let it cool on a rack before slicing.
']

Title: Grand Marnier® Souffle
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter, melted', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '5 teaspoons butter, melted', '5 teaspoons all-purpose flour', '¼ cup cold milk', '2 egg yolks', '1 teaspoon freshly grated orange zest', '1 tablespoon brandy-based orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier®)', '⅛ teaspoon vanilla extract', '2 egg whites', '¼ cup white sugar, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Brush the insides of 2 (8-ounce) ramekins with 1 tablespoon melted butter and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon sugar.
', 'Step 3: Place on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 4: Melt 1 tablespoon butter and 2 teaspoons butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat; cook and stir flour in the melted butter until golden brown and fragrant, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Pour in milk and cook, stirring continuously, until smooth and thick, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove from heat and transfer to a mixing bowl.
', 'Step 7: Stir orange zest and 1 tablespoon brandy-based orange liqueur into butter mixture until combined.
', 'Step 8: Add egg yolks and 1/8 teaspoon vanilla; mix until smooth.
', 'Step 9: Whisk egg whites in a large bowl until frothy.
', 'Step 10: Slowly add half the 1/4 cup sugar and whisk until combined; add remaining sugar and continue to whisk until meringue is thick and holds it shape, but is not stiff.
', 'Step 11: Fold half the meringue into egg yolk mixture until combined.
', 'Step 12: Gently fold in second half until well mixed.
', 'Step 13: Transfer to the prepared ramekins, allowing 1/4-inch of space at the top.
', 'Step 14: Bake in the preheated oven until risen and browned, 16 minutes.
']

Title: Authentic French Meringues
Ingredients: ['4 egg whites', "2 ¼ cups confectioners' sugar"]
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Butter and flour a baking sheet.
', 'Step 3: In a glass or metal bowl, whip egg whites until foamy using an electric mixer.
', 'Step 4: Sprinkle in sugar a little at a time, while continuing to whip at medium speed.
', 'Step 5: When the mixture becomes stiff and shiny like satin, stop mixing, and transfer the mixture to a large pastry bag.
', 'Step 6: Pipe the meringue out onto the prepared baking sheet using a large round tip or star tip.
', 'Step 7: Place the meringues in the oven and place a wooden spoon handle in the door to keep it from closing all the way.
', 'Step 8: Bake for 3 hours, or until the meringues are dry, and can easily be removed from the pan.
', 'Step 9: Allow cookies to cool completely before storing in an airtight container at room temperature.

Title: How to Make French Baguettes
Ingredients: ['¼ teaspoon rapid rise yeast', '1 ½ cups water at room temperature', '1 ¾ teaspoons salt', '4 cups all-purpose flour, or as needed', '½ teaspoon cornmeal, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place yeast into the bottom of a large mixing bowl and stir with water; mix in salt.
', 'Step 2: Beat flour into yeast mixture with a wooden spoon until dough is thick and sticky and pulls flour from the side of the bowl, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Cover bowl with plastic wrap and let stand in a turned-off oven until doubled in size, 12 to 14 hours.
', 'Step 4: Dough will be bubbly and very sticky.
', 'Step 5: Place a silicone baking mat onto a baking sheet and dust generously with cornmeal.
', 'Step 6: Use a floured spatula to scrape dough out onto a well-floured work surface and dust dough with flour.
', 'Step 7: With well-floured hands, pat dough into a rectangle and cut into 4 equal-size pieces.
', 'Step 8: Dust a piece of dough with flour and use your floured fingers to gently roll and stretch it out into a log about 10 inches long and 1 1/2 inches around.
', 'Step 9: Gently transfer to prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 10: If desired, wipe off excess cornmeal with a damp paper towel.
', 'Step 11: Repeat with another piece of dough.
', 'Step 12: (Reserve remaining dough to bake later or prepare 2 baking sheets to bake all 4 at once).
', 'Step 13: Dust loaves lightly with flour.
', 'Step 14: Dust a large piece of plastic wrap with flour and drape plastic lightly over the baking sheet with floured side down.
', 'Step 15: Let loaves rise, covered, until doubled, 1 to 1 1/2 hour.
', 'Step 16: Move oven racks to the bottom and middle positions.
', 'Step 17: Preheat oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C) or as high as your oven will go.
', 'Step 18: Place an oven-safe baking dish full of water into bottom rack of the oven.
', 'Step 19: Use a sharp kitchen shears to cut 4 or 5 angled slashes into the top of each loaf.
', 'Step 20: Poke down the little sharp tips of dough left by the scissors.
', 'Step 21: Spray loaves with water, using a spray bottle.
', 'Step 22: Bake in the preheated oven until baguettes are browned, about 15 minutes, spraying loaves with water after 5 minutes and 10 minutes.
', 'Step 23: Turn the pan around on the second spraying.
', 'Step 24: Transfer baguettes to a cooling rack and let cool to room temperature before slicing with a serrated knife.
']

Title: Baked Potato Puffs
Ingredients: ['4 small Yukon gold potatoes, or as needed, quartered', '½ cup water', '¼ cup butter', 'kosher salt to taste', '½ cup flour', '2 large eggs', '1 pinch cayenne pepper', '1 pinch freshly grated nutmeg']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain and mash.
', 'Step 4: Set aside.
', 'Step 5: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Butter 24 mini muffin cups.
', 'Step 7: Combine water and butter in a saucepan over medium heat and season with salt.
', 'Step 8: Heat until butter melts and starts to bubble.
', 'Step 9: Stir in flour until mixture pulls away from the pan and comes together into a dough.
', 'Step 10: Transfer pastry dough to a bowl.
', 'Step 11: Spread in the bowl and let cool, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Mix in eggs using a spatula until dough is very soft and sticky.
', 'Step 13: Add 2 cups of the mashed potatoes and mix until well combined.
', 'Step 14: Add a pinch of salt, cayenne pepper, and nutmeg.
', 'Step 15: Give it one last mix.
', 'Step 16: Scoop potato dough into the greased muffin cups.
', 'Step 17: Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and puffed, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Let rest for 1 minute before removing puffs onto a wire rack.
', 'Step 19: Let cool for 5 minutes and serve warm.
']

Title: Delicious Easy Chicken Francese
Ingredients: ['½ cup all-purpose flour', '4 eggs, beaten', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '½ cup white wine', '2 cups chicken broth', '1 teaspoon chopped fresh parsley', 'salt and pepper to taste', '¼ cup butter', '2 lemons, juiced', '1 teaspoon cornstarch']

Title: French Macaroons
Ingredients: ['3 egg whites', '6 tablespoons superfine (castor) sugar', '1 cup finely ground almonds', '1 ½ teaspoons finely ground almonds', "1 ⅓ cups confectioners' sugar"]
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 320 degrees F (160 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line baking sheets with parchment paper or a silicon mat.
', 'Step 3: Whisk egg whites in a clean metal mixing bowl until thick, about 5 minutes; whisk the superfine sugar into the egg whites until thick, glossy, and the mixture holds stiff peaks, 5 to 8 more minutes.
', "Step 4: Place a sieve over the bowl containing egg whites and sieve both amounts of almond meal and confectioners' sugar into the egg white mixture.
", "Step 5: Gently fold the almond meal and confectioners' sugar into the egg whites, retaining as much air as possible.
", 'Step 6: Separate the meringue into separate bowls to flavor and color, if desired.
', 'Step 7: Spoon the meringue into a piping bag fitted with a 3/8-inch tip.
', 'Step 8: Pipe 1-inch disks of meringue onto the prepared baking sheets, leaving about 2 inches between cookies.
', 'Step 9: Let the cookies stand at room temperature for about 15 minutes to form a thin skin.
', 'Step 10: Pick up the baking sheets and let drop from several inches above the work surface to adhere cookies to the baking sheets.
', 'Step 11: Bake in the preheated oven until tops are dry, about 15 minutes; let cool completely on the baking sheets before peeling off the parchment paper.
']

Title: Traditional Layered French Croissants
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 ½ cups unsalted butter, at room temperature', '4 cups all-purpose flour, divided', '½ teaspoon salt', '3 tablespoons sugar', '2 (.25 ounce) packages active dry yeast', '¼ cup lukewarm water', '1 cup milk', '½ cup heavy cream', '1 egg', '1 tablespoon water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Sprinkle 2 tablespoons of flour over the butter and mix it together with your hands in a mixing bowl or on a work surface.
', 'Step 2: Transfer the butter to a length of foil or parchment paper and pat it into a 6 inch square.
', 'Step 3: Fold up the foil to make a packet and refrigerate until chilled, about 2 hours.
', 'Step 4: Combine 2 cups of the flour with the salt and sugar in a mixing bowl.
', 'Step 5: Dissolve the yeast in the lukewarm water (100 degrees F/38 degrees C) and set aside until frothy, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Meanwhile, warm the milk and the heavy cream to lukewarm.
', 'Step 7: Add the yeast, milk, and cream to the flour mixture and stir well.
', 'Step 8: The dough will have a batter-like consistency.
', 'Step 9: Stir in the remaining 2 cups of flour 1/4 cup at a time to form a soft dough.
', 'Step 10: It should no longer be sticky.
', 'Step 11: Turn the dough onto a lightly floured work surface and knead until smooth, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Place the dough in a mixing bowl and cover with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 13: Refrigerate for 1 hour.
', 'Step 14: To begin the rolling and folding process, both the butter and the dough should be at a cool room temperature.
', "Step 15: [See Cook's Note.
", 'Step 16: ] Place the dough on a floured surface and roll it into a 10-inch square.
', 'Step 17: Set the block of butter diagonally on the square dough.
', 'Step 18: Bring each point of dough to the center of the butter square; the edges of the dough should overlap.
', 'Step 19: Pinch the edges together to seal.
', 'Step 20: Starting from the center of the square and working outward, use a rolling pin to roll the dough out into a rectangle.
', "Step 21: The butter should be pliable enough to roll smoothly with the dough; if it's too soft and starts to ooze out the corners, wrap the dough in plastic and refrigerate before proceeding.
", 'Step 22: Roll the dough into a long rectangle, approximately 8 by 18 inches.
', 'Step 23: Fold the length of dough into thirds, like a business letter.
', 'Step 24: If the dough is still cool, you can continue with another fold.
', 'Step 25: Otherwise, wrap it in plastic and refrigerate for 45 minutes to 1 hour.
', 'Step 26: Remove the dough from the refrigerator and let it warm up for about 10 minutes before you begin rolling it out again.
', "Step 27: Position the dough so that the open ends are at 12 and 6 o'clock.
", 'Step 28: Roll the dough into a rectangle, working from the center of the dough and pressing outwards.
', 'Step 29: Reposition the dough as necessary to fit your work space.
', 'Step 30: You should have a long rectangle for the "book fold".
', "Step 31: Fold both ends of the dough into the middle; the ends don't have to be touching, but should be close.
", 'Step 32: Fold the already-folded dough in half; it will look like a thick book.
', 'Step 33: Wrap the dough well with plastic and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours.
', 'Step 34: Remove the dough from the refrigerator and let it rest at room temperature for about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 35: Roll the dough into a rectangle again and fold it into thirds, like a business letter.
', 'Step 36: Wrap it in plastic and refrigerate for 4-6 hours or overnight.
', 'Step 37: To shape the croissants, roll the dough into a 10- by 38-inch rectangle on a lightly floured work surface.
', 'Step 38: It should be about 1/4 inch thick.
', 'Step 39: Use a pizza wheel or sharp paring knife to trim the edges of the dough.
', 'Step 40: Divide the rectangle in half so that you have two 5-inch wide strips of dough.
', 'Step 41: Use a clean yardstick to mark each strip into triangles that are 5 inches wide at their bases.
', 'Step 42: Cut the triangles and place them onto parchment-lined baking sheets.
', 'Step 43: Chill for 15 to 20 minutes, if necessary.
', 'Step 44: Starting at the base of the triangle, roll the dough up into a log; the tip of the triangle should be under the body of the croissant to prevent it from unraveling.
', 'Step 45: Bend in the corners to form the traditional crescent shape.
', 'Step 46: Repeat with the remaining dough.
', 'Step 47: Arrange the croissants on the parchment-lined baking sheets and allow to rise until doubled in size, about 1 to 2 hours.
', 'Step 48: Preheat an oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 49: Beat the egg with the tablespoon of water to make the egg wash.
', 'Step 50: Brush the croissants with egg wash and bake in the preheated oven until deep brown, 22 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 51: Cool on a rack before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '212.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '18.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '44.9 mg', 'fatContent': '14 g', 'fiberContent': '0.7 g', 'proteinContent': '3.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '8.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '139.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.1 g'}

Title: French Onion Soup V

Title: Chef John's Coq Au Vin
Ingredients: ['6 bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs', '1 pinch kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '8 ounces bacon, sliced crosswise into 1/2-inch pieces', '10 large button mushrooms, quartered', '½ large yellow onion, diced', '2 shallots, sliced', '2 teaspoons all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons butter', '1 ½ cups red wine', '6 sprigs fresh thyme', '1 cup chicken broth']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Season chicken thighs all over with salt and black pepper.
', 'Step 3: Place bacon in a large, oven-proof skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Transfer bacon with a slotted spoon to a paper-towel lined plate, leaving drippings in the skillet.
', 'Step 5: Increase heat to high and place chicken, skin-side down, into skillet.
', 'Step 6: Cook in hot skillet until browned, 2 to 4 minutes per side.
', 'Step 7: Transfer chicken to a plate; drain and discard all but 1 tablespoon drippings from the skillet.
', 'Step 8: Lower heat to medium-high; saute mushrooms, onion, and shallots with a pinch of salt in the hot skillet until golden and caramelized, 7 to 12 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Stir flour and butter into vegetable mixture until completely incorporated, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 10: Pour red wine into the skillet and bring to a boil while scraping browned bits of food off of the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon.
', 'Step 11: Stir bacon and thyme into red wine mixture; simmer until wine is about 1/3 reduced, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Pour chicken broth into wine mixture and set chicken thighs into skillet; bring wine and stock to a simmer.
', 'Step 13: Cook chicken in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Spoon pan juices over the chicken and continue cooking until no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 30 minutes more.
', 'Step 15: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 16: Transfer chicken to a platter.
', 'Step 17: Place skillet over high heat and reduce pan juices, skimming fat off the top as necessary, until sauce thickens slightly, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Season with salt and pepper; remove and discard thyme.
', 'Step 19: Pour sauce over chicken.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '334.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '7.7 g', 'cholesterolContent': '81.3 mg', 'fatContent': '17.9 g', 'fiberContent': '0.8 g', 'proteinContent': '24.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '5.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '422.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.1 g'}

Title: Chef John's Croissants
Ingredients: ['1 cup warm water (100 degrees F or 38 degrees C)', '1 (.25 ounce) package active dry yeast', '¼ cup granulated white sugar', '3 ½ cups unbleached bread flour', '3 teaspoons kosher salt', '6 tablespoons butter, room temperature, cut into pieces', '2 sticks unsalted European-style butter', '1 egg', '1 tablespoon water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place warm water in the bowl of a stand mixer.
', 'Step 2: Sprinkle with yeast.
', 'Step 3: Let yeast dissolve for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add sugar and bread flour.
', 'Step 5: Sprinkle with salt; add 6 tablespoons butter.
', 'Step 6: Attach the bowl to the stand mixer.
', 'Step 7: Mix dough with the dough hook just until butter is completely kneaded in and the dough forms a ball and pulls away cleanly from the sides of the bowl, 3 or 4 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Transfer dough to a work surface and form into a semi-smooth ball.
', 'Step 9: Place dough back in the mixer bowl; cover.
', 'Step 10: Let rise in a warm spot until doubled, about 2 hours.
', 'Step 11: Transfer dough to a lightly floured work surface.
', 'Step 12: Push and press dough to deflate it, and form it into a rectangle.
', 'Step 13: Fold into thirds by lifting one end over the middle third, and folding the other side onto the middle.
', 'Step 14: Wrap in plastic wrap.
', 'Step 15: Place on a rimmed baking sheet lined with a silicone mat.
', 'Step 16: Refrigerate until chilled through, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 17: Cut 2 sticks butter in half lengthwise and place slightly apart from each other on a length of parchment paper long enough to fold over the butter.
', 'Step 18: Fold the parchment paper over the butter.
', 'Step 19: Press butter down.
', 'Step 20: Roll out with a rolling pin to a square about 8x8 inches.
', 'Step 21: Refrigerate until a little chilled and just barely flexible, 10 or 15 minutes.
', 'Step 22: Roll dough out into a rectangle slightly wider than the butter slab and just over twice as long.
', 'Step 23: Place butter on one half of the dough leaving about 1 inch margin from the edge of the dough.
', 'Step 24: Fold the other half of the dough over the butter.
', 'Step 25: Dust work surface and dough with flour as needed.
', 'Step 26: Press rolling pin down on dough to create ridges.
', 'Step 27: Then roll out the ridges.
', 'Step 28: Repeat this process.
', 'Step 29: Keep pressing and rolling until dough is about the same size rectangle as you had before you folded it in half, dusting with just a bit of flour as necessary.
', 'Step 30: Starting from the short side, fold one-third of dough over middle third.
', 'Step 31: Then fold the other end over to form a small rectangle.
', 'Step 32: Flatten out just slightly with rolling pin.
', 'Step 33: Transfer to the silicone-lined baking sheet; cover with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 34: Refrigerate until chilled, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 35: Transfer dough back to work surface and repeat pressing and rolling technique until dough is the size of the previous larger rectangle.
', 'Step 36: Fold into thirds again, starting from the short side.
', 'Step 37: Press and roll slightly.
', 'Step 38: Transfer back to lined baking sheet.
', 'Step 39: Cover and refrigerate about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 40: Roll back out to a large rectangle.
', 'Step 41: This time, fold dough in half.
', 'Step 42: Then press and roll out into a 1/2-inch thick rectangle, using as little flour as needed to keep dough from sticking.
', 'Step 43: Cut dough in half lengthwise using a pastry wheel or pizza cutter.
', 'Step 44: Dust one piece with flour and roll out to a rectangle about 1/4 to 1/8 inch thick.
', 'Step 45: Starting from one corner, cut the dough diagonally crosswise into 8 triangles using a pastry wheel.
', 'Step 46: Starting with the bottom end of each triangle, roll each up toward the tip to form the croissant with the seam at the bottom.
', 'Step 47: If necessary, use a bit of water to seal the tip to the rolled croissant.
', 'Step 48: Repeat with the other half of the dough.
', 'Step 49: Place shaped croissants on baking sheets lined with silicone mats.
', 'Step 50: Whisk together egg and 1 tablespoon water to make the egg wash.
', 'Step 51: Brush croissants with egg wash.
', 'Step 52: Place in a warm area to allow them to rise, about 45 to 60 minutes.
', 'Step 53: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 54: Brush croissants gently but thoroughly again with egg wash.
', 'Step 55: Bake in preheated oven until beautifully browned, about 25 minutes.
', 'Step 56: Transfer to a cooling rack.
', 'Step 57: Cool to room temperature before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '531.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '50.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '107.1 mg', 'fatContent': '33.3 g', 'fiberContent': '1.6 g', 'proteinContent': '8.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '20.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '795.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '6.5 g'}

Title: French Crepes
Ingredients: ['1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon white sugar', '¼ teaspoon salt', '3 eggs', '2 cups milk', '2 tablespoons butter, melted']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Sift together flour, sugar and salt; set aside.
', 'Step 2: In a large bowl, beat eggs and milk together with an electric mixer.
', 'Step 3: Beat in flour mixture until smooth; stir in melted butter.
', 'Step 4: Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium high heat.
', 'Step 5: Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 2 tablespoons for each crepe.
', 'Step 6: Tip and rotate pan to spread batter as thinly as possible.
', 'Step 7: Brown on both sides and serve hot.
']

Title: Lemon Sorbet
Ingredients: ["1 lemon's peel, finely diced", '1 cup water', '½ cup sugar', '½ cup lemon juice', '½ cup carbonated mineral water', '6 strips of lemon zest, for garnish']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a saucepan, stir together the diced lemon peel, 1 cup of water and sugar.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium and simmer for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove from the heat, and allow to cool.
', 'Step 4: In a pitcher or bowl, stir together the lemon syrup with peel, lemon juice and mineral water.
', "Step 5: Pour into an ice cream maker, and freeze according to the manufacturer's instructions.
", 'Step 6: Garnish each serving with a twist of lemon peel.
', 'Step 7: If you do not have an ice cream maker, you may freeze it in a tall canister.
', 'Step 8: Freeze for 1 1/2 hours.
', 'Step 9: Remove and stir with a whisk.
', 'Step 10: Return to the freezer and stir about once every hour for about 4 hours.
', 'Step 11: The more times you stir, the more air will be incorporated, resulting in a lighter finished product.
']

Title: Basic Crepes
Ingredients: ['1 cup all-purpose flour', '2 eggs', '½ cup milk', '½ cup water', '¼ teaspoon salt', '2 tablespoons butter, melted']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour and the eggs.
', 'Step 2: Gradually add in the milk and water, stirring to combine.
', 'Step 3: Add the salt and butter; beat until smooth.
', 'Step 4: Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium high heat.
', 'Step 5: Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each crepe.
', 'Step 6: Tilt the pan with a circular motion so that the batter coats the surface evenly.
', 'Step 7: Cook the crepe for about 2 minutes, until the bottom is light brown.
', 'Step 8: Loosen with a spatula, turn and cook the other side.
', 'Step 9: Serve hot.
']

Title: Chicken Cordon Bleu
Ingredients: ['nonstick cooking spray', '4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '¼ teaspoon salt', '⅛ teaspoon ground black pepper', '6 slices Swiss cheese', '4 slices cooked ham', '½ cup seasoned bread crumbs']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Coat a 7x11-inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Pound chicken breasts to 1/4 inch thickness.
', 'Step 4: Sprinkle each piece of chicken on both sides with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 5: Place 1 Swiss cheese slice and 1 ham slice on top of each breast.
', 'Step 6: Roll up each breast, and secure with a toothpick.
', 'Step 7: Place in the prepared baking dish, and sprinkle chicken evenly with bread crumbs.
', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink, 30 to 35 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove from the oven, and place 1/2 Swiss cheese slice on top of each breast.
', 'Step 10: Return to the oven until cheese has melted, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Remove toothpicks and serve immediately.
']

Title: Rich and Simple French Onion Soup
Ingredients: ['½ cup unsalted butter', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '4 cups sliced onions', '5 cups beef broth', '2 tablespoons dry sherry', '1 teaspoon dried thyme', '1 pinch salt and pepper to taste', '4 slices French bread', '4 slices provolone cheese', '2 slices Swiss cheese, diced', '¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt butter with olive oil in an 8-quart stock pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add onions and continually stir until tender and translucent.
', 'Step 3: Do not brown the onions.
', 'Step 4: Add beef broth, sherry, and thyme.
', 'Step 5: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 6: Let simmer for 30 minutes.
', "Step 7: Meanwhile, preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 8: Ladle soup into oven-safe serving bowls and place one slice of bread on top of each (bread may be broken into pieces if you prefer).
', 'Step 9: Layer each slice of bread with a slice of provolone, 1/2 slice diced Swiss and 1 tablespoon Parmesan cheese.
', 'Step 10: Place bowls on a cookie sheet and broil in the preheated oven until cheese bubbles and browns slightly, 2 to 3 minutes.
']

Title: Simple Creme Brulee Dessert
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons white sugar', '1 cup heavy cream', '3 egg yolks', '¼ teaspoon vanilla extract', '2 tablespoons white sugar, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Whisk 3 tablespoons sugar and cream in a microwave-safe bowl until well combined; heat the mixture in microwave until warm, 1 to 2 minutes, and whisk again to dissolve sugar.
', 'Step 3: Whisk in egg yolks and vanilla extract until smooth.
', 'Step 4: Pour cream mixture into 2 ramekins.
', 'Step 5: Set ramekins into a roasting pan and pour in enough hot water to reach halfway up the sides of the ramekins.
', 'Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven until creme desserts are set but still slightly jiggly when shaken, about 50 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove ramekins from hot water and chill in refrigerator until cold, at least 2 hours.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of sugar evenly over the top of each dessert.
', 'Step 9: Use a kitchen torch to lightly toast and melt the sugar topping until brown and bubbly, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 10: Let the sugar topping cool before serving.
', 'Step 11: To serve, use a spoon to crack the crisp sugar open to reveal the creamy dessert underneath.
']

Title: Fondant Potatoes
Ingredients: ['3 large whole russet potatoes', '2 tablespoons high-heat-resistant vegetable oil, such as grapeseed oil', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '3 tablespoons butter', '4 sprigs thyme, plus more for garnish', '½ cup chicken broth, or more as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Cut off ends of russet potatoes.
', 'Step 3: Stand potatoes on end, and peel them from top to bottom with a sharp knife to make each potato into a uniform cylinder.
', 'Step 4: Cut each cylinder in half crosswise to make 6 potato cylinders about 2 inches long.
', 'Step 5: Place potatoes into a bowl of cold water for about 5 minutes to remove starch from the outsides; pat dry with paper towels.
', 'Step 6: Heat vegetable oil in a heavy oven-proof skillet over high heat until it shimmers slightly.
', 'Step 7: Place potato cylinders with the best-looking ends into the hot oil.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat to medium-high, and pan-fry potatoes until well-browned, 5 to 6 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Season with salt and black pepper.
', 'Step 10: Flip potatoes and repeat on the other ends.
', 'Step 11: As they cook, use a paper towel held with tongs to carefully blot out the oil from the skillet.
', 'Step 12: Add butter and thyme sprigs to the skillet.
', 'Step 13: Pick up a thyme sprig with tongs and use it to paint butter over the top of the potatoes.
', 'Step 14: Cook until butter foams and foam turns from white to a pale tan color.
', 'Step 15: Season with more salt and pepper.
', 'Step 16: Pour chicken stock into skillet.
', 'Step 17: Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and cook until potatoes are tender and creamy inside, about 30 minutes.
', "Step 18: If potatoes aren't tender, add 1/4 cup more stock and cook for 10 more minutes.
", 'Step 19: Place potatoes on a serving platter.
', 'Step 20: Spoon thyme-scented butter remaining in skillet over potatoes.
', 'Step 21: Garnish with thyme sprigs.
', 'Step 22: Let cool about 5 minutes before serving.
']

Title: Rich and Creamy Potatoes Au Gratin
Ingredients: ['3 pounds Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and very thinly sliced', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '¾ teaspoon salt', '1 cup heavy cream, divided', 'freshly ground black pepper to taste', 'freshly grated nutmeg to taste', '2 cups freshly shredded Gruyere cheese, divided']
Cooking Instructions:

', 'Step 2: Place potatoes, garlic, and salt into a large pot, fill with enough water to cover, and bring to a boil.

', 'Step 4: With a slotted spoon, transfer about half the potatoes to a 9x13-inch baking dish.

', 'Step 6: Top with the remaining potatoes; sprinkle again with black pepper and nutmeg.
', 'Step 7: Pour on the remaining cream, and sprinkle with remaining Gruyere cheese.

']

Title: The Best Lemon Vinaigrette

Title: Lobster Thermidor
Ingredients: ['1 medium (1 1/2 pound) cooked lobster', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 shallot, finely chopped', '1 ⅜ cups fresh fish stock', '¼ cup white wine', '¼ cup double cream', '½ teaspoon hot English mustard', '1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '¼ cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Cut the lobster in half lengthwise, and remove the meat from the claws and tail.
', 'Step 2: Leave to one side.
', 'Step 3: Remove any meat from the head and set aside.

', 'Step 5: Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 6: Add the shallot; cook and stir until tender.

', 'Step 14: Serve immediately.

Title: Pastry Cream
Ingredients: ['2 cups milk', '¼ cup white sugar', '2 egg yolks', '1 egg', '¼ cup cornstarch', '⅓ cup white sugar', '2 tablespoons butter', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a heavy saucepan, stir together the milk and 1/4 cup of sugar.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: In a medium bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and egg.
', 'Step 4: Stir together the remaining sugar and cornstarch; then stir them into the egg until smooth.
', 'Step 5: When the milk comes to a boil, drizzle it into the bowl in a thin stream while mixing so that you do not cook the eggs.
', "Step 6: Return the mixture to the saucepan, and slowly bring to a boil, stirring constantly so the eggs don' t curdle or scorch on the bottom.
", 'Step 7: When the mixture comes to a boil and thickens, remove from the heat.
', 'Step 8: Stir in the butter and vanilla, mixing until the butter is completely blended in.
', 'Step 9: Pour into a heat-proof container and place a piece of plastic wrap directly on the surface to prevent a skin from forming.
', 'Step 10: Refrigerate until chilled before using.
']

Title: Chicken Cordon Bleu II
Ingredients: ['6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves', '6 slices Swiss cheese', '6 slices ham', '3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon paprika', '6 tablespoons butter', '½ cup dry white wine', '1 teaspoon chicken bouillon granules', '1 tablespoon cornstarch', '1 cup heavy whipping cream']

', 'Step 2: Place a cheese and ham slice on each breast within 1/2 inch of the edges.
', 'Step 3: Fold the edges of the chicken over the filling, and secure with toothpicks.
', 'Step 4: Mix the flour and paprika in a small bowl, and coat the chicken pieces.

', 'Step 11: Serve warm.

Title: Blender Hollandaise Sauce
Ingredients: ['3 egg yolks', '¼ teaspoon Dijon mustard', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '1 dash hot pepper sauce (e.g. Tabasco™)', '½ cup butter']

['Step 1: In the container of a blender, combine the egg yolks, mustard, lemon juice and hot pepper sauce.

', 'Step 3: n Place the butter in a glass measuring cup.

']

Title: Disney's Ratatouille
Ingredients: ['1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '½ onion, chopped', '¼ cup minced garlic', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '¾ cup water', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 small eggplant, trimmed and very thinly sliced', '1 zucchini, trimmed and very thinly sliced', '1 yellow squash, trimmed and very thinly sliced', '1 red bell pepper, cored and very thinly sliced', '1 yellow bell pepper, cored and very thinly sliced', '3 tablespoons olive oil, or to taste', '1 teaspoon fresh thyme leaves, or to taste', '3 tablespoons mascarpone cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Spread tomato paste into the bottom of a 10x10-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Sprinkle with onion and garlic and stir in 1 tablespoon olive oil and water until thoroughly combined.
', 'Step 4: Season with salt and black pepper.
', 'Step 5: Arrange alternating slices of eggplant, zucchini, yellow squash, red bell pepper, and yellow bell pepper, starting at the outer edge of the dish and working concentrically towards the center.
', 'Step 6: Overlap the slices a little to display the colors.
', 'Step 7: Drizzle the vegetables with 3 tablespoons olive oil and season with salt and black pepper.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle with thyme leaves.
', 'Step 9: Cover vegetables with a piece of parchment paper cut to fit inside.
', 'Step 10: Bake in the preheated oven until vegetables are roasted and tender, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Serve with dollops of mascarpone cheese.
']

Title: Restaurant-Style French Onion Soup
Ingredients: ['½ cup butter', '8 onions, sliced', '2 cloves garlic, crushed', '½ teaspoon salt, or to taste', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste', '1 teaspoon dried thyme', '1 cup red wine', '1 tablespoon sherry', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '2 quarts beef broth', '1 French baguette, cut into 1/2-inch thick slices', 'olive oil, or as needed', '6 slices Swiss cheese', '6 slices provolone cheese']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt butter in a large soup pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir onions, garlic, salt, black pepper, and thyme until onions are soft and brown, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Pour in red wine and sherry; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat to low and simmer until you can no longer smell alcohol cooking off, about 15 more minutes.
', 'Step 5: Sprinkle onion mixture with flour and stir until coated; cook for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Pour in broth, stir to blend in flour, and simmer until slightly thickened, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) while soup is simmering.
', 'Step 8: Arrange bread slices on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil.
', 'Step 9: Toast the baguette slices in the preheated oven until golden brown, 12 to 14 minutes, turning the bread over halfway through cooking.
', 'Step 10: Remove toast and set aside.
', "Step 11: Set an oven rack about 8 inches from the heat source and turn on the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 12: Ladle soup into 6 oven-proof crocks, filling them about 3/4 full.
', 'Step 13: Place 1 or 2 bread slices into the bowls and top each with a slice of Swiss cheese and a slice of provolone.
', 'Step 14: Carefully place filled crocks onto a sturdy baking sheet.
', 'Step 15: Broil soup until the cheese is browned and bubbling, 3 to 4 minutes.
']

Title: Herbs de Provence
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons dried rosemary', '1 tablespoon fennel seed', '2 tablespoons dried savory', '2 tablespoons dried thyme', '2 tablespoons dried basil', '2 tablespoons dried marjoram', '2 tablespoons dried lavender flowers', '2 tablespoons dried Italian parsley', '1 tablespoon dried oregano', '1 tablespoon dried tarragon', '1 teaspoon bay powder']

', 'Step 2: Stir savory, thyme, basil, marjoram, lavender, parsley, oregano, tarragon, and bay powder with the rosemary and fennel.
', 'Step 3: Store in an air-tight container between uses.

Title: French Onion Soup Gratinee
Ingredients: ['4 tablespoons butter', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 large red onions, thinly sliced', '2 large sweet onions, thinly sliced', '1 (48 fluid ounce) can chicken broth', '1 (14 ounce) can beef broth', '½ cup red wine', '1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', '2 sprigs fresh parsley', '1 sprig fresh thyme leaves', '1 bay leaf', '1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '4 thick slices French or Italian bread', '8 slices Gruyere or Swiss cheese slices, room temperature', '½ cup shredded Asiago or mozzarella cheese, room temperature', '4 pinches paprika']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt butter in a large pot over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Stir in salt, red onions and sweet onions.
', 'Step 3: Cook 35 minutes, stirring frequently, until onions are caramelized and almost syrupy.
', 'Step 4: Mix chicken broth, beef broth, red wine and Worcestershire sauce into pot.
', 'Step 5: Bundle the parsley, thyme, and bay leaf with twine and place in pot.
', 'Step 6: Simmer over medium heat for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
', 'Step 7: Remove and discard the herbs.
', 'Step 8: Reduce the heat to low, mix in vinegar and season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 9: Cover and keep over low heat to stay hot while you prepare the bread.
', 'Step 10: Preheat oven broiler.
', 'Step 11: Arrange bread slices on a baking sheet and broil 3 minutes, turning once, until well toasted on both sides.
', 'Step 12: Remove from heat; do not turn off broiler.
', 'Step 13: Arrange 4 large oven safe bowls or crocks on a rimmed baking sheet.
', 'Step 14: Fill each bowl 2/3 full with hot soup.
', 'Step 15: Top each bowl with 1 slice toasted bread, 2 slices Gruyere cheese and 1/4 of the Asiago or mozzarella cheese.
', 'Step 16: Sprinkle a little bit of paprika over the top of each one.
', 'Step 17: Broil 5 minutes, or until bubbly and golden brown.
', 'Step 18: As it softens, the cheese will cascade over the sides of the crock and form a beautifully melted crusty seal.
', 'Step 19: Serve immediately!
']

Title: Macaron (French Macaroon)
Ingredients: ['3 egg whites', '¼ cup white sugar', "1 ⅔ cups confectioners' sugar", '1 cup finely ground almonds']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Line a baking sheet with a silicone baking mat.
', 'Step 2: Beat egg whites in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment until whites are foamy; beat in white sugar and continue beating until egg whites are glossy, fluffy, and hold soft peaks.
', "Step 3: Sift confectioners' sugar and ground almonds in a separate bowl and quickly fold the almond mixture into the egg whites, about 30 strokes.
", 'Step 4: Spoon a small amount of batter into a plastic bag with a small corner cut off and pipe a test disk of batter, about 1 1/2 inches in diameter, onto prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 5: If the disk of batter holds a peak instead of flattening immediately, gently fold the batter a few more times and retest.
', 'Step 6: When batter is mixed enough to flatten immediately into an even disk, spoon into a pastry bag fitted with a plain round tip.
', 'Step 7: Pipe the batter onto the baking sheet in rounds, leaving space between the disks.
', 'Step 8: Let the piped cookies stand out at room temperature until they form a hard skin on top, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 9: Preheat oven to 285 degrees F (140 degrees C).
', 'Step 10: Bake cookies until set but not browned, about 10 minutes; let cookies cool completely before filling.
']

Title: Quiche Lorraine I
Ingredients: ['1 (9 inch) prepared pie crust', '12 slices bacon', '1 cup shredded Swiss cheese', '⅓ cup minced onion', '4 eggs, beaten', '2 cups light cream', '¾ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon white sugar', '⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place bacon in a large skillet, and fry over medium-high heat until crisp.
', 'Step 3: Drain on paper towels, then chop coarsely.
', 'Step 4: Sprinkle bacon, cheese and onion into pastry shell.
', 'Step 5: In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, cream, salt, sugar and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 6: Pour mixture into pastry shell.
', 'Step 7: Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C), and bake an additional 30 minutes, or until a knife inserted 1 inch from edge comes out clean.
', 'Step 9: Allow quiche to sit 10 minutes before cutting into wedges.
']

Title: Real French Crepes
Ingredients: ['1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 egg', '2 cups milk']

['Step 1: In a mixing bowl, combine flour, egg, and milk.
', 'Step 2: Heat a large skillet or crepe pan over a medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Spray the pan with non-stick cooking spray.
', 'Step 4: Pour about 1/3 cup of batter into the pan, lift the pan and turn it by rotating your wrist, spreading a PAPER THIN amount in the pan.
', 'Step 5: Flip the crepe when it starts to bubble.
', 'Step 6: When it is finished cooking, remove it and repeat this process with the remaining batter.
']

Title: Eclairs II
Ingredients: ['½ cup butter', '1 cup water', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '¼ teaspoon salt', '4 eggs', '1 (5 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix', '2 ½ cups cold milk', '1 cup heavy cream', "¼ cup confectioners' sugar", '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '2 (1 ounce) squares semisweet chocolate', '2 tablespoons butter', "1 cup confectioners' sugar", '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '3 tablespoons hot water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease a cookie sheet.
', 'Step 3: In a medium saucepan, combine 1/2 cup butter and 1 cup water.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil, stirring until butter melts completely.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat to low, and add flour and salt.
', 'Step 6: Stir vigorously until mixture leaves the sides of the pan and begins to form a stiff ball.
', 'Step 7: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 8: Add eggs, one at a time, beating well to incorporate completely after each addition.
', 'Step 9: With a spoon or a pastry bag fitted with a No.
', 'Step 10: 10, or larger, tip, spoon or pipe dough onto cookie sheet in 1 1/2 x 4 inch strips.
', 'Step 11: Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven, then reduce heat to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) and bake 20 minutes more, until hollow sounding when lightly tapped on the bottom.
', 'Step 12: Cool completely on a wire rack.
', 'Step 13: For the filling, combine pudding mix and milk in medium bowl according to package directions.
', 'Step 14: In a separate bowl, beat the cream with an electric mixer until soft peaks form.
', "Step 15: Beat in 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla.
", 'Step 16: Fold whipped cream into pudding.
', 'Step 17: Cut tops off of cooled pastry shells with a sharp knife.
', 'Step 18: Fill shells with pudding mixture and replace tops.
', 'Step 19: For the icing, melt the chocolate and 2 tablespoons butter in a medium saucepan over low heat.
', "Step 20: Stir in 1 cup confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla.
", 'Step 21: Stir in hot water, one tablespoon at a time, until icing is smooth and has reached desired consistency.
', 'Step 22: Remove from heat, cool slightly, and drizzle over filled eclairs.
', 'Step 23: Refrigerate until serving.
']

Title: Lyonnaise Potatoes
Ingredients: ['2 pounds russet potatoes', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '4 onions, thinly sliced', '2 tablespoons chopped garlic', '½ cup butter', 'salt to taste', 'ground white pepper, to taste', '1 tablespoon finely minced fresh parsley']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Peel potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch slices.
', 'Step 3: Place sliced potatoes in a pot and cover with water.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil.
', 'Step 5: Allow to boil 2 minutes, then drain and set aside.
', 'Step 6: Heat a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 7: Pour in olive oil, then add onions.
', 'Step 8: Saute until lightly caramelized, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Stir in garlic and saute until onions are deep brown and garlic is soft.
', 'Step 10: Transfer mixture to a bowl.
', 'Step 11: Place skillet back on stove over low heat.
', 'Step 12: Melt butter, then cover bottom of pan with 1/3 of potatoes.
', 'Step 13: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 14: Cover potatoes with 1/2 of onion mixture.
', 'Step 15: Cover with 1/2 of remaining potatoes and season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 16: Spread with the rest of onion mixture.
', 'Step 17: Cover with remaining potatoes, and season with more salt and pepper.
', 'Step 18: Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 12 minutes, or until potatoes are tender and browned on top.
', 'Step 19: Remove from oven and use a spatula to carefully transfer potatoes to a serving platter.
', 'Step 20: Sprinkle with chopped parsley just before serving.
']
